  3659                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3660                                  
  3661                                  ;; M015 -- begin changes
  3662                                  ;;
  3663                                  ;; Certain old COMPAQ '286 machines have a bug in their ROM BIOS.
  3664                                  ;; When Int13 is done with AH > 15h and DL >= 80h, they trash
  3665                                  ;; the byte at DS:74h, assuming that DS points to ROM_DATA.
  3666                                  ;; If our init code detects this error, it will install this
  3667                                  ;; special Int13 hook through the same mechanism that was set
  3668                                  ;; up for the IBM patch above. This code is also dynamically
  3669                                  ;; relocated by MSINIT.
  3670                                  
  3671                                  compaq_disk_io:
  3672 0000140A 80FC15                  		cmp	ah, 15h		; compaq_disk_io proc far
  3673                                  					;
  3674                                  					; the following	label defines the end of the at	rom patch.
  3675                                  					; this is used at configuration	time.
  3676                                  					;
  3677                                  					; warning!!!
  3678                                  					; this code will be dynamically	relocated by msinit
  3679 0000140D 7705                    		ja	short mebbe_hookit ; only deal with functions > 15h
  3680                                  no_hookit:				
  3681                                  		;jmp	cs:Old13
  3682                                  		; 16/10/2022
  3683 0000140F 2EFF2E[0601]            		jmp	far [cs:Old13]
  3684                                  
  3685                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3686                                  
  3687                                  mebbe_hookit:				
  3688 00001414 80FA80                  		cmp	dl, 80h
  3689 00001417 72F6                    		jb	short no_hookit
  3690 00001419 1E                      		push	ds
  3691 0000141A 50                      		push	ax
  3692 0000141B B84000                  		mov	ax, 40h
  3693 0000141E 8ED8                    		mov	ds, ax
  3694 00001420 58                      		pop	ax
  3695 00001421 9C                      		pushf
  3696                                  		;call	cs:Old13
  3697                                  		; 16/10/2022
  3698 00001422 2EFF1E[0601]            		call	far [cs:Old13]
  3699 00001427 1F                      		pop	ds
  3700 00001428 CA0200                  		retf	2
  3701                                  
  3702                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3703                                  
  3704 0000142B 00                      end_compaq_i13hook: db 0			
  3705                                  
  3706                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  3707                                  
  3708                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.		
  3709                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
  3710                                  
  3711                                  daycnt_to_day:	; proc far
  3712                                  
  3713                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
  3714                                  ;
  3715                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
  3716                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
  3717                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
  3718                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
  3719                                  
  3720                                  		; 16/10/2022		
  3721 0000142C 2EFF36[F004]            		push	word [cs:daycnt] ; save daycnt
  3722 00001431 2E813E[F004]891C        		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 7305	; (365*20+(20/4))
  3723                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
  3724 00001438 730E                    		jnb	short century20
  3725 0000143A 2EC606[F404]13          		mov	byte [cs:base_century], 19
  3726 00001440 2EC606[F504]50          		mov	byte [cs:base_year], 80
  3727 00001446 EB13                    		jmp	short years
  3728                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3729                                  		
  3730                                  century20:				
  3731 00001448 2EC606[F404]14          		mov	byte [cs:base_century], 20
  3732 0000144E 2EC606[F504]00          		mov	byte [cs:base_year], 0
  3733 00001454 2E812E[F004]891C        		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 7305	; (365*20+(20/4))
  3734                                  					; adjust daycnt
  3735                                  years:					
  3736 0000145B 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  3737 0000145D 2EA1[F004]              		mov	ax, [cs:daycnt]
  3738 00001461 BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
  3739                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
  3740 00001464 F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
  3741 00001466 2E8916[F004]            		mov	[cs:daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
  3742 0000146B B304                    		mov	bl, 4
  3743 0000146D F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
  3744 0000146F 2E0006[F504]            		add	[cs:base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
  3745 00001474 2EFF06[F004]            		inc	word [cs:daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
  3746 00001479 2E813E[F004]6E01        		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 366	; daycnt=remainder of leap year	bk
  3747 00001480 7626                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
  3748 00001482 2EFE06[F504]            		inc	byte [cs:base_year]	; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
  3749 00001487 2E812E[F004]6E01        		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 366	; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
  3750 0000148E B90300                  		mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
  3751                                  regularyear:				
  3752 00001491 2E813E[F004]6D01        		cmp	word [cs:daycnt], 365	; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365;	i++)
  3753 00001498 7614                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
  3754 0000149A 2EFE06[F504]            		inc	byte [cs:base_year]	;   { daycnt -=	365
  3755 0000149F 2E812E[F004]6D01        		sub	word [cs:daycnt], 365	;   }
  3756 000014A6 E2E9                    		loop	regularyear	; }
  3757                                  					;
  3758                                  					; should never fall through loop
  3759                                  leapyear:				
  3760 000014A8 2EC606[F704]1D          		mov	byte [cs:month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
  3761                                  					; change month table.
  3762                                  yeardone:				
  3763 000014AE 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
  3764 000014B0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  3765 000014B2 2EA1[F004]              		mov	ax, [cs:daycnt]
  3766                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
  3767 000014B6 BE[F604]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
  3768 000014B9 B90C00                  		mov	cx, 12
  3769                                  months:					
  3770 000014BC FEC3                    		inc	bl
  3771                                  
  3772                                  		; !!! -- 16/10/2022 -- (if DS=CS, what for CS: prefixes are used !?)
  3773                                  		;mov	dl, [cs:si]
  3774                                  		; !!! -- 16/10/2022 -- (may be to keep code addrs as unchanged/fix!?)
  3775                                  		; ds = cs !? ((ofcourse ds must be same with cs here))
  3776                                  		;mov	dl, [si] ; 20/03/2019 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:14C0h)
  3777                                  		;mov	dl, [si] ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, BIOSDATA:14C0h)
  3778                                  		
  3779 000014BE 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si] ; ?	; mov dl, [cs:si]
  3780 000014C0 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
  3781                                  					; dh=0
  3782 000014C2 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
  3783 000014C4 46                      		inc	si		; next month
  3784 000014C5 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
  3785 000014C7 E2F3                    		loop	months		;
  3786                                  					; should never fall through loop
  3787                                  month_done:				
  3788 000014C9 2EC606[F704]1C          		mov	byte [cs:month_tab+1], 28
  3789                                  					; restore month table value
  3790 000014CF 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
  3791 000014D1 2E8A36[F504]            		mov	dh, [cs:base_year]
  3792 000014D6 2E8A0E[F404]            		mov	cl, [cs:base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
  3793 000014DB 2EFF1E[0205]            		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3794                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
  3795                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
  3796 000014E0 86D0                    		xchg	dl, al
  3797 000014E2 2EFF1E[0205]            		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3798                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
  3799 000014E7 86F0                    		xchg	dh, al
  3800 000014E9 2EFF1E[0205]            		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3801                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
  3802 000014EE 86C8                    		xchg	cl, al
  3803 000014F0 2EFF1E[0205]            		call	far [cs:bintobcd]
  3804                                  		;call	cs:bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
  3805 000014F5 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
  3806 000014F7 2E8F06[F004]            		pop	word [cs:daycnt] ; restore original value
  3807 000014FC CB                      		retf
  3808                                  
  3809                                  enddaycnttoday:	
  3810                                  
  3811                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  3812                                  
  3813                                  bin_to_bcd:	; proc far		; real time clock support
  3814                                  
  3815                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
  3816                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
  3817                                  		
  3818 000014FD 51                      		push	cx		
  3819 000014FE D40A                    		aam			; al=high digit	bcd, ah=low digit bc
  3820 00001500 B104                    		mov	cl, 4
  3821 00001502 D2E4                    		shl	ah, cl		; mov the high digit to	high nibble
  3822 00001504 08E0                    		or	al, ah
  3823 00001506 59                      		pop	cx
  3824 00001507 CB                      		retf
  3825                                  
  3826                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3827                                  
  3828                                  ; the k09 requires the routines for reading the clock because of the suspend/
  3829                                  ; resume facility. the system clock needs to be reset after resume.
  3830                                  
  3831                                  ; the following routine is executed at resume time when the system
  3832                                  ; powered on after suspension. it reads the real time clock and
  3833                                  ; resets the system time and date, and then irets.
  3834                                  
  3835                                  ; warning!!! this code will be dynamically relocated by msinit.
  3836                                  
  3837                                  int6c:					
  3838 00001508 0E                      		push	cs
  3839 00001509 1F                      		pop	ds
  3840 0000150A 8F06[BB06]              		pop	word [int6c_ret_addr]	; pop off return address
  3841 0000150E 8F06[BD06]              		pop	word [int6c_ret_addr+2]
  3842 00001512 9D                      		popf
  3843 00001513 E81300                  		call	read_real_date	; get the date from the clock
  3844 00001516 FA                      		cli
  3845 00001517 8936[F004]              		mov	[daycnt], si	; update dos copy of date
  3846 0000151B FB                      		sti
  3847 0000151C E8CB00                  		call	read_real_time	; get the time from the	rtc
  3848 0000151F FA                      		cli
  3849 00001520 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  3850 00001522 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  3851                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  3852                                  					; Return: time of day set
  3853 00001524 FB                      		sti
  3854                                  		;jmp	int6c_ret_addr	; long jump
  3855                                  		; 16/10/2022
  3856 00001525 FF2E[BB06]              		jmp	far [int6c_ret_addr] ; long jump
  3857                                  
  3858                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  3859                                  
  3860                                  ;   read_real_date reads real-time clock for date and returns the number
  3861                                  ;   of days elapsed since 1-1-80 in si
  3862                                  
  3863                                  read_real_date:	; proc near		
  3864 00001529 50                      		push	ax
  3865 0000152A 51                      		push	cx
  3866 0000152B 52                      		push	dx
  3867 0000152C 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; throw	away clock roll	over
  3868 0000152E CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  3869                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  3870                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  3871                                  					; midnight
  3872                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  3873 00001530 5A                      		pop	dx
  3874 00001531 59                      		pop	cx
  3875 00001532 58                      		pop	ax
  3876 00001533 50                      		push	ax
  3877 00001534 53                      		push	bx
  3878 00001535 51                      		push	cx
  3879 00001536 52                      		push	dx
  3880 00001537 2EC706[DB06]0100        		mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 1
  3881                                  					; REAL TIME CLOCK ERROR	FLAG (+1 DAY)
  3882 0000153E B404                    		mov	ah, 4
  3883 00001540 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ DATE FROM REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  3884                                  					; Return: DL = day in BCD
  3885                                  					; DH = month in	BCD
  3886                                  					; CL = year in BCD
  3887                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  3888 00001542 7303                    		jnb	short read_ok
  3889 00001544 E99300                  		jmp	r_d_ret
  3890                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3891                                  
  3892                                  read_ok:				
  3893 00001547 882E[BF06]              		mov	[bin_date_time], ch
  3894 0000154B 880E[C006]              		mov	[bin_date_time+1], cl
  3895 0000154F 8836[C106]              		mov	[bin_date_time+2], dh
  3896 00001553 8816[C206]              		mov	[bin_date_time+3], dl
  3897 00001557 2EC706[DB06]0200        		mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 2 ; READ OF R-T CLOCK SUCCESSFUL
  3898 0000155E E84201                  		call	bcd_verify	; verify bcd values in range
  3899 00001561 7277                    		jb	short r_d_ret	;  some	value out of range
  3900 00001563 2EC706[DB06]0300        		mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 3
  3901 0000156A E8E600                  		call	date_verify
  3902 0000156D 726B                    		jb	short r_d_ret
  3903 0000156F 2EC706[DB06]0000        		mov	word [cs:daycnt2], 0
  3904 00001576 E8AA00                  		call	in_bin
  3905 00001579 A0[C006]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+1]
  3906 0000157C 98                      		cbw
  3907 0000157D 803E[BF06]14            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 20 ; 20th century?
  3908 00001582 7503                    		jnz	short century_19 ; no
  3909 00001584 83C064                  		add	ax, 100		; add in a century
  3910                                  
  3911                                  century_19:				
  3912 00001587 83E850                  		sub	ax, 80		; subtract off 1-1-80
  3913 0000158A B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; leap year every 4
  3914 0000158C F6F1                    		div	cl		; al= #	leap year blocks, ah= remainder
  3915 0000158E 88E3                    		mov	bl, ah		; save odd years
  3916 00001590 98                      		cbw			; zero ah
  3917 00001591 B9B505                  		mov	cx, 1461	; 366+(3*365)
  3918                                  					; # of days in leap year blocks
  3919 00001594 F7E1                    		mul	cx
  3920 00001596 2EA3[DB06]              		mov	[cs:daycnt2], ax ; SAVE COUNT OF DAYS
  3921 0000159A 88D8                    		mov	al, bl		; get odd years	count
  3922 0000159C 98                      		cbw
  3923 0000159D 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
  3924 0000159F 740C                    		jz	short leap_year
  3925 000015A1 B96D01                  		mov	cx, 365		; days in year
  3926 000015A4 F7E1                    		mul	cx
  3927 000015A6 2E0106[DB06]            		add	[cs:daycnt2], ax ; ADD ON DAYS IN ODD YEARS
  3928 000015AB EB07                    		jmp	short leap_adjustment ;	account	for leap year
  3929                                  					; possibly account for a leap day
  3930                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3931                                  
  3932                                  leap_year:				
  3933 000015AD 803E[C106]02            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 2 ; is	month february?
  3934 000015B2 7605                    		jbe	short no_leap_adjustment ; jan or feb. no leap day yet.
  3935                                  leap_adjustment:			
  3936 000015B4 2EFF06[DB06]            		inc	word [cs:daycnt2] ; account for leap day
  3937                                  no_leap_adjustment:			
  3938 000015B9 8A0E[C206]              		mov	cl, [bin_date_time+3] ; get days of month
  3939 000015BD 30ED                    		xor	ch, ch
  3940 000015BF 49                      		dec	cx		; because of offset from day 1,	not day	0
  3941 000015C0 2E010E[DB06]            		add	[cs:daycnt2], cx ; GET DAYS IN MONTHS PRECEEDING
  3942 000015C5 8A0E[C106]              		mov	cl, [bin_date_time+2] ; get month
  3943 000015C9 30ED                    		xor	ch, ch
  3944 000015CB 49                      		dec	cx		; january starts at offset 0
  3945 000015CC D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1		; word offset
  3946 000015CE BE[C306]                		mov	si, month_table
  3947 000015D1 01CE                    		add	si, cx
  3948                                  		; 16/10/2022
  3949                                  		; ds must be same with cs here, if so..
  3950                                  		; what for cs: prefixes are used !?)
  3951                                  		; mov	ax, [cs:si]
  3952                                  		; mov	ax, [si] ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSDATA:15D5h)
  3953 000015D3 8B04                    		mov	ax, [si]	; mov ax, [cs:si]
  3954                                  					; get #	days in	previous months
  3955 000015D5 2E0106[DB06]            		add	[cs:daycnt2], ax
  3956                                  r_d_ret:				
  3957 000015DA 2E8B36[DB06]            		mov	si, [cs:daycnt2]
  3958 000015DF 5A                      		pop	dx
  3959 000015E0 59                      		pop	cx
  3960 000015E1 5B                      		pop	bx
  3961 000015E2 58                      		pop	ax
  3962 000015E3 C3                      		retn
  3963                                  
  3964                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  3965                                  
  3966                                  r_t_retj:				
  3967 000015E4 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  3968 000015E6 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  3969 000015E8 EB38                    		jmp	short r_t_ret
  3970                                  
  3971                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  3972                                  
  3973                                  ; read_real_time reads the time from the rtc. on exit, it has the number of
  3974                                  ; ticks (at 18.2 ticks per sec.) in cx:dx.
  3975                                  
  3976                                  read_real_time:	; proc near		
  3977 000015EA B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  3978 000015EC CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  3979                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  3980                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  3981                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  3982 000015EE 72F4                    		jb	short r_t_retj
  3983 000015F0 882E[BF06]              		mov	[bin_date_time], ch ; hours
  3984 000015F4 880E[C006]              		mov	[bin_date_time+1], cl ; minutes
  3985 000015F8 8836[C106]              		mov	[bin_date_time+2], dh ; seconds
  3986 000015FC C606[C206]00            		mov	byte [bin_date_time+3], 0 ; unused for time
  3987 00001601 E89F00                  		call	bcd_verify
  3988 00001604 72DE                    		jb	short r_t_retj
  3989 00001606 E88500                  		call	time_verify
  3990 00001609 72D9                    		jb	short r_t_retj
  3991 0000160B E81500                  		call	in_bin		; from bcd to bin
  3992 0000160E 8A2E[BF06]              		mov	ch, [bin_date_time]
  3993 00001612 8A0E[C006]              		mov	cl, [bin_date_time+1]
  3994 00001616 8A36[C106]              		mov	dh, [bin_date_time+2]
  3995 0000161A 8A16[C206]              		mov	dl, [bin_date_time+3]
  3996                                  		; 16/10/2022
  3997                                  		; 17/09/2022
  3998                                  		; 31/05/2019
  3999 0000161E FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks] 
  4000                                  		;call	dword ptr ttticks ; note: indirect far call
  4001                                  					; cx:dx	= number of ticks
  4002                                  					; (at 18.2 ticks per sec.)
  4003                                  r_t_ret:				
  4004 00001622 C3                      		retn
  4005                                  
  4006                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  4007                                  
  4008                                  ;   in_bin converts bin_date_time values from bcd to bin
  4009                                  
  4010                                  in_bin:		; proc near		
  4011 00001623 A0[BF06]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time] ; century or hours
  4012 00001626 E81F00                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  4013 00001629 A2[BF06]                		mov	[bin_date_time], al
  4014 0000162C A0[C006]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+1] ; years or minutes
  4015 0000162F E81600                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  4016 00001632 A2[C006]                		mov	[bin_date_time+1], al
  4017 00001635 A0[C106]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+2] ; months or seconds
  4018 00001638 E80D00                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  4019 0000163B A2[C106]                		mov	[bin_date_time+2], al
  4020 0000163E A0[C206]                		mov	al, [bin_date_time+3] ; days (not used for time)
  4021 00001641 E80400                  		call	bcd_to_bin
  4022 00001644 A2[C206]                		mov	[bin_date_time+3], al
  4023 00001647 C3                      		retn
  4024                                  
  4025                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  4026                                  
  4027                                  ;   bcd_to_bin converts two bcd nibbles in al (value <= 99.) to
  4028                                  ;   a binary representation in al
  4029                                  ;   ah is destroyed
  4030                                  
  4031                                  bcd_to_bin:	; proc near		
  4032 00001648 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  4033 0000164A 240F                    		and	al, 0Fh
  4034 0000164C B104                    		mov	cl, 4
  4035 0000164E D2EC                    		shr	ah, cl
  4036 00001650 D50A                    		aad
  4037 00001652 C3                      		retn
  4038                                  
  4039                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4040                                  
  4041                                  ;   date_verify loosely checks bcd date values to be in range
  4042                                  ;   in bin_date_time
  4043                                  
  4044                                  date_verify:	; proc near		
  4045 00001653 803E[BF06]20            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 20h ; century check
  4046 00001658 7732                    		ja	short date_error
  4047 0000165A 740E                    		jz	short century_20 ; jmp in 21th century
  4048 0000165C 803E[BF06]19            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 19h ; century check
  4049                                  		;jb	short date_error
  4050                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4051 00001661 722A                    		jb	short date_err2
  4052 00001663 803E[C006]80            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+1], 80h ; year check
  4053                                  		;jb	short date_error
  4054                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4055 00001668 7223                    		jb	short date_err2
  4056                                  century_20:				
  4057 0000166A 803E[C006]99            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+1], 99h ; year check
  4058 0000166F 771B                    		ja	short date_error
  4059 00001671 803E[C106]12            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 12h ; month check
  4060 00001676 7714                    		ja	short date_error
  4061 00001678 803E[C106]00            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 0
  4062                                  		;jbe	short date_error
  4063 0000167D 760D                    		jna	short date_error
  4064 0000167F 803E[C206]31            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+3], 31h ; day check
  4065 00001684 7706                    		ja	short date_error
  4066                                  		;cmp	byte [bin_date_time+3], 0 ; day check
  4067                                  		;;jbe	short date_error
  4068                                  		;jna	short date_error
  4069                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4070                                  		; cf=0
  4071                                  		;clc
  4072                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4073 00001686 803E[C206]01            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+3], 1 ; day check
  4074 0000168B C3                      		retn
  4075                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4076                                  
  4077                                  date_error:				
  4078 0000168C F9                      		stc
  4079                                  date_err2:
  4080 0000168D C3                      		retn
  4081                                  
  4082                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4083                                  
  4084                                  ; time_verify very loosely checks bcd date values to be in range
  4085                                  ; in bin_date_time
  4086                                  
  4087                                  time_verify:	; proc near		
  4088 0000168E 803E[BF06]24            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time], 24h ; hour check
  4089 00001693 770C                    		ja	short time_error
  4090 00001695 803E[C006]59            		cmp	byte [bin_date_time+1], 59h ; minute check
  4091 0000169A 7705                    		ja	short time_error
  4092                                  		; 12/12/2022h
  4093                                  		;cmp	byte [bin_date_time+2], 59h ; second check
  4094                                  		;ja	short time_error
  4095                                  		;clc
  4096                                  		;retn
  4097                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4098 0000169C 803E[C106]5A            		cmp	byte  [bin_date_time+2], 5Ah	
  4099                                  time_error:
  4100                                  bv_error:	
  4101 000016A1 F5                      		cmc	; cf=0 -> cf=1, cf=1 -> cf=0
  4102 000016A2 C3                      		retn
  4103                                  
  4104                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4105                                  
  4106                                  ;time_error:				
  4107                                  		;stc
  4108                                  		;retn
  4109                                  
  4110                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E ========================================
  4111                                  
  4112                                  ;   bcd_verify checks values in bin_date_time to be valid
  4113                                  ;   bcd numerals.  carry set if any nibble out of range
  4114                                  
  4115                                  bcd_verify:	; proc near		
  4116 000016A3 B90400                  		mov	cx, 4		; 4 bytes to check
  4117 000016A6 BB[BF06]                		mov	bx, bin_date_time
  4118                                  bv_loop:				
  4119 000016A9 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; get a	bcd number (0..99)
  4120 000016AB 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  4121 000016AD 250FF0                  		and	ax, 0F00Fh	; 10's place in high ah, 1's in al
  4122                                  					; is 1's place in range?
  4123 000016B0 3C0A                    		cmp	al, 10
  4124 000016B2 77ED                    		ja	short bv_error	; jmp out of range
  4125 000016B4 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  4126 000016B6 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  4127 000016B8 D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  4128 000016BA D0EC                    		shr	ah, 1
  4129 000016BC 80E40F                  		and	ah, 0Fh		; get rid of any erroneous bits
  4130 000016BF 80FC0A                  		cmp	ah, 10		; is 10's place in range
  4131 000016C2 77DD                    		ja	short bv_error	; jmp out of range
  4132 000016C4 43                      		inc	bx		; next byte
  4133 000016C5 49                      		dec	cx
  4134 000016C6 75E1                    		jnz	short bv_loop
  4135 000016C8 F8                      		clc			; set success flag
  4136 000016C9 C3                      		retn
  4137                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4138                                  
  4139                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4140                                  ;bv_error:				
  4141                                  		;stc			; set error flag
  4142                                  		;retn
  4143                                  
  4144                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4145                                  
  4146                                  endk09:
  4147                                  
  4148                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4149                                  
  4150                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4151                                  ;									:
  4152                                  ;	System initialization						:
  4153                                  ;									:
  4154                                  ;	The entry conditions are established by the bootstrap		:
  4155                                  ;	loader and are considered unknown. The following jobs		:
  4156                                  ;	will be performed by this module:				:
  4157                                  ;									:
  4158                                  ;	1.	All device initialization is performed			:
  4159                                  ;	2.	A local stack is set up and DS:SI are set		:
  4160                                  ;		to point to an initialization table. Then		:
  4161                                  ;		an inter-segment call is made to the first		:
  4162                                  ;		byte of the dos 					:
  4163                                  ;	3.	Once the dos returns from this call the ds		:
  4164                                  ;		register has been set up to point to the start		:
  4165                                  ;		of free memory. The initialization will then		:
  4166                                  ;		load the command program into this area 		:
  4167                                  ;		beginning at 100 hex and transfer control to		:
  4168                                  ;		this program.						:
  4169                                  ;									:
  4170                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4171                                  
  4172                                  ; 01/10/2022
  4173                                  ; 08/01/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  4174                                  
  4175                                  ; drvfat must be the first location of freeable space!
  4176                                  
  4177                                  ; 22/12/2022
  4178                                  align 2
  4179                                  		;db 90h
  4180                                  
  4181 000016CA 0000                    drvfat:		dw 0			; drive	and fat	id of dos
  4182 000016CC 0000                    bios_l:		dw 0			; first	sector of data (low word)
  4183 000016CE 0000                    bios_h:		dw 0			; first	sector of data (high word)
  4184 000016D0 0000                    doscnt:		dw 0			; how many sectors to read
  4185 000016D2 00                      fbigfat:	db 0			; flags	for drive
  4186 000016D3 0000                    fatloc:		dw 0			; seg addr of fat sector
  4187 000016D5 0000                    init_bootseg:	dw 0			; seg addr of buffer for reading boot record
  4188 000016D7 80                      rom_drv_num:	db 80h			; rom drive number
  4189 000016D8 0002                    md_sectorsize:	dw 200h			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4190 000016DA 0000                    temp_cluster:	dw 0			; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4191 000016DC FFFF                    last_fat_sec_num: dw 0FFFFh		; used by get_fat_sector proc.
  4192                                  
  4193                                  ; the following two bytes are used to save the info returned by int 13, ah = 8
  4194                                  ; call to determine drive parameters.
  4195                                  
  4196 000016DE 02                      num_heads:	db 2			; number of heads returned by rom
  4197 000016DF 09                      sec_trk:	db 9			; sec/trk returned by rom
  4198 000016E0 28                      num_cyln:	db 40			; number of cylinders returned by rom
  4199 000016E1 00                      fakefloppydrv:	db 0			; if 1,	then no	diskette drives	in the system.

  4280                                  		dw	512		; physical sector size in bytes
  4281                                  		db	2		; sectors/allocation unit
  4282                                  		dw	1		; reserved sectors for dos
  4283                                  		db	2		; number of allocation tables
  4284                                  		dw	112		; number of directory entries
  4285                                  		dw	720 ; 2*9*40	; number of sectors (at 512 bytes each)
  4286                                  		db	0FDh		; media descriptor
  4287                                  		dw	2		; number of fat sectors
  4288                                  		dw	9		; sectors per track
  4289                                  		dw	2		; heads
  4290                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector count (low word)
  4291                                  		dw	0		; hidden sector (high)
  4292                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (low)
  4293                                  		dw	0		; number of sectors (high)

  4418                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4419                                  
  4420                                  ;	entry point to call utility functions in Bios_Code. At this time,
  4421                                  ;	  we aren't doing any A20 switching. During MSINIT time Bios_Code
  4422                                  ;	  will not yet be moved to its final resting place, so we know
  4423                                  ;	  it'll be low.
  4424                                  ;
  4425                                  ;	to use this function, do a "push cs" and load bp with the offset of
  4426                                  ;	  the function you want to call in Bios_Code. This routine will
  4427                                  ;	  push the address of a retf in Bios_Code onto the stack which
  4428                                  ;	  will get executed when the utility function finishes. It will
  4429                                  ;	  then transfer control to Bios_Code:bp using a couple of pushes
  4430                                  ;	  and a retf
  4431                                  
  4432                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4433                                  ;BC_RETF equ bc_retf - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h
  4434                                  ; 09/12/2022
  4435                                  BC_RETF equ bc_retf
  4436                                  
  4437                                  addr_of_bcretf:	;dw 0C8h		; dw bc_retf
  4438                                  					; 2C7h:0C8h = 70h:2638h
  4439 00001763 [C800]                  		dw BC_RETF
  4440                                  
  4441                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4442                                  
  4443                                  call_bios_code:	; proc far			
  4444 00001765 2EFF36[6317]            		push	word [cs:addr_of_bcretf] 
  4445                                  					; set up near return to far return
  4446 0000176A 2EFF36[E006]            		push	word [cs:cdev+2] ; push Bios_Code segment
  4447 0000176F 55                      		push	bp		; save offset of utility function
  4448 00001770 CB                      		retf			; far jump to (DOS)BIOS code
  4449                                  
  4450                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4451                                  
  4452 00001771 00                      flp_drvs	db 0			
  4453                                  
  4454                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4455                                  
  4456                                  ; 01/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 5.0)
  4457                                  
  4458                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4459                                  ; entry point from boot sector
  4460                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4461                                  
  4462                                  init:		; 27/12/2018
  4463                                  		; MSDOS 6.0 (MSINIT.ASM)
  4464                                  		;=============================================================
  4465                                  		;
  4466                                  		; entry from boot sector. the register contents are:
  4467                                  		;
  4468                                  		;   dl = int 13 drive number we booted from
  4469                                  		;   ch = media byte
  4470                                  		;   bx = first data sector on disk.
  4471                                  		;   ax = first data sector (high)
  4472                                  		;   di = sectors/fat for the boot media.
  4473                                  
  4474                                  		; 07/04/2018
  4475                                  		;=============================================================
  4476                                  		; Retro DOS v2.0 - registers from FD Boot Sector 
  4477                                                  ; DL = [bsDriveNumber]
  4478                                  		; DH = [bsMedia]
  4479                                  		; AX = [bsSectors] ; Total sectors
  4480                                  		; DS = 0, SS = 0
  4481                                  		; BP = 7C00h
  4482                                  		
  4483 00001772 FA                      		cli
  4484                                  
  4485                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4486                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4487                                  		;push	ax
  4488                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  4489                                  		;mov	ds, ax
  4490                                  		;pop	ax
  4491                                  	
  4492                                  ; 02/10/2022
  4493                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4494                                  ; Note: Retro DOS v4.0 Kernel does not use/contain MSLOAD part of IO.SYS (5.0)
  4495                                  ; 	Because, Retro DOS v2 boot sector loads complete/entire MSDOS.SYS
  4496                                  ;	(RETRODOS.SYS) Kernel file (IO.SYS & MSDOS.SYS together).
  4497                                  ;	As result of boot sector ve init differences, Retro DOS init code (here)
  4498                                  ;	moves kernel to segment 070h at first, then sets diskette parameters
  4499                                  ;	at segment 50h (while MSDOS 5.0 boot sector sets this).
  4500                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4501                                  
  4502                                  ; msload will check the extended boot record and set ax, bx accordingly.
  4503                                  
  4504                                  ;	msload passes a 32 bit sector number hi word in ax and low in bx
  4505                                  ;	save this in cs:bios_h and cs:bios_l. this is for the start of
  4506                                  ;	data sector of the bios.
  4507                                  
  4508 00001773 2EA3[CE16]              		mov	[cs:bios_h], ax	; (start of) dos bios (IO.SYS) data sector
  4509 00001777 2E891E[CC16]            		mov	[cs:bios_l], bx
  4510                                  
  4511                                  ; with the following information from msload, we don't need the
  4512                                  ;     boot sector any more.-> this will solve the problem of 29 kb size
  4513                                  ;     limitation of msbio.com file.
  4514                                  
  4515 0000177C 0E                      		push	cs		; Save a peck of interrupt vectors...
  4516 0000177D 07                      		pop	es
  4517 0000177E 51                      		push	cx
  4518 0000177F 57                      		push	di
  4519                                  
  4520                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4521                                  		; ds = 0 (?)
  4522                                  		; 24/12/2022
  4523                                  		; ds = cs
  4524 00001780 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  4525 00001782 8ED9                    		mov	ds, cx
  4526                                  		; ds = 0
  4527                                  
  4528 00001784 B105                    		mov	cl, 5
  4529                                  		;mov	cx, 5		; NUMROMVECTORS
  4530                                  					; no. of rom vectors to	be saved
  4531                                  		;mov	si, offset RomVectors ; point to list of int vectors
  4532 00001786 BE[0001]                		mov	si, RomVectors
  4533                                  next_int_:		
  4534 00001789 2E                      		cs	; 16/10/2022
  4535 0000178A AC                      		lodsb		
  4536                                  		;lods	byte ptr cs:[si] ; cs lodsb
  4537 0000178B 98                      		cbw			; ax = interrupt number
  4538 0000178C D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1
  4539 0000178E D1E0                    		shl	ax, 1		; int no * 4
  4540 00001790 89C7                    		mov	di, ax		; interrupt vector address
  4541 00001792 87F7                    		xchg	si, di		; rombios interrupt vector address in si
  4542                                  					; saving address in di
  4543 00001794 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4544 00001795 AB                      		stosw
  4545 00001796 AD                      		lodsw			; movsw
  4546 00001797 AB                      		stosw			; save the vector
  4547 00001798 87F7                    		xchg	si, di
  4548 0000179A E2ED                    		loop	next_int_
  4549 0000179C 5F                      		pop	di
  4550 0000179D 59                      		pop	cx
  4551                                  
  4552                                  ; we need to save int13 in two places in case we are running on an at.
  4553                                  ; on ats we install the ibm supplied rom_bios patch which hooks
  4554                                  ; int13 ahead of orig13. since int19 must unhook int13 to point to the
  4555                                  ; rom int13 routine, we must have that rom address also stored away.
  4556                                  
  4557                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4558                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4559                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13], ax
  4560                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:Old13+2]
  4561                                  		;mov	[cs:Orig13+2], ax
  4562                                  
  4563                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4564 0000179E C7064C00[7407]          		mov	word [13h*4], block13
  4565                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Ch, offset	block13	; 13h*4
  4566                                  					; set up int 13	for new	action
  4567 000017A4 8C0E4E00                		mov	[13h*4+2], cs
  4568                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:4Eh, cs ; 13h*4+2
  4569 000017A8 C7065400[4808]          		mov	word [15h*4], Int15
  4570                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:54h, offset	Int15 ;	15h*4
  4571                                  					; set up int 15	for new	action
  4572 000017AE 8C0E5600                		mov	[15h*4+2], cs
  4573                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:56h, cs ; 15h*4+2
  4574 000017B2 C7066400[F907]          		mov	word [19h*4], int19
  4575                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:64h, offset	int19 ;	19h*4
  4576                                  					; set up int 19	for new	action
  4577 000017B8 8C0E6600                		mov	[19h*4+2], cs
  4578                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:66h, cs ; 19h*4+2
  4579                                  
  4580                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4581 000017BC 0E                      		push	cs
  4582 000017BD 1F                      		pop	ds
  4583                                  		
  4584 000017BE A1[0601]                		mov	ax, [Old13]	; save old13 in orig13 also
  4585 000017C1 A3[B400]                		mov	[Orig13], ax
  4586 000017C4 A1[0801]                		mov	ax, [Old13+2]
  4587 000017C7 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
  4588                                  					; ;
  4589 000017CA FB                      		sti
  4590 000017CB CD11                    		int	11h		; EQUIPMENT DETERMINATION
  4591                                  					; Return: AX = equipment flag bits
  4592                                  
  4593                                  ; we have to support a system that does not have any diskette
  4594                                  ; drives but only hardfiles. this system will ipl from the hardfile.
  4595                                  ; if the equipment flag bit 0 is 1, then the system has diskette drive(s).
  4596                                  ; otherwise, the system has only hardfiles.
  4597                                  ;
  4598                                  ; important thing is that still, for compatibility reason, the drive letter
  4599                                  ; for the hardfiles start from "c".  so, we still need to allocate dummy bds
  4600                                  ; drive a and drive b. at sysinit time, we are going to set cds table entry
  4601                                  ; of dpb pointer for these drives to 0, so any user attempt to access this
  4602                                  ; drives will get "invalid drive letter ..." message. we are going to
  4603                                  ; establish "fakefloppydrv" flag. ***sysinit module should call int 11h to
  4604                                  ; determine whether there are any diskette drivers in the system or not.!!!***
  4605                                  
  4606                                  ; check the register returned by the equipment determination interrupt
  4607                                  ; we have to handle the case of no diskettes in the system by faking
  4608                                  ; two dummy drives.
  4609                                  ;
  4610                                  ; if the register indicates that we do have floppy drives we don't need
  4611                                  ; to do anything special.
  4612                                  ;
  4613                                  ; if the register indicates that we don't have any floppy drives then
  4614                                  ; what we need to do is set the fakefloppydrv variable, change the
  4615                                  ; register to say that we do have floppy drives and then go to execute
  4616                                  ; the code which starts at notsingle. this is because we can skip the
  4617                                  ; code given below which tries to find if there are one or two drives
  4618                                  ; since we already know about this.
  4619                                  
  4620                                  		; 12/12/2022
  4621 000017CD A801                    		test	al, 1
  4622                                  		;test	ax, 1		; floppy drives	present	?
  4623 000017CF 752C                    		jnz	short normalfloppydrv ;	yes.
  4624                                  
  4625                                  ; Some ROM BIOSs lie that there are no floppy drives. Lets find out
  4626                                  ; whether it is an old ROM BIOS or a new one
  4627                                  ;
  4628                                  ; WARNING !!!
  4629                                  ;
  4630                                  ; This sequence of code is present in SYSINIT1.ASM also. Any modification
  4631                                  ; here will require an equivalent modification in SYSINIT1.ASM also
  4632                                  
  4633 000017D1 50                      		push	ax
  4634 000017D2 53                      		push	bx
  4635 000017D3 51                      		push	cx
  4636 000017D4 52                      		push	dx
  4637 000017D5 57                      		push	di
  4638 000017D6 06                      		push	es
  4639 000017D7 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  4640 000017D9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  4641 000017DB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  4642                                  					; DL = drive number
  4643                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  4644                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  4645                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  4646 000017DD 7204                    		jb	short _gdskp_error
  4647                                  		;mov	[cs:flp_drvs], dl
  4648                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4649                                  		; ds = cs
  4650 000017DF 8816[7117]              		mov	[flp_drvs], dl
  4651                                  _gdskp_error:				
  4652 000017E3 07                      		pop	es
  4653 000017E4 5F                      		pop	di
  4654 000017E5 5A                      		pop	dx
  4655 000017E6 59                      		pop	cx
  4656 000017E7 5B                      		pop	bx
  4657 000017E8 58                      		pop	ax
  4658 000017E9 7212                    		jb	short normalfloppydrv
  4659                                  					; if error it is an old ROM BIOS
  4660                                  					; so, lets assume that ROM BIOS lied
  4661                                  
  4662                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4663                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:flp_drvs], 0 ; number of drvs == 0?
  4664                                  		;jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4665                                  		;mov	al, [cs:flp_drvs]
  4666 000017EB A0[7117]                		mov	al, [flp_drvs]
  4667 000017EE 08C0                    		or	al, al		; number of drvs == 0?
  4668 000017F0 7403                    		jz	short _set_fake_flpdrv
  4669                                  
  4670                                  		;dec	al		; make it zero based
  4671                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4672 000017F2 48                      		dec	ax
  4673 000017F3 EB0C                    		jmp	short got_num_flp_drvs
  4674                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4675                                  
  4676                                  _set_fake_flpdrv:
  4677                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4678 000017F5 B80100                  		mov	ax, 1			
  4679 000017F8 A2[E116]                		mov	[fakefloppydrv], al ; 1
  4680                                  		;mov	byte [cs:fakefloppydrv], 1
  4681                                  		;			; we don't have any floppy drives.
  4682                                  		;mov	ax, 1
  4683 000017FB EB09                    		jmp	short settwodrive ; well then set it for two drives!
  4684                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4685                                  
  4686                                  normalfloppydrv:			; yes, bit 0 is 1.			
  4687 000017FD D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; there	exist floppy drives.
  4688 000017FF D0C0                    		rol	al, 1		; put bits 6 & 7 into bits 0 & 1
  4689                                  got_num_flp_drvs:			
  4690                                  		;and	ax, 3		; only look at bits 0 &	1
  4691                                  		; 18/12/2022
  4692 00001801 2403                    		and	al, 3
  4693 00001803 7505                    		jnz	short notsingle	; zero means single drive system
  4694 00001805 40                      		inc	ax		; pretend it's a two drive system
  4695                                  settwodrive:				; set this to two fakedrives
  4696                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4697                                  		; ds = cs
  4698 00001806 FE06[7800]              		inc	byte [single]
  4699                                  		;inc	byte [cs:single] ; remember this
  4700                                  notsingle:				
  4701 0000180A 40                      		inc	ax		; ax has number	of drives, 2-4
  4702                                  					; is also 0 indexed boot drive if we
  4703                                  					; booted off hard file
  4704 0000180B 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; ch is	fat id,	cl # floppies
  4705                                  
  4706                                  ; 16/10/2022
  4707                                  ; MSDOS 3.3 - "MSEQU.INC" (24/07/1987)
  4708                                  INITSPOT EQU	534h	; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4709                                  BRKADR	 EQU	1BH * 4	; 6CH, 1BH break vector address
  4710                                  TIMADR	EQU	1CH * 4	; 70H, 1CH timer interrupt
  4711                                  DSKADR	EQU	1EH * 4	; address of ptr to disk parameters
  4712                                  SEC9	EQU	522h	; address of disk parameters
  4713                                  CHROUT	EQU	29h
  4714                                  LSTDRV	EQU     504h
  4715                                  
  4716                                  ; determine whether we booted from floppy or hard disk...
  4717                                  
  4718 0000180D F6C280                  		test	dl, 80h		; boot from floppy ?
  4719 00001810 7502                    		jnz	short gothrd	; no.
  4720 00001812 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; indicate boot	from drive a
  4721                                  gothrd:					
  4722 00001814 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; ax = 0-based drive we	booted from
  4723                                  					; bios_l, bios_h set.
  4724                                  					; cl = number of floppies including fake one
  4725                                  					; ch = media byte
  4726 00001816 FA                      		cli
  4727 00001817 8ED2                    		mov	ss, dx		; set stack segment and stack pointer
  4728 00001819 BC0007                  		mov	sp, 700h
  4729 0000181C FB                      		sti
  4730 0000181D 51                      		push	cx ; *		; save number of floppies and media byte
  4731 0000181E 88EC                    		mov	ah, ch		; FAT ID to AH
  4732 00001820 50                      		push	ax ; **		; save boot drive number and media byte
  4733                                  		
  4734                                  ; let model_byte, secondary_model_byte be set here!!!
  4735                                  
  4736 00001821 B4C0                    		mov	ah, 0C0h
  4737 00001823 CD15                    		int	15h		; SYSTEM - GET CONFIGURATION (XT after 1/10/86,AT mdl 3x9,CONV,XT286,PS)
  4738 00001825 7215                    		jb	short no_rom_system_conf ; just	use Model_Byte
  4739 00001827 80FC00                  		cmp	ah, 0
  4740 0000182A 7510                    		jnz	short no_rom_system_conf
  4741                                  
  4742                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4743                                  		; ds = cs
  4744 0000182C 268A4702                		mov	al, [es:bx+2]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_modelbyte]
  4745 00001830 A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4746                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al
  4747                                  					; get/save model byte
  4748 00001833 268A4703                		mov	al, [es:bx+3]	; [es:bx+ROMBIOS_DESC.bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte]

  4750                                  		;mov	[cs:secondary_model_byte], al
  4751                                  					; get/save secondary model byte
  4752 0000183A EB0C                    		jmp	short turn_timer_on
  4753                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  4754                                  
  4755                                  no_rom_system_conf:			
  4756 0000183C BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh
  4757 0000183F 8EC6                    		mov	es, si
  4758                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4759 00001841 26A00E00                		mov	al, [es:0Eh]	; get model byte (from 0FFFFh:0Eh)
  4760 00001845 A2[3E06]                		mov	[model_byte], al
  4761                                  		;mov	[cs:model_byte], al ; save model byte
  4762                                  turn_timer_on:				
  4763 00001848 B020                    		mov	al, 20h	; ' '   ; turn on the timer
  4764 0000184A E620                    		out	20h, al		; Interrupt controller,	8259A.
  4765                                  					; AKPORT
  4766                                  
  4767                                  ; some olivetti m24 machines have an 8530 serial communications
  4768                                  ; chip installed at io address 50h and 52h. if we're running
  4769                                  ; on one of those, we must inhibit the normal aux port initialization
  4770                                  
  4771                                  		; 21/12/2022
  4772                                  		; ds = cs
  4773 0000184C 803E[3E06]00            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0
  4774                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0 ; next to last	byte in	rom bios
  4775 00001851 7510                    		jnz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; skip for all other machines
  4776                                  					; (except olivetti m24)
  4777 00001853 E466                    		in	al, 66h		; is 8530 installed?
  4778 00001855 A820                    		test	al, 20h
  4779 00001857 740A                    		jz	short not_olivetti_m24 ; we're done if not
  4780 00001859 B00F                    		mov	al, 0Fh		; double check
  4781 0000185B E650                    		out	50h, al
  4782 0000185D E450                    		in	al, 50h
  4783 0000185F A801                    		test	al, 1		; this test was	copied from olivetti
  4784 00001861 7414                    		jz	short skip_aux_port_init ; take	this branch if 8530 installed
  4785                                  
  4786                                  not_olivetti_m24:			
  4787 00001863 B003                    		mov	al, 3		; init com4
  4788 00001865 E8C308                  		call	aux_init
  4789 00001868 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init com3
  4790 0000186A E8BE08                  		call	aux_init
  4791 0000186D B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init com2
  4792 0000186F E8B908                  		call	aux_init
  4793 00001872 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init com1
  4794 00001874 E8B408                  		call	aux_init
  4795                                  
  4796                                  skip_aux_port_init:			
  4797 00001877 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; init lpt3
  4798 00001879 E8A708                  		call	print_init
  4799 0000187C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; init lpt2
  4800 0000187E E8A208                  		call	print_init
  4801 00001881 30C0                    		xor	al, al		; init lpt1
  4802 00001883 E89D08                  		call	print_init
  4803                                  		
  4804 00001886 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx ; 0
  4805 00001888 8EDA                    		mov	ds, dx		; to initialize	print screen vector
  4806 0000188A 8EC2                    		mov	es, dx
  4807 0000188C 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  4808                                  		; 16/10/2022
  4809 0000188E BF3405                  		mov	di, INITSPOT	; 0534h
  4810                                  		;mov	di, 534h	; INITSPOT (0000h:0534h)
  4811                                  					; IBM wants 4 zeros here
  4812 00001891 AB                      		stosw
  4813 00001892 AB                      		stosw
  4814 00001893 8CC8                    		mov	ax, cs		; fetch	segment
  4815 00001895 C7066C00[EE06]          		mov	word [BRKADR], cbreak
  4816                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:6Ch, offset	cbreak ; [BRKADR]
  4817                                  					; break	entry point
  4818 0000189B A36E00                  		mov	[BRKADR+2], ax		
  4819                                  		;mov	ds:6Eh,	ax	; vector for break
  4820 0000189E C706A400[6207]          		mov	word [CHROUT*4], outchr
  4821                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:0A4h, offset outchr	; [CHROUT*4]
  4822 000018A4 A3A600                  		mov	[CHROUT*4+2], ax
  4823                                  		;mov	ds:0A6h, ax	; [CHROUT*4+2]
  4824 000018A7 BF0400                  		mov	di, 4
  4825 000018AA BB[F406]                		mov	bx, intret ; 19/10/2022
  4826                                  		;mov	bx, offset intret ; intret (cs:intret)
  4827                                  					; will initialize rest of interrupts
  4828 000018AD 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  4829 000018AE AB                      		stosw			; location 4
  4830 000018AF 93                      		xchg	ax, bx		; cs:
  4831 000018B0 AB                      		stosw			; int 1	; location 6
  4832 000018B1 83C704                  		add	di, 4
  4833 000018B4 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  4834 000018B5 AB                      		stosw			; location 12
  4835 000018B6 93                      		xchg	ax, bx		; cs:
  4836 000018B7 AB                      		stosw			; int 3	; location 14
  4837 000018B8 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
  4838 000018B9 AB                      		stosw			; location 16
  4839 000018BA 93                      		xchg	ax, bx		; cs:
  4840 000018BB AB                      		stosw			; int 4	; location 18
  4841 000018BC 89160005                		mov	[0500h], dx
  4842                                  		;mov	ds:500h, dx	; set print screen & break = 0
  4843 000018C0 89160405                		mov	[LSTDRV], dx	; [0504h]
  4844                                  		;mov	ds:504h, dx	; clean	out last drive spec
  4845                                  
  4846                                  ; we need to initalize the cs:motorstartup variable from the disk
  4847                                  ; parameter table at sec9. the offsets in this table are defined in
  4848                                  ; the disk_parms struc in msdskprm.inc. 2 locs

  5077                                  ;

  5097                                  ; check to see if we are faking floppy drives. if not we don't
  5098                                  ; do anything special. if we are faking floppy drives we need
  5099                                  ; to set aside two bdss for the two fake floppy drives. we
  5100                                  ; don't need to initalise any fields though. so starting at start_bds
  5101                                  ; use the link field in the bds structure to go to the second bds
  5102                                  ; in the list and initalise it's link field to -1 to set the end of
  5103                                  ; the list. then jump to the routine at dohard to allocate/initialise
  5104                                  ; the bds for harddrives.

  5404                                  ;		as usual and then rescan the bds chain to adjust the  drive
  5405                                  ;		letters. to do this, scan for disk drives and assign logical
  5406                                  ;		drive number starting from 2 and then rescan diskette drives
  5407                                  ;		and assign next to the last logical drive number of last disk

  5421                                  ;we now decide, based on the configurations available so far, what
  5422                                  ;code or data we need to keep as a stay resident code. the following table

  5424                                  ;of their current position memory.

  5426                                  ;configuration will be done in two ways:
  5427                                  ;
  5428                                  ;first, we are going to set "static configuration". static configuration will
  5429                                  ;consider from basic configuration to endof96tpi configuration. the result
  5430                                  ;of static configuration will be the address the dynamic configuration will
  5431                                  ;use to start with.
  5432                                  ;
  5433                                  ;secondly, "dynamic cofiguration" will be performed. dynamic configuration
  5434                                  ;involves possible relocation of code or data. dynamic configuration routine
  5435                                  ;will take care of bdsm tables and at rom fix module thru k09 suspend/resume
  5436                                  ;code individually. after these operation, [dosdatasg] will be set.
  5437                                  ;this will be the place sysinit routine will relocate msdos module for good.
  5438

  5508                                  ; M065 -- begin changes
  5509                                  ;
  5510                                  ; On certain systems with Western Digital disk controllers, the
  5511                                  ; following detection scheme caused an unpredictable and serious
  5512                                  ; failure. In particular, they've implemented a nonstandard
  5513                                  ; Int13(ah=16h) which reconfigures the hard drive, depending on
  5514                                  ; what happens to be at es:[bx] and other memory locations indexed
  5515                                  ; off of it.
  5516                                  ;
  5517                                  ; Compaq was unable to tell us exactly which kind of systems have
  5518                                  ; the bug, except that they guarantee that the bug was fixed in
  5519                                  ; ROM BIOSs dated 08/04/86 and later. We'll check for the COMPAQ
  5520                                  ; string, and then look for date codes before 08/04/86 to decide
  5521                                  ; when to install the hook.
