  9002                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
  9003 00000386 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
  9004                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9005                                  		; cf=0 (if [uaxnum] is valid number) 
  9006 0000038A C3                      		retn
  9007                                  
  9008                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9009                                  
  9010                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9011                                  
  9012                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9013                                  ;								:
  9014                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
  9015                                  ;								:
  9016                                  ;								:
  9017                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
  9018                                  ;								:
  9019                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
  9020                                  ;								:
  9021                                  ;	routine 		function			:
  9022                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
  9023                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
  9024                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
  9025                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
  9026                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
  9027                                  ;								:
  9028                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
  9029                                  ;								:
  9030                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
  9031                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
  9032                                  ;								:
  9033                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
  9034                                  
  9035                                  ; convert time to ticks
  9036                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
  9037                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
  9038                                  
  9039                                  ;19/07/2019
  9040                                  ;09/03/2019
  9041                                  
  9042                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
  9043                                  
  9044                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
  9045                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
  9046                                  
  9047 0000038B B03C                    		mov	al, 60
  9048 0000038D F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
  9049 0000038F B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9050 00000391 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
  9051 00000393 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
  9052 00000396 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
  9053 00000398 F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
  9054 0000039A 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
  9055 0000039C B064                    		mov	al, 100
  9056 0000039E F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
  9057 000003A0 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
  9058 000003A2 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
  9059 000003A5 B700                    		mov	bh, 0
  9060 000003A7 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
  9061 000003A9 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9062                                  
  9063                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
  9064                                  
  9065 000003AC 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9066 000003AD 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
  9067 000003AE BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
  9068 000003B1 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
  9069 000003B3 87D1                    		xchg	dx, cx
  9070 000003B5 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
  9071 000003B6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
  9072 000003B8 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
  9073 000003BA 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
  9074 000003BD 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
  9075 000003BE BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
  9076 000003C1 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
  9077 000003C3 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
  9078 000003C5 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
  9079 000003C7 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
  9080 000003C9 98                      		cbw
  9081 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
  9082 000003CB F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
  9083 000003CD 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
  9084 000003CF CB                      		retf			; far return
  9085                                  
  9086                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9087                                  
  9088                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9089                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9090                                  
  9091                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9092                                  ;
  9093                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
  9094                                  ;
  9095                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
  9096                                  ;
  9097                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
  9098                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
  9099                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
  9100                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
  9101                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
  9102                                  ;
  9103                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
  9104                                  ;
  9105                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9106                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9107                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9108                                  ;
  9109                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
  9110                                  
  9111                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
  9112 000003D0 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
  9113 000003D3 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
  9114                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
  9115 000003D4 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9116                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9117 000003D9 7426                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
  9118 000003DB 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
  9119                                  					; get binary hours
  9120                                  					; convert to bcd
  9121 000003DF FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9122                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
  9123 000003E3 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
  9124 000003E5 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
  9125 000003E9 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9126                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
  9127 000003ED 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
  9128 000003EF 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
  9129 000003F3 FF1E[0205]              		call	far [bintobcd]
  9130                                  		;call	ds:bintobcd
  9131 000003F7 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
  9132 000003F9 B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
  9133 000003FB FA                      		cli
  9134 000003FC B403                    		mov	ah, 3
  9135 000003FE CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9136                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
  9137                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
  9138                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9139 00000400 FB                      		sti
  9140                                  no_cmos_1:				
  9141 00000401 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
  9142 00000405 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
  9143                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9144 00000409 FF1E[E206]              		call	far [ttticks]
  9145                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
  9146                                  					; convert time to ticks
  9147                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
  9148 0000040D FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
  9149 0000040E B401                    		mov	ah, 1
  9150 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
  9151                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
  9152                                  					; Return: time of day set
  9153                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
  9154 00000412 8F06[F004]              		pop	word [daycnt]
  9155 00000416 FB                      		sti
  9156                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
  9157 00000417 803E[F304]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
  9158 0000041C 740A                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
  9159 0000041E FF1E[0605]              		call	far [daycnttoday]
  9160                                  		;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
  9161                                  					; convert to bcd format
  9162 00000422 FA                      		cli
  9163 00000423 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
  9164 00000425 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9165                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
  9166                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
  9167                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
  9168 00000427 FB                      		sti
  9169                                  no_cmos_2:
  9170                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9171                                  		; cf=0				
  9172                                  		;clc
  9173 00000428 C3                      		retn
  9174                                  
  9175                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9176                                  
  9177                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9178                                  
  9179                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9180                                  ; gettime reads date and time
  9181                                  ; and returns the following information:
  9182                                  ;
  9183                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
  9184                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
  9185                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
  9186                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
  9187                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
  9188                                  ;
  9189                                  ;	NOTE:  Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
  9190                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
  9191                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
  9192                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9193                                  
  9194                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
  9195 00000429 E84E00                  		call	GetTickCnt
  9196 0000042C 8B36[F004]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
  9197                                  
  9198                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
  9199                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
  9200                                  ;
  9201                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
  9202                                  ;	       ----------------
  9203                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
  9204                                  ;
  9205                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
  9206                                  ;
  9207                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
  9208                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9209                                  ;		1,193,180
  9210                                  ;
  9211                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
  9212                                  ;
  9213                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
  9214                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
  9215                                  ;		59,659
  9216                                  ;
  9217                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
  9218                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
  9219                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
  9220                                  ;
  9221                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
  9222                                  ; multiply by 5
  9223                                  
  9224 00000430 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
  9225 00000432 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
  9226                                  					; multiply by 5
  9227 00000434 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9228 00000436 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
  9229 00000438 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
  9230 0000043A D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
  9231 0000043C 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
  9232 0000043E 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
  9233 00000440 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
  9234                                  
  9235                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
  9236                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
  9237                                  
  9238 00000441 B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
  9239 00000444 F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
  9240                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
  9241 00000446 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
  9242 00000448 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
  9243 0000044A F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
  9244                                  
  9245                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
  9246                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
  9247                                  
  9248 0000044C 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
  9249 0000044E B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		;extract 1/100's
  9250                                  
  9251                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
  9252                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
  9253                                  
  9254 00000451 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9255 00000453 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
  9256 00000456 7203                    		jb	short noadj
  9257 00000458 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
  9258                                  noadj:					
  9259 0000045B F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
  9260 0000045C 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
  9261                                  
  9262                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
  9263                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
  9264                                  
  9265 0000045E D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
  9266 00000460 B200                    		mov	dl, 0
  9267 00000462 D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
  9268 00000464 B93C00                  		mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
  9269 00000467 F7F1                    		div	cx
  9270 00000469 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
  9271 0000046B F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
  9272 0000046D 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah
  9273                                  
  9274                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
  9275                                  
  9276 0000046F 50                      		push	ax
  9277 00000470 89F0                    		mov	ax, si		; daycnt
  9278 00000472 AB                      		stosw
  9279 00000473 58                      		pop	ax
  9280 00000474 AB                      		stosw
  9281 00000475 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
  9282 00000477 AB                      		stosw
  9283 00000478 F8                      		clc
  9284 00000479 C3                      		retn
  9285                                  
  9286                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9287                                  
  9288                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9289                                  
  9290                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9291                                  ;
  9292                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
  9293                                  ;
  9294                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
  9295                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
  9296                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
  9297                                  ;
  9298                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
  9299                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
  9300                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
  9301                                  ;			else
  9302                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
  9303                                  ;		}
  9304                                  ;
  9305                                  ; USES : AX
  9306                                  ;
  9307                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
  9308                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
  9309                                  ;
  9310                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9311                                  
  9312                                  		; 17/10/2022
  9313                                  GetTickCnt:	
  9314 0000047A 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
  9315 0000047C CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
  9316                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
  9317                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
  9318                                  					; midnight
  9319                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
  9320 0000047E 803E[F204]00            		cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
  9321 00000483 7507                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes  that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
  9322 00000485 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
  9323                                  					; and not flag
  9324 00000487 0106[F004]              		add	[daycnt], ax
  9325 0000048B C3                      		retn
  9326                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9327                                  
  9328                                  inc_case:				
  9329 0000048C 08C0                    		or	al, al
  9330 0000048E 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
  9331 00000490 FF06[F004]              		inc	word [daycnt]
  9332                                  no_rollover:				
  9333 00000494 C3                      		retn
  9334                                  
  9335                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9336                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
  9337                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9338                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
  9339                                  ; 09/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9340                                  
  9341                                  ; MSDISK.ASM - MSDOS 3.3 - 02/02/1988
  9342                                  ; 26/05/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9343                                  ; 23/03/2018 - Retro DOS v2.0
  9344

  9346                                  
  9347                                  ;struc BPB_TYPE
  9348                                  ;.SECSIZE:	resw 1
  9349                                  ;.SECALL:	resb 1
  9350                                  ;.RESNUM:	resw 1
  9351                                  ;.FATNUM:	resb 1
  9352                                  ;.DIRNUM:	resw 1
  9353                                  ;.SECNUM:	resw 1
  9354                                  ;.FATID:	resb 1
  9355                                  ;.FATSIZE:	resw 1
  9356                                  ;.SLIM:		resw 1
  9357                                  ;.HLIM:		resw 1
  9358                                  ;.HIDDEN:	resw 1
  9359                                  ;.size:
  9360                                  ;endstruc
  9361                                  
  9362                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9363                                  ;	disk interface routines
  9364                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9365                                  
  9366                                  ; device attribute bits:
  9367                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
  9368                                  
  9369                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
  9370                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
  9371                                  
  9372                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
  9373                                  
  9374                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
  9375                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
  9376                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
  9377                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
  9378                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
  9379                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
  9380                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
  9381                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
  9382                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
  9383                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
  9384                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
  9385                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
  9386                                  ; we reset the counter.
  9387                                  
  9388                                  accessmax	equ	5
  9389                                  
  9390                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
  9391                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
  9392                                  ;
  9393                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
  9394                                  ;   if it is 0, then
  9395                                  ;	set slow = 15
  9396                                  ;   else
  9397                                  ;	set slow = value
  9398                                  ;   ...
  9399                                  ;*********************************************
  9400                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
  9401                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
  9402                                  ;*	 use slow
  9403                                  ;*   else
  9404                                  ;*	 use fast
  9405                                  ;*********************************************
  9406                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
  9407                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
  9408                                  ;	use slow
  9409                                  ;   else
  9410                                  ;	use fast
  9411                                  ;   ...
  9412                                  ;   restore current head settle value
  9413                                  ;
  9414                                  ;
  9415                                  ;---------------------------------------
  9416                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
  9417                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
  9418                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
  9419                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
  9420                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
  9421                                  
  9422                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
  9423                                  
  9424                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9425                                  
  9426                                  ; BIOSCODE:04A2h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
  9427

  9429                                  ;	command jump table
  9430                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
  9431                                  
  9432 00000495 00                      		db 0
  9433

  9436

  9450                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9452                                  		dw 80Ah			; dsk_open
  9453                                  		dw 81Ah			; dsk_close
  9454                                  		dw 831h			; dsk_rem
  9455                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9456                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9457                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9458                                  		dw 0C6Bh		; do_generic_ioctl
  9459                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear
  9460                                  		dw 558h			; ret_carry_clear

  9500                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9501                                  
  9502                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9503                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
  9504                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
  9505                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]
  9506                                  ;
  9507                                  ;  AL contains the logical drive number.
  9508                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9509                                  
  9510                                  SetDrive:	
  9511                                  		;les	di, ds:start_bds ; Point es:di to first bds	
  9512 000004CB C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; 19/10/2022
  9513                                  X_Scan_Loop:				
  9514 000004CF 26384505                		cmp	[es:di+5], al	
  9515 000004D3 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv
  9516 000004D5 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link] ; Go	to next	bds
  9517 000004D8 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
  9518 000004DB 75F2                    		jnz	short X_Scan_Loop
  9519 000004DD F9                      		stc
  9520                                  X_SetDrv:				
  9521 000004DE C3                      		retn
  9522                                  
  9523                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9524                                  
  9525                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9526                                  
  9527                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9528                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
  9529                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
  9530                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
  9531                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
  9532                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
  9533                                  
  9534                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh
  9535 000004DF E8E9FF                  		call	SetDrive
  9536 000004E2 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1
  9537 000004E5 26F6452401              		test	byte [es:di+24h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags+1]
  9538                                  					; fchanged_by_format
  9539 000004EA 7416                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
  9540                                  		; 12/12/2022
  9541 000004EC 26806524FE              		and	byte [es:di+24h], 0FEh ; ~fchanged_by_format
  9542                                  		;and	word [es:di+23h], 0FEFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9543                                  					; ~fchanged_by_format ;	reset flag
  9544 000004F1 C606[1E01]FF            		mov	byte [tim_drv], 0FFh ; -1
  9545                                  					; Ensure that we ask the rom if media has changed
  9546 000004F6 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
  9547                                  					; fnon_removable
  9548 000004FB 740C                    		jz	short wehaveafloppy
  9549 000004FD BEFFFF                  		mov	si, 0FFFFh	; Indicate media changed
  9550 00000500 EB2C                    		jmp	short Media_Done ; Media_Done
  9551                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9552                                  
  9553                                  WeAreNotFakingIt:
  9554                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], fnon_removable			
  9555 00000502 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
  9556 00000507 7525                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9557                                  wehaveafloppy:				
  9558 00000509 31F6                    		xor	si, si		; Presume "I don't know"
  9559                                  
  9560                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
  9561                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
  9562                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.
  9563                                  
  9564 0000050B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; Do we	have changeline	support?
  9565 00000510 740A                    		jz	short mChk_NoChangeLine	; Brif not
  9566 00000512 E87912                  		call	mediacheck	;  Call	into removable routine
  9567 00000515 7236                    		jb	short err_exitj
  9568 00000517 E8C913                  		call	haschange
  9569 0000051A 7512                    		jnz	short Media_Done
  9570                                  mChk_NoChangeLine:
  9571                                  		; If we come here, we have a floppy with no changeline support
  9572                                  			
  9573 0000051C BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; Presume no change
  9574 0000051F A0[1E01]                		mov	al, [tim_drv]	; Last drive accessed
  9575 00000522 263A4504                		cmp	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
  9576                                  					; Is drive of last access the same?
  9577 00000526 7505                    		jnz	short Media_Unk	; No, then "i don't know"
  9578 00000528 E82800                  		call	Check_Time_Of_Access
  9579 0000052B EB01                    		jmp	short Media_Done

  9584

  9586                                  		; Clean up the left overs
  9587                                  Media_Done:

  9592 00000537 07                      		pop	es
  9593 00000538 09F6                    		or	si, si
  9594 0000053A 790F                    		jns	short ret_carry_clear ;	volidok
  9595 0000053C 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
  9596 00000541 7403                    		jz	short mChk1_NoChangeLine ; Brif	no changeline support
  9597 00000543 E82F13                  		call	media_set_vid
  9598                                  mChk1_NoChangeLine:

  9600                                  					; Make sure we ask rom for media check
  9601                                  ret_carry_clear:

  9605                                  
  9606                                  err_exitj:				
  9607 0000054D E87D06                  		call	maperror	; guaranteed to	set carry
  9608                                  ret81:					
  9609 00000550 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; return error status
  9610 00000552 C3                      		retn			; return with carry set
  9611                                  
  9612                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9613                                  
  9614                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9615                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
  9616                                  ; drive.
  9617                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
  9618                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
  9619                                  ; returns in si:
  9620                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
  9621                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
  9622                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
  9623                                  ;
  9624                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
  9625                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9626                                  
  9627                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9628                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
  9629 00000553 BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
  9630 00000556 E821FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
  9631 00000559 268B4547                		mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
  9632                                  					; get stored time
  9633 0000055D 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
  9634 0000055F 268B4549                		mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
  9635 00000563 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
  9636 00000565 751A                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
  9637 00000567 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
  9638 00000569 7511                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
  9639 0000056B FE06[1D01]              		inc	byte [accesscount]
  9640 0000056F 803E[1D01]05            		cmp	byte [accesscount], 5 
  9641                                  					; if count is less than threshold, ok
  9642 00000574 720C                    		jb	short timecheck_ret
  9643 00000576 FE0E[1D01]              		dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
  9644 0000057A EB05                    		jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
  9645                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9646                                  
  9647                                  timepassed:				
  9648 0000057C 83FA24                  		cmp	dx, 36		; 18*2 ; 18.2 tics per second.
  9649                                  					; min elapsed time? (2 seconds)
  9650 0000057F 7601                    		jbe	short timecheck_ret ; yes, presume no change
  9651                                  
  9652                                  		; everything indicates that we do not know what has happened.
  9653                                  timecheck_unk:				
  9654 00000581 4E                      		dec	si		; presume i don't know
  9655                                  timecheck_ret:				
  9656 00000582 C3                      		retn
  9657                                  
  9658                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9659                                  ; 15/10/2022

  9733                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------
  9734                                  ; clear ids in bds table. only applied for floppies.

  9770                                  		
  9771                                  		; 11/09/2023 (BugFix, DI is not start addr of BDS structure here)
  9772                                  		;;test	byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbig
  9773                                  		; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh)
  9774                                  		;test	byte [es:di+1Fh], 40h
  9775                                  
  9776                                  			; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
  9777                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
  9778                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
  9779                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
  9780                                  			; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
  9781                                  			; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!?
  9782                                  			;
  9783                                  			; Correct Code:
  9784                                  			; ;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig
  9785                                  			; 11/09/2023
  9786                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
  9787                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)

  9818                                  
  9819                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9820                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
  9821                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
  9822                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
  9823                                  ;	    for all other cases,
  9824                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
  9825                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
  9826                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
  9827                                  ;
  9828                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
  9829                                  ;
  9830                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
  9831                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
  9832                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
  9833                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
  9834                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
  9835                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
  9836                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
  9837                                  ;
  9838                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
  9839                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
  9840                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
  9841                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9842

 10008                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10009                                  
 10010                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10011                                  
 10012                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10013                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 10014                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 10015                                  ;
 10016                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 10017                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 10018                                  
 10019                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10020                                  
 10021                                  readbootsec:	
 10022 000006B1 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 10023 000006B3 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 10024 000006B6 E8BF00                  		call	read_sector
 10025 000006B9 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 10026 000006BB 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 10027                                  
 10028                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 10029                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 10030                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 10031                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 10032                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 10033                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 10034                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 10035                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 10036                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 10037                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 10038                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 10039                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 10040                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 10041                                  		; informations
 10042                                  
 10043                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 10044                                  
 10045                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10046                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10047                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 10048                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 10049                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 10050                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 10051                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 10052                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10053                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10054                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10055                                  
 10056                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 10057 000006BD A0[4E01]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 10058 000006C0 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 10059 000006C2 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10060                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 10061 000006C4 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 10062 000006C6 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 10063                                  					; no need for nop
 10064 000006C8 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 10065 000006CA 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10066 000006CC 803E[5001]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 10067 000006D1 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 10068                                  
 10069                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10070                                  ;
 10071                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 10072                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 10073                                  ;;
 10074                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 10075                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 10076                                  ;;
 10077                                  ;;check_signature:
 10078                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 10079                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 10080                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if single sided medium.
 10081                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 10082                                  
 10083                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 10084                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 10085                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 10086                                  
 10087                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10088                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:			
 10089 000006D3 A0[6301]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10090                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10091 000006D6 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10092 000006D7 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 10093 000006D9 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 10094 000006DB 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 10095 000006DC 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 10096                                  
 10097                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 10098                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 10099                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 10100                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 10101                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 10102                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 10103                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 10104                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 10105                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 10106                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 10107                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 10108                                  
 10109                                  checksinglesided:
 10110                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 10111                                  		; 02/09/2023
 10112                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 10113 000006DE 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 10114 000006E0 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 10115 000006E2 A801                    		test	al, 1
 10116 000006E4 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 10117 000006E6 813E[5601]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 10118 000006EC 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 10119 000006EE 803E[5801]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 10120 000006F3 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 10121                                  
 10122                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 10123                                  
 10124                                  mustbeearlier:				
 10125 000006F5 C606[5B01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 10126                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10127 000006FA EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 10128                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10129                                  
 10130                                  invalidbootsec:				
 10131 000006FC 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 10132                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10133                                  movbpb_ret:
 10134                                  gooddsk:				
 10135 000006FD F8                      		clc
 10136                                  err_ret:
 10137 000006FE C3                      		retn
 10138                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10139                                  
 10140                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10141                                  ;err_ret:				
 10142                                  		;retn
 10143                                  
 10144                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10145                                  
 10146                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10147                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10148                                  ; 'movbpb' moves the bpb read from the boot sector into registers for use by
 10149                                  ; getbp routine at has1
 10150                                  ;
 10151                                  ; if the set_id_flag is 1, and if an extended boot record, then set volume
 10152                                  ; serial number, volume label, file system id in bds according to
 10153                                  ; the boot record.  after that, this routine will set the set_id_flag to 2
 10154                                  ; to signal that volume label is set already from the extended boot record
 10155                                  ; (so, don't set it again by calling "set_volume_id" routine which uses
 10156                                  ; the volume label in the root directory.)
 10157                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10158                                  
 10159                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10160                                  
 10161                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10162                                  movbpb:	
 10163 000006FF 8A36[5B01]              		mov	dh, [disksector+0Dh]
 10164                                  					; disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 10165                                  					; sectors per unit
 10166 00000703 8A3E[5F01]              		mov	bh, [disksector+11h]
 10167                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.ROOTENTRIES]
 10168                                  					; number of directory entries
 10169 00000707 8B0E[6101]              		mov	cx, [disksector+13h]
 10170                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.TOTALSECTORS]
 10171                                  					; size of drive
 10172 0000070B 8A26[6301]              		mov	ah, [disksector+15h]
 10173                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 10174                                  					; media	descriptor
 10175 0000070F A0[6401]                		mov	al, [disksector+16h];
 10176                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERFAT]
 10177                                  					; number of fat	sectors

 10180                                  					; sectors per track

 10183                                  					; number of heads

 10199                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10200                                  
 10201                                  ;copy the boot_serial number, volume id, and filesystem id from the
 10202                                  ;***extended boot record*** in ds:disksector to the bds table pointed
 10203                                  ;by es:di.
 10204                                  
 10205                                  ;in.) es:di -> bds
 10206                                  ;     ds:disksector = valid extended boot record.

 10208                                  ;      the boot record information.

 10220                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL]

 10223                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.SERIAL+2]

 10255                                  
 10256                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10257                                  ; --------------------------------------------------------------
 10258                                  ; read in the fat sector and get the media byte from it.
 10259                                  ; input : es:di -> bds
 10260                                  ; output:
 10261                                  ;	  carry set if an error occurs, ax contains error code.
 10262                                  ;	  otherwise, ah contains media byte on exit

 10264                                  
 10265                                  readfat:	
 10266                                  		;mov	dh, 0
 10267                                  		; 10/12/2022
 10268 0000076B 30F6                    		xor	dh, dh
 10269 0000076D B90200                  		mov	cx, 2		; head 0
 10270                                  					; cylinder 0, sector 2
 10271 00000770 E80500                  		call	read_sector
 10272 00000773 7202                    		jb	short bad_fat_ret
 10273 00000775 8A27                    		mov	ah, [bx]	; media	byte
 10274                                  bad_fat_ret:

 10276                                  
 10277                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10278                                  
 10279                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10280                                  
 10281                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10282                                  ; read a single sector into the temp buffer.
 10283                                  ; perform three retries in case of error.
 10284                                  ;   inputs:	es:[di].bds_drivenum has physical drive to use
 10285                                  ;		cx has sector and cylinder
 10286                                  ;		dh has head
 10287                                  ;		es:di has bds
 10288                                  ;		ds has Bios_Data
 10289                                  ;
 10290                                  ;   outputs:	carry clear
 10291                                  ;		    Bios_Data:bx point to sector
 10292                                  ;		       (note: some callers assume location of buffer)
 10293                                  ;
 10294                                  ;		carry set
 10295                                  ;		    ax has rom error code
 10296                                  ;
 10297                                  ; register bp is preserved.
 10298                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10299                                  
 10300                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10301                                  
 10302                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10303                                  read_sector:	
 10304 00000778 55                      		push	bp
 10305 00000779 BD0300                  		mov	bp, 3		; make 3 attempts
 10306 0000077C 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10307 00000780 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector	; get es:bx to point to	buffer
 10308                                  rd_ret:					
 10309 00000783 06                      		push	es
 10310 00000784 1E                      		push	ds
 10311 00000785 07                      		pop	es
 10312 00000786 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10313 00000789 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10314                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10315                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10316                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10317 0000078B 07                      		pop	es
 10318 0000078C 734A                    		jnb	short okret2
 10319                                  rd_rty:					
 10320 0000078E E87404                  		call	again		; reset	disk, decrement	bp, preserve ax
 10321 00000791 7442                    		jz	short err_rd_ret
 10322 00000793 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 10323                                  		;test	byte ptr [es:di+23h], 1	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10324                                  					; fnon_removable
 10325 00000798 75E9                    		jnz	short rd_ret
 10326 0000079A 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10327 0000079F 7510                    		jnz	short rd_skip1_dpt
 10328 000007A1 50                      		push	ax
 10329 000007A2 1E                      		push	ds		; for retry, set the head settle time to 0Fh
 10330 000007A3 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10331                                  		;mov	al, [si+9]	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10332                                  		;mov	byte [si+9], 15 ; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10333                                  		;			; NORMSETTLE
 10334                                  		; 12/12/2022
 10335 000007A7 B00F                    		mov	al, 15
 10336 000007A9 864409                  		xchg	al, [si+9]
 10337                                  		; 
 10338 000007AC 1F                      		pop	ds
 10339 000007AD A2[2A01]                		mov	[save_head_sttl], al
 10340 000007B0 58                      		pop	ax
 10341                                  rd_skip1_dpt:				
 10342 000007B1 06                      		push	es
 10343 000007B2 1E                      		push	ds
 10344 000007B3 07                      		pop	es
 10345 000007B4 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h
 10346 000007B7 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - READ SECTORS INTO MEMORY
 10347                                  					; AL = number of sectors to read, CH = track, CL = sector
 10348                                  					; DH = head, DL	= drive, ES:BX -> buffer to fill
 10349                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status,	AL = number of sectors read
 10350 000007B9 07                      		pop	es
 10351 000007BA 9C                      		pushf
 10352 000007BB 803E[3806]00            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 0
 10353 000007C0 750E                    		jnz	short rd_skip2_dpt
 10354 000007C2 50                      		push	ax
 10355 000007C3 A0[2A01]                		mov	al, [save_head_sttl]
 10356 000007C6 1E                      		push	ds
 10357 000007C7 C536[2D01]              		lds	si, [dpt]
 10358 000007CB 884409                  		mov	[si+9],	al	; [si+DISK_PARMS.DISK_HEAD_STTL]
 10359 000007CE 1F                      		pop	ds
 10360 000007CF 58                      		pop	ax
 10361                                  rd_skip2_dpt:				
 10362 000007D0 9D                      		popf
 10363 000007D1 7305                    		jnb	short okret2
 10364 000007D3 EBB9                    		jmp	short rd_rty
 10365                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10366                                  
 10367                                  err_rd_ret:				
 10368 000007D5 B2FF                    		mov	dl, 0FFh	; make sure we ask rom if media	has changed
 10369                                  					; return error
 10370 000007D7 F9                      		stc
 10371                                  
 10372                                  ; update information pertaining to last drive accessed, time of access, last
 10373                                  ; track accessed in that drive.
 10374                                  
 10375                                  okret2:					
 10376 000007D8 8816[7600]              		mov	[step_drv], dl	; set up for head settle logic in disk
 10377 000007DC 8816[1E01]              		mov	[tim_drv], dl	; save drive last accessed
 10378 000007E0 26886D46                		mov	[es:di+46h], ch	; [es:di+BDS.track]
 10379                                  					; save last track accessed on this drive
 10380                                  					; preserve flags in case error occurred

 10383 000007E8 9D                      		popf			; restore flags
 10384 000007E9 5D                      		pop	bp
 10385 000007EA C3                      		retn

 10411                                  exitjx:

 10413                                  		; cf = 0

 10475                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10476                                  
 10477                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10478                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 10479                                  
 10480                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10481                                  ; miscellaneous odd jump routines. 
 10482                                  ; moved out of mainline for speed.
 10483                                  
 10484                                  ; if we have a system where we have virtual drives, we need 
 10485                                  ; to prompt the user to place the correct disk in the drive.
 10486                                  ;
 10487                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds:->Bios_Data
 10488                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------
 10489                                  
 10490                                  		; 19/10/2022
 10491                                  checksingle:		
 10492 0000083A 50                      		push	ax
 10493 0000083B 53                      		push	bx
 10494 0000083C 268B5D23                		mov	bx, [es:di+23h]	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 10495                                  
 10496                                  ; if hard drive, cannot change disk.
 10497                                  ; if current owner of physical drive, no need to change diskette.
 10498                                  
 10499 00000840 F6C321                  		test	bl, 21h		; fnon_removable|fi_own_physical
 10500 00000843 7573                    		jnz	short singleret
 10501 00000845 F6C310                  		test	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 10502                                  					; is there a drive sharing this	physical drive?
 10503 00000848 746E                    		jz	short singleret
 10504                                  
 10505                                  
 10506                                  ; look for the previous owner of this physical drive
 10507                                  ; and reset its ownership flag.
 10508                                  
 10509 0000084A 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 10510                                  					; get physical drive number
 10511 0000084E 06                      		push	es		; preserve pointer to current bds
 10512 0000084F 57                      		push	di
 10513 00000850 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds] ; get first bds
 10514                                  scan_list:				
 10515 00000854 26384504                		cmp	[es:di+4], al
 10516 00000858 7553                    		jnz	short scan_skip	; Not our drive. Try next bds.
 10517 0000085A B320                    		mov	bl, 20h	; ' '   ; fi_own_physical ; test ownership flag
 10518 0000085C 26845D23                		test	[es:di+23h], bl
 10519 00000860 744B                    		jz	short scan_skip	; he doesn't own it either. continue
 10520 00000862 26305D23                		xor	[es:di+23h], bl	; reset	ownership flag
 10521 00000866 5F                      		pop	di		; restore pointer to current bds
 10522 00000867 07                      		pop	es
 10523 00000868 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; ; set	ownership flag
 10524                                  
 10525                                  ; we examine the fsetowner flag. if it is set, then we are using the code in
 10526                                  ; checksingle to just set the owner of a drive. we must not issue the prompt
 10527                                  ; in this case.
 10528 0000086C 803E[7A00]01            		cmp	byte [fsetowner], 1
 10529 00000871 7517                    		jnz	short not_fsetowner
 10530                                  		;cmp	byte ptr es:[di+4], 0 ;	are we handling	drive number 0 ?
 10531 00000873 26807D0400              		cmp	byte [es:di+4], 0
 10532 00000878 753E                    		jnz	short singleret
 10533 0000087A 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]
 10534                                  		;mov	al, es:[di+5]	; [es:di+BDS.drivelet]
 10535                                  					; get the DOS drive letter
 10536 0000087E 06                      		push	es
 10537 0000087F 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10538 00000883 26A20405                		mov	[es:LSTDRV], al
 10539                                  		;mov	es:504h, al	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10540                                  					; set up sdsb
 10541 00000887 07                      		pop	es		; restore bds pointer
 10542 00000888 EB2E                    		jmp	short singleret
 10543                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10544                                  
 10545                                  ; to support "backward" compatibility with ibm's "single drive status byte"
 10546                                  ; we now check to see if we are in a single drive system and the application
 10547                                  ; has "cleverly" diddled the sdsb
 10548                                  
 10549                                  not_fsetowner:				
 10550 0000088A 803E[7800]02            		cmp	byte [single], 2 ; if (single_drive_system)
 10551 0000088F 7517                    		jnz	short ignore_sdsb
 10552 00000891 50                      		push	ax
 10553 00000892 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; if (curr_drv == req_drv)
 10554 00000896 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 10555 00000898 06                      		push	es
 10556 00000899 8E06[1A00]              		mov	es, [zeroseg]
 10557 0000089D 2686060405              		xchg	al, [es:LSTDRV]
 10558                                  		;xchg	al, es:504h	; [es:LSTDRV]
 10559                                  					; then swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10560 000008A2 07                      		pop	es
 10561 000008A3 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; else
 10562 000008A5 58                      		pop	ax		; swap(curr_drv,req_drv)
 10563 000008A6 7410                    		jz	short singleret	; issue	swap_dsk_msg
 10564                                  ignore_sdsb:				
 10565 000008A8 E85C0E                  		call	swpdsk
 10566 000008AB EB0B                    		jmp	short singleret
 10567                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10568                                  
 10569                                  scan_skip:	
 10570 000008AD 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]			
 10571                                  		;les	di, es:[di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 10572                                  					; go to	next bds
 10573 000008B0 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh	; end of list?
 10574 000008B3 759F                    		jnz	short scan_list	; ontinue until	hit end	of list
 10575 000008B5 F9                      		stc
 10576 000008B6 5F                      		pop	di		; restore current bds
 10577 000008B7 07                      		pop	es
 10578                                  
 10579                                  singleret:				
 10580 000008B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 10581 000008B9 58                      		pop	ax
 10582 000008BA C3                      		retn

 10600                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10601                                  
 10602                                  ; 15/10/52022
 10603                                  
 10604                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10605                                  ;	disk i/o handler
 10606                                  ;
 10607                                  ;	al = drive number (0-6)
 10608                                  ;	ah = media descriptor
 10609                                  ;	cx = sector count
 10610                                  ;	dx = first sector (low)
 10611                                  ;	[start_sec_h] = first sector (high)  32 bit calculation.
 10612                                  ;	ds = cs
 10613                                  ;	es:di = transfer address
 10614                                  ;	[rflag]=operation (2=read, 3=write)
 10615                                  ;	[verify]=1 for verify after write
 10616                                  ;
 10617                                  ;	if successful carry flag = 0
 10618                                  ;	  else cf=1 and al contains error code
 10619                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10620                                  
 10621                                  diskrd:	
 10622                                  		;mov	ds:rflag, 2	; romread
 10623                                  		; 19/10/2022
