 12816                                  
 12817                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12818                                  
 12819                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12820                                  ;	BootIo
 12821                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12822                                  ;
 12823                                  ; function: read/write the boot record into boot sector.
 12824                                  ;
 12825                                  ; input :
 12826                                  ;	    al=logical drive number
 12827                                  ;	    rFlag = operation (read/write)
 12828                                  ;
 12829                                  ; output:   for read operation,the boot record of the drive specified in bds
 12830                                  ;	    be read into the DiskSector buffer.
 12831                                  ;	    for write operation,the DiskSector buffer image will be written
 12832                                  ;	    to the drive specified in bds.
 12833                                  ;	    if carry set,then al contains the device driver error number
 12834                                  ;	    that will be returned to dos.
 12835                                  ;	    AX,CX,DX register destroyed.
 12836                                  ;	    if carry set,then al will contain the error code from DiskIO.
 12837                                  ;
 12838                                  ; subroutines to be called:
 12839                                  ;	DiskIO:NEAR
 12840                                  ;
 12841                                  ; logic:
 12842                                  ;
 12843                                  ; {
 12844                                  ;	first_sector = 0;	 /*logical sector 0 is the boot sector */
 12845                                  ;	sectorcount = 1;	 /*read 1 sector only */
 12846                                  ;	buffer = DiskSector;	 /*read it into the DiskSector buffer */
 12847                                  ;	call DiskIO (rFlag,drive_number,first_sector,sectorcount,buffer);
 12848                                  ; }
 12849                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12850                                  
 12851                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12852                                  BootIo:	
 12853 000011D4 06                      		push	es
 12854 000011D5 57                      		push	di
 12855 000011D6 53                      		push	bx
 12856 000011D7 1E                      		push	ds
 12857 000011D8 07                      		pop	es		; Point ES: to Bios_Data
 12858                                  
 12859                                  		; Call DiskIO to read/write the boot sec. The parameters which
 12860                                  		; need to be initialized for this subroutine out here are
 12861                                  		; - Transfer address to Bios_Data:DiskSector
 12862                                  		; - Low sector needs to be initalized to 0. this is a reg. param
 12863                                  		; - Hi sector in [Start_Sec_H] needs to be initialised to 0.
 12864                                  		; - Number of sectors <-- 1
 12865                                  
 12866 000011D9 BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; es:di -> transfer address
 12867 000011DC 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx		; First	sector (h) -> 0
 12868 000011DE 8916[2B05]              		mov	[start_sec_h], dx ; Start sector (h) -> 0
 12869 000011E2 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1
 12870 000011E5 E8E0F6                  		call	diskio
 12871 000011E8 5B                      		pop	bx
 12872 000011E9 5F                      		pop	di
 12873 000011EA 07                      		pop	es
 12874 000011EB C3                      		retn
 12875                                  
 12876                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12877                                  
 12878                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12879                                  
 12880                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12881                                  ;	ChangeLineChk
 12882                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12883                                  ;
 12884                                  ; when the user calls get/set media id call before dos establishes the media
 12885                                  ; by calling "media_chk",the change line activity of the drive is going to be
 12886                                  ; lost.	this routine will check the change line activity and will save the
 12887                                  ; history in the flags.
 12888                                  ;
 12889                                  ; FUNCTION: check the change line error activity
 12890                                  ;
 12891                                  ; INPUT :  ES:di -> bds table.
 12892                                  ;
 12893                                  ; OUTPUT:   flag in bds table will be updated if change line occurs.
 12894                                  ;
 12895                                  ; SUBROUTINES TO BE CALLED:
 12896                                  ;	Set_Changed_DL
 12897                                  ;
 12898                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12899                                  
 12900                                  ChangeLineChk:	
 12901 000011EC 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 12902 000011F0 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; Fixed	disk?
 12903 000011F2 7821                    		js	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Yes, skip it.
 12904                                  		; 12/12/2022
 12905 000011F4 26F6452304              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 4
 12906                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 4 ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12907                                  					; return_fake_bpb
 12908 000011F9 751A                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12909 000011FB 803E[7700]01            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 1	; This rom support change line?
 12910 00001200 7513                    		jnz	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12911 00001202 E8DE06                  		call	haschange	; This drive support change line?
 12912 00001205 740E                    		jz	short ChangeLnChkRet ; Do nothing
 12913                                  
 12914                                  		; Execute the rom disk interrupt to check changeline activity.
 12915                                  
 12916 00001207 B416                    		mov	ah, 16h
 12917 00001209 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - FLOPPY	DISK - CHANGE OF DISK STATUS (AT,XT2,XT286,CONV,PS)
 12918                                  					; DL = drive to	check
 12919                                  					; Return: AH = disk change status
 12920 0000120B 7308                    		jnb	short ChangeLnChkRet
 12921 0000120D 53                      		push	bx
 12922 0000120E BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 12923                                  					; Update flag in BDS for this
 12924                                  					; physical drive
 12925 00001211 E8A806                  		call	set_changed_dl
 12926 00001214 5B                      		pop	bx
 12927                                  ChangeLnChkRet:				
 12928 00001215 C3                      		retn
 12929                                  
 12930                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12931                                  
 12932                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12933                                  
 12934                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12935                                  ;	GetAccessFlag
 12936                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12937                                  ;
 12938                                  ; FUNCTION: get the status of UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12939                                  ;
 12940                                  ; INPUT :
 12941                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12942                                  ;
 12943                                  ; OUTPUT:   a_DiskAccess_Control.dac_access_flag = 0 if disk i/o not allowed.
 12944                                  ;						 = 1 if disk i/o allowed.
 12945                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12946                                  
 12947                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12948                                  GetAccessFlag:				
 12949 00001216 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header
 12950 0000121A C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12951                                  		;mov	al, 0		; Assume result	is unformatted
 12952                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12953 0000121D 28C0                    		sub	al, al
 12954                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12955 0000121F 26F6452402              		test	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12956                                  		;test	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12957                                  					; unformatted_media
 12958 00001224 7502                    		jnz	short GafDone	; Done if unformatted
 12959 00001226 FEC0                    		inc	al		; Return true for formatted
 12960                                  
 12961                                  GafDone:				
 12962 00001228 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12963 0000122B C3                      		retn
 12964                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12965                                  
 12966                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12967                                  
 12968                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12969                                  ;	SetAccessFlag
 12970                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12971                                  ;
 12972                                  ; function: set/reset the UNFORMATTED_MEDIA bit of flags in bds table
 12973                                  ;
 12974                                  ; input :
 12975                                  ;	    ES:di -> bds table
 12976                                  ;
 12977                                  ; output:   unformtted_media bit modified according to the user request
 12978                                  ; ==========================================================================
 12979                                  
 12980                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12981                                  SetAccessFlag:				
 12982 0000122C C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX	points to request header
 12983 00001230 C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; [bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 12984                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12985 00001233 26806524FD              		and	byte [es:di+36], 0FDh
 12986                                  		;and	word [es:di+35], 0FDFFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12987                                  					; ~unformatted_media
 12988 00001238 807F0100                		cmp	byte [bx+1], 0	; [bx+A_DISKACCESS_CONTROL.DAC_ACCESS_FLAG]
 12989 0000123C 7505                    		jnz	short saf_Done
 12990                                  		; 10/12/2022
 12991 0000123E 26804D2402              		or	byte [es:di+36], 02h
 12992                                  		;or	word [es:di+35], 200h ; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 12993                                  					; unformatted_media
 12994                                  saf_Done:				
 12995 00001243 C3                      		retn
 12996                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12997                                  
 12998                                  ; 16/10/2022
 12999                                  
 13000                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13001                                  ; Ioctl_Support_Query
 13002                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13003                                  ;
 13004                                  ; New device command which was added in DOS 5.00 to allow a query of a 
 13005                                  ; specific GENERIC IOCtl to see if it is supported. Bit 7 in the
 13006                                  ; device attributes specifies if this function is supported.
 13007                                  ;
 13008                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13009                                  
 13010                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13011                                  ioctl_support_query:
 13012 00001244 06                      		push	es
 13013 00001245 C41E[1200]              		les	bx, [ptrsav]	; ES:BX Points to request header.
 13014 00001249 268B470D                		mov	ax, [es:bx+13]	; [es:bx+IOCTL_REQ.MAJORFUNCTION]
 13015                                  					; AL ==	Major, AH == Minor
 13016 0000124D 3C08                    		cmp	al, 8		; IOC_DC
 13017                                  					; See if major code is 8
 13018 0000124F 7513                    		jnz	short nosupport
 13019 00001251 0E                      		push	cs
 13020 00001252 07                      		pop	es
 13021 00001253 B90B00                  		mov	cx, 11		; IOC_DC_TABLE_LEN
 13022                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13023 00001256 BF[370C]                		mov	di, IOC_DC_Table
 13024                                  		;mov	di, 0C60h	; IOC_DC_Table
 13025                                  					; at 2C7h:0C60h	= 70h:31D0h
 13026 00001259 86C4                    		xchg	al, ah		; Put minor code in AL
 13027 0000125B F2AE                    		repne scasb		; Scan for minor code in AL
 13028 0000125D 7505                    		jnz	short nosupport	; it was not found
 13029 0000125F B80001                  		mov	ax, 100h
 13030                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13031                                  		; (jump to ioctlsupexit is not required)
 13032                                  		;jmp	short $+2	; ioctlsupexit
 13033                                  					; Signal ioctl is supported
 13034                                  		;;jmp	short ioctlsupexit
 13035                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13036                                  ioctlsupexit:				
 13037 00001262 07                      		pop	es
 13038                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13039                                  		; cf = 0
 13040                                  		;clc
 13041 00001263 C3                      		retn
 13042                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13043                                  nosupport:				
 13044 00001264 07                      		pop	es
 13045 00001265 E96DEE                  		jmp	bc_cmderr
 13046                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13047                                  
 13048                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13049                                  
 13050                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13051                                  ;	GetMediaSenseStatus
 13052                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13053                                  ;
 13054                                  ; FUNCTION: Will return the type of diskette media in the specified DOS
 13055                                  ;	    diskette drive and whether the media is the default type
 13056                                  ;	    for that drive. (default type means the max size for that
 13057                                  ;	    drive)
 13058                                  ;
 13059                                  ; INPUT :   ES:DI -> BDS table
 13060                                  ; OUTPUT:   If carry clear
 13061                                  ;	    DS:BX -> Updated IOCtlPacket
 13062                                  ;
 13063                                  ;			 Special Function at offset 0:
 13064                                  ;				0	- Media detected is not default type
 13065                                  ;				1	- Media detected is default type
 13066                                  ;
 13067                                  ;			 Device Type at offset 1:
 13068                                  ;				2       - 720K 3.5" 80 tracks
 13069                                  ;				7	- 1.44M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13070                                  ;				9	- 2.88M 3.5" 80 tracks
 13071                                  ;
 13072                                  ; Error Codes returned in AX if carry set:
 13073                                  ;
 13074                                  ; 8102 - Drive not ready	- No disk is in the drive.
 13075                                  ; 8107 - Unknown media type	- Drive doesn't support this function or
 13076                                  ;				  the media is really unkown, any error
 13077                                  ;				  other than "media not present"
 13078                                  ; 
 13079                                  ; ==========================================================================
 13080                                  
 13081                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13082                                  SenseMediaType:				
 13083 00001268 C51E[1200]              		lds	bx, [ptrsav]	; DS:BX	points to request header.
 13084 0000126C C55F13                  		lds	bx, [bx+19]	; bx+IOCTL_REQ.GENERICIOCTL_PACKET]
 13085                                  		; 10/10/2022
 13086                                  		;mov	word [bx], 0	; Initialize the 2 packet bytes
 13087 0000126F 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13088 00001271 8917                    		mov	[bx], dx ; 0
 13089                                  		;
 13090 00001273 268A5504                		mov	dl, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13091                                  					; Get int 13h drive number from	BDS
 13092                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13093                                  		;xor	dh, dh		; DX = physical	drive number
 13094 00001277 B420                    		mov	ah, 20h		; Get Media Type function
 13095                                  					; If no	carry media type in AL
 13096 00001279 CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - QCACHE	- DISMOUNT
 13097 0000127B 7216                    		jb	short MediaSenseEr ; error code	in AH
 13098 0000127D FE07                    		inc	byte [bx]	; Signal media type is default (bit 1)
 13099                                  DetermineMediaType:			
 13100 0000127F FEC8                    		dec	al
 13101 00001281 3C02                    		cmp	al, 2		; Chk for 720K ie: (3-1) = 2
 13102 00001283 740A                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13103 00001285 0404                    		add	al, 4
 13104 00001287 3C07                    		cmp	al, 7		; Chk for 1.44M ie: (4-1+4) = 7
 13105 00001289 7404                    		jz	short GotMediaType
 13106 0000128B 3C09                    		cmp	al, 9		; Chk for 2.88M	ie: (6-1+4) = 9
 13107 0000128D 7510                    		jnz	short UnknownMediaType ; Just didn't recognize media type
 13108                                  GotMediaType:				
 13109 0000128F 884701                  		mov	[bx+1],	al	; Save the return value
 13110                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13111                                  		; cf = 0
 13112                                  		;clc			; Signal success
 13113 00001292 C3                      		retn
 13114                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13115                                  
 13116                                  MediaSenseEr:				
 13117 00001293 80FC32                  		cmp	ah, 32h		; See if not default media error
 13118 00001296 74E7                    		jz	short DetermineMediaType ; Not really an error
 13119 00001298 B002                    		mov	al, 2		; Now assume drive not ready
 13120 0000129A 80FC31                  		cmp	ah, 31h		; See if media was present
 13121 0000129D 7402                    		jz	short SenseErrExit ; Return drive not ready
 13122                                  UnknownMediaType:			
 13123 0000129F B007                    		mov	al, 7		; Just don't know the media type
 13124                                  SenseErrExit:				
 13125 000012A1 B481                    		mov	ah, 81h		; Signal error return
 13126 000012A3 F9                      		stc
 13127 000012A4 C3                      		retn
 13128                                  
 13129                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13130                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13131                                  		;db    0
 13132                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13133                                  
 13134                                  ; 16/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13135                                  
 13136                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13137                                  ; MSINT13.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 13138                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13139                                  ; 16/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13140                                  
 13141                                  ;	int 2f function 13h allows the user to change the orig13 int_13 vector
 13142                                  ;	after booting. this allows testing and implementation of custom int_13
 13143                                  ;	handlers, without giving up ms-dos error recovery
 13144                                  ;	entry:	ds:dx	== addr. of new int_13 handler
 13145                                  ;		es:bx	== addr. of new int_13 vector used by warm boot (int19)
 13146                                  ;	exit:	orig13	== address of new int_13 handler
 13147                                  ;		ds:dx	== old orig13 value
 13148                                  ;		es:bx	== old old13  value
 13149                                  ;
 13150                                  ; int 2f handler for external block drivers to communicate with the internal
 13151                                  ; block driver in msdisk. the multiplex number chosen is 8. the handler
 13152                                  ; sets up the pointer to the request packet in [ptrsav] and then jumps to
 13153                                  ; dsk_entry, the entry point for all disk requests.
 13154                                  ;
 13155                                  ; on exit from this driver, we will return to the external driver
 13156                                  ; that issued this int 2f, and can then remove the flags from the stack.
 13157                                  ; this scheme allows us to have a small external device driver, and makes
 13158                                  ; the maintainance of the various drivers (driver and msbio) much easier,
 13159                                  ; since we only need to make changes in one place (most of the time).
 13160                                  ;
 13161                                  ;   ax=800h - check for installed handler - reserved
 13162                                  ;   ax=801h - install the bds into the linked list
 13163                                  ;   ax=802h - dos request
 13164                                  ;   ax=803h - return bds table starting pointer in ds:di
 13165                                  ;	   (ems device driver hooks int 13h to handle 16kb dma overrun
 13166                                  ;	    problem. bds table is going to be used to get head/sector
 13167                                  ;	    informations without calling generic ioctl get device parm call.)
 13168                                  
 13169                                  ;BIOSSEGMENT equ 70h
 13170                                  DOSBIOSSEG equ 0070h ; 17/10/2022	
 13171                                  
 13172                                  ;;BIOSCODE:1302h (MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)
 13173                                  
 13174                                  i2f_handler:				; here is 02C7h:1302h =	0070h:3872h
 13175 000012A5 80FC13                  		cmp	ah, 13h
 13176 000012A8 7413                    		jz	short int2f_replace_int13
 13177 000012AA 80FC08                  		cmp	ah, 8
 13178 000012AD 7431                    		jz	short mine
 13179                                  
 13180                                  ; Check for WIN386 startup and return the BIOS instance data
 13181                                  
 13182 000012AF 80FC16                  		cmp	ah, 16h		; MultWin386
 13183 000012B2 746C                    		jz	short win386call
 13184 000012B4 80FC4A                  		cmp	ah, 4Ah		; multMULT
 13185 000012B7 7503                    		jnz	short i2f_handler_iret
 13186 000012B9 E99700                  		jmp	handle_multmult
 13187                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13188                                  
 13189                                  i2f_handler_iret:			
 13190 000012BC CF                      		iret
 13191                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13192                                  
 13193                                  int2f_replace_int13:			
 13194 000012BD 50                      		push	ax	; free up a register for caller's ds
 13195 000012BE 8CD8                    		mov	ax, ds	; then we can use ds: -> Bios_Data
 13196                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h] ; 15/10/2022	
 13197                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13198                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13199 000012C0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022
 13200                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13201                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13	; save old value of old13 and
 13202                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Orig13+2	; orig13 so that we can
 13203                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13	; return them to caller
 13204                                  		;push	word ptr ds:Old13+2
 13205                                  		
 13206                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13207                                  		;push	word [Orig13]
 13208 000012C5 FF36[B600]              		push	word [Orig13+2]
 13209                                  		;push	word [Old13]
 13210 000012C9 FF36[0801]              		push	word [Old13+2]
 13211                                  
 13212                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13, dx	; orig13 := addr. of new int_13
 13213                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Orig13+2, ax
 13214                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13, bx	; old13 := addr. of new boot_13
 13215                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:Old13+2, es
 13216                                  		
 13217                                  		;mov	[Orig13], dx
 13218                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13219 000012CD 8716[B400]              		xchg	dx, [Orig13]
 13220 000012D1 A3[B600]                		mov	[Orig13+2], ax
 13221                                  		;mov	[Old13], bx
 13222                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13223 000012D4 871E[0601]              		xchg	bx, [Old13]
 13224 000012D8 8C06[0801]              		mov	[Old13+2], es
 13225                                  
 13226 000012DC 07                      		pop	es			; es:bx := old old13 vector
 13227                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13228                                  		;pop	bx
 13229 000012DD 1F                      		pop	ds			; ds:dx := old orig13 vector
 13230                                  		;pop	dx ; 02/09/2023
 13231 000012DE 58                      		pop	ax
 13232                                  i2f_iret:
 13233 000012DF CF                      		iret
 13234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13235                                  
 13236                                  mine:					
 13237 000012E0 3CF8                    		cmp	al, 0F8h 		; iret on reserved functions
 13238 000012E2 73FB                    		jnb	short i2f_iret
 13239 000012E4 08C0                    		or	al, al			; a get installed state request?
 13240 000012E6 7503                    		jnz	short disp_func
 13241 000012E8 B0FF                    		mov	al, 0FFh
 13242                                  		;jmp	short i2f_iret
 13243                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13244 000012EA CF                      		iret
 13245                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13246                                  
 13247                                  disp_func:				
 13248 000012EB 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1			; request for installing bds?
 13249 000012ED 7418                    		jz	short do_subfun_01
 13250 000012EF 3C03                    		cmp	al, 3			; get bds vector?
 13251 000012F1 7423                    		jz	short do_get_bds_vector
 13252                                  
 13253                                  ; set up pointer to request packet
 13254                                  
 13255 000012F3 1E                      		push	ds
 13256 000012F4 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD] ; 17/10/2022	
 13257                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13258                                  					; = [0070h:25A0h] = [02C7h:0030h]
 13259                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13260                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav, bx
 13261                                  		;mov	word ptr ds:ptrsav+2, es

 13270                                  					;  IRET type function. Callers of
 13271                                  					;  this int2f subfunction will have
 13272                                  					;  to be careful to do a popf

 13308                                  ; WIN386 startup stuff is done here. If starting up we set our WIN386 present
 13309                                  ; flag and return instance data. If exiting, we reset the WIN386 present flag
 13310                                  ; NOTE: We assume that the BIOS int 2fh is at the bottom of the chain.

 13312                                  win386call:				
 13313 00001320 1E                      		push	ds
 13314 00001321 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]

 13318                                  					; is it	win386 initializing?

 13321                                  					; is it	win386 exiting?

 13431                                  
 13432                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13433                                  ;
 13434                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 13435                                  ;
 13436                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 13437                                  ;							seg ffff )
 13438                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 13439                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 13440                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 13441                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 13442                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 13443                                  ;
 13444                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 13445                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 13446                                  ;
 13447                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13448                                  
 13449                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13450                                  HMAPtr:
 13451 000013A0 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 13452                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 13453 000013A5 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13454                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13455 000013A9 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13456 000013AC 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13457 000013AE 803E[FB08]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 13458                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 13459 000013B3 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 13460 000013B5 FF1E[F708]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13461                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 13462 000013B9 8B3E[F508]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 13463                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 13464                                  HMAPtr_retn:				
 13465 000013BD C3                      		retn
 13466                                  
 13467                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13468                                  
 13469                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13470                                  
 13471                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 13472                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 13473                                  
 13474                                  move_sector:
 13475                                  
 13476                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 13477                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 13478                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 13479                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 13480                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 13481                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 13482                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 13483                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 13484                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 13485                                  ;
 13486                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 13487                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 13488                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 13489                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 13490                                  ; back to a byte move.
 13491                                  
 13492 000013BE FC                      		cld
 13493 000013BF 51                      		push	cx
 13494 000013C0 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 13495 000013C3 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 13496 000013C7 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13497 000013C9 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 13498 000013CD 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 13499 000013CF F3A5                    		rep movsw
 13500 000013D1 59                      		pop	cx
 13501 000013D2 C3                      		retn
 13502                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13503                                  
 13504                                  movsec_bytes:				
 13505 000013D3 D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 13506 000013D5 F3A4                    		rep movsb
 13507 000013D7 59                      		pop	cx
 13508 000013D8 C3                      		retn
 13509                                  
 13510                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13511                                  
 13512                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13513                                  
 13514                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 13515                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 13516                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 13517                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 13518                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 13519                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 13520                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 13521                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 13522                                  ;
 13523                                  ; input conditions:
 13524                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 13525                                  ;
 13526                                  ; output:
 13527                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 13528                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 13529                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 13530                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 13531                                  
 13532                                  check_wrap:	
 13533 000013D9 50                      		push	ax
 13534 000013DA 53                      		push	bx
 13535 000013DB 06                      		push	es
 13536 000013DC 57                      		push	di
 13537 000013DD E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 13538 000013E0 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 13539                                  		; 12/12/2022
 13540 000013E2 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 13541                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 13542 000013E7 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 13543 000013E9 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 13544 000013ED 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 13545 000013EF 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 13546 000013F2 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 13547 000013F4 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 13548 000013F6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 13549                                  
 13550                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 13551                                  ; last sector on that track.
 13552                                  
 13553 000013F8 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 13554 000013FA 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 13555                                  		; 18/12/2022
 13556 000013FC 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 13557 000013FD 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 13558                                  					; if on	boundary
 13559                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 13560                                  not_on_bound:				
 13561 000013FF 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 13562 00001402 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 13563 00001404 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 13564 00001406 40                      		inc	ax
 13565 00001407 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 13566 00001409 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 13567                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13568 0000140C 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13569 00001410 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 13570                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13571                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 13572 00001412 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 13573 00001414 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 13574 00001415 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 13575                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 13576 00001417 F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 13577                                  
 13578                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 13579                                  
 13580 00001419 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 13581 0000141B 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 13582 0000141D 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 13583                                  
 13584                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 13585                                  
 13586 0000141F 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 13587 00001421 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 13588 00001423 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 13589                                  no_head_bound:				
 13590 00001424 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 13591 00001426 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 13592 00001427 FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 13593 00001429 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 13594 0000142B 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 13595 0000142D 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 13596 00001430 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 13597 00001432 86CB                    		xchg	cl, bl
 13598 00001434 D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 13599 00001436 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 13600 00001438 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 13601 0000143A D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 13602 0000143C 86D9                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 13603 0000143E 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 13604                                  no_wrap:				
 13605 00001440 F8                      		clc
 13606 00001441 5F                      		pop	di
 13607 00001442 07                      		pop	es
 13608 00001443 5B                      		pop	bx
 13609 00001444 58                      		pop	ax
 13610 00001445 C3                      		retn
 13611                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13612                                  
 13613                                  no_wrap_head:				
 13614 00001446 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 13615 00001448 FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 13616 0000144A EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 13617                                  
 13618                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13619                                  
 13620                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13621                                  
 13622                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 13623                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 13624                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 13625                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 13626                                  ;
 13627                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 13628                                  
 13629                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13630                                  find_bds:	
 13631 0000144C C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 13632                                  fbds_1:					
 13633 00001450 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 13634 00001454 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 13635 00001456 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 13636                                  					; go to next bds
 13637 00001459 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 13638 0000145C 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 13639 0000145E F9                      		stc
 13640                                  fdbs_2:					
 13641 0000145F C3                      		retn
 13642                                  
 13643                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13644                                  
 13645                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13646                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13647                                  doint:
 13648                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13649 00001460 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 13650                                  					; get physical drive number
 13651                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 13652                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 13653                                  		
 13654 00001463 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13655 00001465 08C0                    		or	al, al
 13656 00001467 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 13657                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13658 00001469 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 13659                                  					; get request code
 13660                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 13661 0000146C FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13662                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 13663 0000146F 9D                      		popf
 13664                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 13665                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13666 00001470 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13667                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 13668                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13669 00001475 9C                      		pushf
 13670                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13671 00001476 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 13672                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 13673                                  dointdone:				
 13674 00001479 C3                      		retn
 13675                                  
 13676                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13677                                  
 13678                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13679                                  
 13680                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 13681                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 13682                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 13683                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 13684                                  ;
 13685                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 13686                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 13687                                  ;
 13688                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 13689                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 13690                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 13691                                  
 13692                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 13693                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 13694                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 13695                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 13696                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 13697                                  ;.olddx: resw
 13698                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 13699                                  ;.olddd: resd
 13700                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 13701                                  ;end struc
 13702                                  
 13703                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13704                                  
 13705                                  ;   entry conditions:
 13706                                  ;	ah = function
 13707                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 13708                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 13709                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 13710                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 13711                                  ;   output conditions:
 13712                                  ;	no dma violation.
 13713                                  
 13714                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 13715                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 13716                                  ;
 13717                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 13718                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 13719                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 13720                                  
 13721                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13722                                  
 13723                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13724                                  
 13725 0000147A 90004000                dtype_array:	dd 400090h		; 40:90	is drive type array
 13726                                  
 13727                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13728                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13729                                  ; 09/12/2022
 13730                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 13731                                  
 13732                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13733                                  
 13734                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 13735                                  
 13736                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 13737                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 13738                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 13739                                  
 13740                                  format_special_stuff:			
 13741 0000147E 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 13742 00001483 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 13743 00001485 53                      		push	bx
 13744 00001486 BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 13745 00001489 E83004                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 13746 0000148C 5B                      		pop	bx
 13747 0000148D EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 13748                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13749                                  
 13750                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13751                                  
 13752                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 13753                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 13754                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h

 13761 00001494 51                      		push	cx
 13762 00001495 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 13763 00001497 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 13764 00001499 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 13765 0000149B 8406[3105]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 13766 0000149F 59                      		pop	cx
 13767 000014A0 58                      		pop	ax

 13769                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 13770 000014A3 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 13771 000014A4 06                      		push	es
 13772                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13773 000014A5 2EC41E[7A14]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 13774                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 13775                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h

 13777 000014AC 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 13778 000014AF 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 13779                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 13780                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 13781 000014B3 07                      		pop	es
 13782 000014B4 5B                      		pop	bx
 13783 000014B5 EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 13784                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13785                                  
 13786                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13787                                  
 13788                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 13789                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 13790                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 13791                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 13792                                  
 13793                                  ps2_special_stuff:			
 13794 000014B7 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 13795                                  					; read driver parm ?
 13796 000014BC 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 13797 000014BE 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 13798                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 13799 000014C3 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13800                                  ps2_30_problem:				
 13801 000014C5 50                      		push	ax
 13802 000014C6 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 13803                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 13804                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13805 000014C8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13806                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 13807                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13808 000014CD 58                      		pop	ax
 13809 000014CE EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 13810                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13811                                  
 13812                                  ; 17/10/2022
 13813                                  ; 16/10/2022
 13814                                  
 13815                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 13816                                  
 13817                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 13818                                  
 13819                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 13820                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 13821                                  
 13822                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13823 000014D0 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 13824                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 13825                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data

 13827                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 13828                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 13829                                  
 13830                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 13831                                  
 13832 000014D6 A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 13833 000014D9 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 13834 000014DC 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 13835                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 13836                                   format_special_stuff_done:		
 13837 000014DE 803E[3105]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 13838 000014E3 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 13839                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 13840                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 13841                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h		
 13842 000014E5 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13843                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13844                                  		
 13845 000014EA 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 13846                                  		
 13847 000014EB 803E[3E06]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 13848                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 13849 000014F0 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 13850                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 13851                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so		
 13852 000014F2 9D                      		popf
 13853 000014F3 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 13854                                  ret_from_i13:				
 13855 000014F5 1F                      		pop	ds
 13856 000014F6 CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 13857                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13858                                  
 13859                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 13860                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 13861                                  ; a changeline error.
 13862                                  
 13863                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 13864 000014F9 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 13865                                  i13_ret_error:				
 13866 000014FB 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 13867 000014FE 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 13868 00001500 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 13869 00001502 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 13870 00001504 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 13871 00001509 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 13872                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 13873                                  					; never	would
 13874 0000150B 53                      		push	bx
 13875 0000150C BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 13876 0000150F E8AA03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 13877 00001512 5B                      		pop	bx
 13878                                  int13b:
