 13880 00001514 EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 13881                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13882                                  
 13883                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 13884                                  
 13885                                  goterr13:				
 13886 00001516 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 13887 00001519 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 13888                                  goterr13_xxxx:				
 13889 0000151B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 13890 0000151E 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 13891 00001520 803E[3806]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 13892 00001525 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 13893                                  
 13894 00001527 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 13895                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 13896                                  					; (2 = romread)
 13897                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 13898 0000152C 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 13899                                  
 13900 0000152E 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 13901                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 13902                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13903 00001530 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13904                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13905                                  					; call far 70:797h
 13906 00001535 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 13907 00001538 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 13908 0000153A 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 13909 0000153C 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 13910 0000153E 53                      		push	bx
 13911 0000153F 51                      		push	cx
 13912 00001540 52                      		push	dx
 13913 00001541 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 13914                                  loop_ecc:				
 13915 00001544 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13916                                  
 13917                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 13918                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 13919                                  ;
 13920                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 13921                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 13922                                  ; track.
 13923                                  ;
 13924                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 13925                                  ; this request.
 13926                                  ;
 13927                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 13928                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 13929                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 13930                                  ;
 13931 00001547 E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 13932                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 13933                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13934 0000154A 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13935                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13936 0000154F 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 13937 00001551 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 13938 00001554 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 13939 00001556 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 13940 00001559 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 13941                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13942                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 13943                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 13944 0000155B 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 13945                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 13946                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 13947                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 13948                                  ok11_op:				
 13949 0000155D FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 13950 00001561 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 13951 00001563 FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 13952                                  					; add 200h to address
 13953 00001565 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13954 00001567 FEC7                    		inc	bh
 13955 00001569 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 13956                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13957                                  
 13958                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 13959                                  
 13960                                  ok11_exit_err:				
 13961 0000156B F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 13962                                  ok11_exit:				
 13963 0000156C 5A                      		pop	dx
 13964 0000156D 59                      		pop	cx
 13965 0000156E 5B                      		pop	bx
 13966 0000156F EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 13967                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13968                                  
 13969                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 13970                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 13971                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 13972                                  
 13973                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:			
 13974 00001571 06                      		push	es
 13975 00001572 53                      		push	bx
 13976 00001573 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 13977 00001576 1E                      		push	ds
 13978 00001577 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 13979 00001578 B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 13980                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 13981                                  		; 17/10/2022
 13982 0000157B 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 13983                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 13984 00001580 5B                      		pop	bx
 13985 00001581 07                      		pop	es
 13986 00001582 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 13987 00001584 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 13988 00001587 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 13989                                  
 13990                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 13991                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 13992                                  
 13993                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:		
 13994 00001589 56                      		push	si
 13995 0000158A 57                      		push	di
 13996 0000158B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 13997 0000158D BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 13998 00001590 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 13999 00001593 5F                      		pop	di
 14000 00001594 5E                      		pop	si
 14001 00001595 EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 14002                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14003                                  
 14004                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 14005                                  ; operation as best we can.
 14006                                  
 14007                                  gotdmaerr:				
 14008 00001597 A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 14009 0000159A FB                      		sti
 14010 0000159B 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 14011 0000159E 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14012                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 14013                                  					; functions we don't handle
 14014 000015A0 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 14015 000015A3 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 14016 000015A5 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 14017 000015A8 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 14018 000015AA 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 14019                                  
 14020                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 14021                                  
 14022                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 14023                                  
 14024 000015AC 52                      		push	dx
 14025 000015AD 51                      		push	cx
 14026 000015AE 53                      		push	bx
 14027 000015AF 50                      		push	ax
 14028 000015B0 55                      		push	bp
 14029 000015B1 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 14030 000015B3 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 14031 000015B5 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14032 000015B7 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14033 000015B9 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 14034 000015BB D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 14035 000015BD 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 14036 000015BF 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 14037                                  
 14038                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 14039                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 14040                                  
 14041 000015C3 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 14042 000015C5 E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 14043                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14044                                  
 14045                                  no_skip_first:				
 14046 000015C8 D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 14047 000015CA B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 14048 000015CC 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 14049                                  
 14050                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 14051                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 14052                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 14053                                  ;
 14054                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 14055                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 14056                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 14057                                  ; in error.
 14058                                  
 14059 000015CE 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 14060 000015D0 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 14061                                  
 14062                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 14063                                  
 14064 000015D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14065                                  					; set up head number
 14066 000015D5 E888FE                  		call	doint
 14067 000015D8 E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 14068                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14069                                  
 14070                                  i13_done_dmaerr:			
 14071 000015DB B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 14072 000015DD F9                      		stc
 14073 000015DE E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 14074                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 14075                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14076                                  
 14077                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 14078                                  
 14079                                  intverify:				
 14080 000015E1 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 14081 000015E2 53                      		push	bx
 14082 000015E3 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 14083 000015E4 07                      		pop	es
 14084                                  dosimple:				
 14085 000015E5 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14086                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 14087                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 14088                                  		; 17/10/2022
 14089 000015E8 9A[9707]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 14090                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 14091 000015ED 5B                      		pop	bx
 14092 000015EE 07                      		pop	es
 14093 000015EF E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 14094                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14095                                  
 14096                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 14097                                  
 14098                                  intformat:				
 14099 000015F2 06                      		push	es
 14100 000015F3 53                      		push	bx
 14101 000015F4 56                      		push	si
 14102 000015F5 57                      		push	di
 14103 000015F6 1E                      		push	ds
 14104                                  
 14105                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 14106                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 14107                                  
 14108 000015F7 06                      		push	es
 14109 000015F8 1E                      		push	ds
 14110 000015F9 07                      		pop	es
 14111 000015FA 1F                      		pop	ds
 14112 000015FB 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 14113 000015FD BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector
 14114 00001600 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 14115 00001603 1F                      		pop	ds
 14116 00001604 5F                      		pop	di
 14117 00001605 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 14118 00001606 EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 14119                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14120                                  
 14121                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 14122                                  ; the first block.
 14123                                  ;
 14124                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 14125                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 14126                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 14127                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 14128                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 14129                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 14130                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 14131                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 14132                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 14133                                  
 14134                                  doblock:
 14135                                  
 14136                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 14137                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 14138                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 14139                                  				
 14140 00001608 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14141                                  					; get head #, drive #
 14142 0000160B 51                      		push	cx
 14143 0000160C 06                      		push	es
 14144 0000160D 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14145                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 14146 0000160E E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 14147 00001611 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 14148                                  		; 12/12/2022
 14149 00001615 26F6452301              		test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 14150                                  		;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 14151 0000161A 5F                      		pop	di
 14152 0000161B 07                      		pop	es
 14153 0000161C 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 14154 0000161E 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 14155 00001620 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 14156 00001622 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 14157                                  doblockflop:				
 14158 00001624 59                      		pop	cx
 14159                                  doblockcontinue:			
 14160 00001625 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 14161 00001627 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 14162 00001629 50                      		push	ax
 14163 0000162A 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 14164 0000162C EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 14165                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14166                                  
 14167                                  doblocklast:				
 14168 0000162E 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 14169 00001630 50                      		push	ax
 14170                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot	
 14171 00001631 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 14172 00001634 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 14173 00001636 58                      		pop	ax
 14174 00001637 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 14175                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 14176 0000163A 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 14177 0000163C 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 14178 0000163E 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 14179 00001640 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 14180 00001642 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 14181                                  					; then we are done already.
 14182 00001644 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 14183                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 14184 00001646 E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 14185 00001649 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 14186                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14187                                  
 14188                                  bufferx:				
 14189 0000164B 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 14190                                  					; set up head number
 14191                                  buffer:					
 14192 0000164E 53                      		push	bx
 14193 0000164F 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 14194 00001652 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 14195 00001655 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 14196                                  					
 14197                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 14198                                  
 14199 00001657 06                      		push	es
 14200 00001658 1E                      		push	ds
 14201 00001659 56                      		push	si
 14202 0000165A 57                      		push	di
 14203 0000165B 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 14204 0000165C 06                      		push	es
 14205 0000165D 1F                      		pop	ds
 14206 0000165E 07                      		pop	es
 14207 0000165F BF[4E01]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 14208 00001662 57                      		push	di		; save it
 14209 00001663 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 14210 00001665 E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 14211 00001668 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 14212                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 14213 00001669 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 14214 0000166A 5E                      		pop	si
 14215 0000166B 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 14216                                  
 14217                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 14218                                  
 14219 0000166C B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14220                                  					; get drive number
 14221 0000166E 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 14222 00001671 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 14223                                  					;
 14224                                  					; ah is	function
 14225                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 14226                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 14227                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 14228                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 14229                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 14230 00001674 E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 14231 00001677 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 14232 00001678 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 14233 0000167A EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 14234                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14235                                  
 14236                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 14237                                  
 14238                                  doread:					
 14239 0000167C 06                      		push	es
 14240 0000167D 53                      		push	bx
 14241 0000167E 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 14242 0000167F 07                      		pop	es
 14243 00001680 BB[4E01]                		mov	bx, disksector
 14244 00001683 B001                    		mov	al, 1
 14245 00001685 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14246                                  					; get drive number
 14247 00001688 E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 14248                                  					; ah = function
 14249                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 14250                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 14251                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 14252 0000168B E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 14253 0000168E 5B                      		pop	bx
 14254 0000168F 07                      		pop	es
 14255 00001690 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 14256 00001692 56                      		push	si
 14257 00001693 57                      		push	di
 14258 00001694 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 14259 00001696 BE[4E01]                		mov	si, disksector
 14260 00001699 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 14261 0000169C 5F                      		pop	di
 14262 0000169D 5E                      		pop	si
 14263                                  
 14264                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 14265                                  
 14266                                  dotail:					
 14267 0000169E 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 14268 0000169F 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 14269 000016A2 41                      		inc	cx
 14270 000016A3 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 14271 000016A6 F8                      		clc
 14272 000016A7 FEC8                    		dec	al
 14273 000016A9 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 14274                                  
 14275                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 14276                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 14277                                  
 14278 000016AB 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 14279 000016AE E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 14280 000016B1 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 14281                                  
 14282                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 14283                                  
 14284                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 14285                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 14286                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 14287                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 14288                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 14289                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 14290                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 14291                                  
 14292                                  bad13:					
 14293 000016B4 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 14294 000016B6 5D                      		pop	bp
 14295 000016B7 5B                      		pop	bx
 14296 000016B8 5B                      		pop	bx
 14297 000016B9 59                      		pop	cx
 14298 000016BA 5A                      		pop	dx
 14299 000016BB 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 14300 000016BD E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 14301                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14302                                  
 14303                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:				
 14304 000016C0 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 14305                                  
 14306                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14307                                  		; 10/12/2022
 14308                                  		;db 	0
 14309                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14310                                  
 14311                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 14328                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 14329                                  
 14330                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14331                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 14332                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 14333                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 14334                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 14335                                  
 14336                                  install_bds:		
 14337 000016CF 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 14338 000016D0 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 14339                                  
 14340                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 14341                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 14342                                  loop_next_bds:				
 14343 000016D3 C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 14344                                  					; fetch	next bds
 14345 000016D5 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 14346 000016D9 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 14347                                  					; drive	with new one?
 14348 000016DC 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 14349 000016DE B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 14350 000016E0 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14351                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 14352 000016E4 085C23                  		or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14353 000016E7 26806523DF              		and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 14354                                  					; we don't own it
 14355 000016EC 8A5C23                  		mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 14356                                  					; determine if changeline available
 14357 000016EF 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 14358 000016F2 26085D23                		or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 14359                                  next_bds:				
 14360                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 14361 000016F6 B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 14362 000016F9 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14363                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 14364                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 14365 000016FB 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 14366 000016FD 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 14367                                  					; install bds
 14368 00001700 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 14369 00001702 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14370                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 14371                                  					; set next pointer to null
 14372 00001705 1F                      		pop	ds
 14373                                  
 14374                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 14375                                  ;
 14376                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 14377                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 14378                                  ;
 14379                                  ;		; 01/06/2019
 14380                                  ;		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 14381                                  ;		mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 14382                                  ;
 14383                                  ;		cmp	al,[eot]
 14384                                  ;		jbe	short _eot_ok
 14385                                  ;		mov	[eot],al
 14386                                  
 14387 00001706 C3                      		retn
