 15585                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15586                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 15587 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 15588 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 15589 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 15590 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 15591 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 15592 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 15593                                                          ; word
 15594 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 15595 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 15596 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 15597 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 15598                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 15599                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 15600                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 15601                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 15602                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 15603                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 15604                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 15605                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 15606 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 15607 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 15608 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 15609 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 15610 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 15611 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 15612                                  .size:
 15613                                  endstruc

 15615                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15616                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 15617                                  
 15618                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 15619                                  
 15620                                  struc buffinfo
 15621 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1	; Pointer to next buffer in list
 15622 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1	; Pointer to previous buffer in list
 15623 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1	; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15624                                  			; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 15625                                  			; = FFh if buffer free
 15626 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1	; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 15627                                  			;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 15628                                  			; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 15629                                  			; Bit 5 = Reserved
 15630                                  			; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 15631                                  			; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 15632                                  			; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 15633                                  			; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 15634                                  			; Bit 0 = Reserved
 15635 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1	; Sector number of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 15636                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (bit 7 = 0)
 15637 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1	; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 15638 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1	; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 15639 0000000D ????????                .buf_DPB :	resd 1	; Pointer to drive parameters
 15640 00000011 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1	; How full buffer is (bit 7 = 1)
 15641 00000013 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1	; make DWORD boundary for 386
 15642                                  .size:
 15643                                  endstruc
 15644                                  
 15645                                  %define buf_offset	dword [buf_sector]
 15646                                  			;For bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 15647                                  			;offset of the start of the buffer in
 15648                                  			;the file pointed to by buf_ID.  Thus
 15649                                  			;the buffer starts at location
 15650                                  			;buf_offset in the file and contains
 15651                                  			;buf_fill bytes.
 15652                                  
 15653                                  bufinsiz	equ	buffinfo.size ; ; Size of structure in bytes
 15654                                  
 15655                                  
 15656                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 15657                                  
 15658                                  ;Flag byte masks
 15659                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 15660                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 15661                                  ;***
 15662                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 15663                                  ;***
 15664                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 15665                                  
 15666                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 15667                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 15668                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 15669                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 15670                                  
 15671                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz

 15674                                  
 15675                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 15676                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 15677                                  
 15678                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 15679                                  
 15680                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 15681                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 15682                                  ;
 15683                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 15684                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 15685                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 15686                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 15687                                  ;
 15688                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 15689                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 15690                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 15691                                  
 15692                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 15693                                  
 15694                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 15695                                  
 15696                                  struc	DPB
 15697 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 15698 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 15699 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 15700 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 15701 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 15702 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 15703 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 15704 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 15705 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 15706 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 15707                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1  ; MSDOS 3.3
 15708 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 15709 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 15710 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 15711 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 15712 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 15713                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 15714 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 15715 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 15716 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 15717                                  .size:
 15718                                  endstruc
 15719                                  
 15720                                  DPBSIZ  EQU     DPB.size	; Size of the structure in bytes
 15721                                  
 15722                                  DSKSIZ  EQU	DPB.MAX_CLUSTER	; Size of disk (temp used during init only)

 15779                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0  (MSDOS 6.0, BPB.INC, IOCTL.INC)
 15780                                  
 15781                                  ;**	BIOS PARAMETER BLOCK DEFINITION
 15782                                  ;
 15783                                  ;	The BPB contains information about the disk structure.  It dates
 15784                                  ;	back to the earliest FAT systems and so FAT information is
 15785                                  ;	intermingled with physical driver information.
 15786                                  ;
 15787                                  ;	A boot sector contains a BPB for its device; for other disks
 15788                                  ;	the driver creates a BPB.  DOS keeps copies of some of this
 15789                                  ;	information in the DPB.
 15790                                  ;
 15791                                  ;	The BDS structure contains a BPB within it.
 15792                                  
 15793                                  struc A_BPB
 15794 00000000 ????                    .BPB_BYTESPERSECTOR:	resw	1
 15795 00000002 ??                      .BPB_SECTORSPERCLUSTER:	resb	1
 15796 00000003 ????                    .BPB_RESERVEDSECTORS:	resw	1
 15797 00000005 ??                      .BPB_NUMBEROFFATS:	resb	1
 15798 00000006 ????                    .BPB_ROOTENTRIES: 	resw	1
 15799 00000008 ????                    .BPB_TOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15800 0000000A ??                      .BPB_MEDIADESCRIPTOR:	resb	1
 15801 0000000B ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERFAT:	resw	1
 15802 0000000D ????                    .BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK:	resw	1
 15803 0000000F ????                    .BPB_HEADS:		resw	1
 15804 00000011 ????                    .BPB_HIDDENSECTORS:	resw	1
 15805 00000013 ????                    			resw	1
 15806 00000015 ????                    .BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS:	resw	1
 15807 00000017 ????                    			resw	1
 15808 00000019 ????????????            			resb	6	; NOTE:  many times these
 15809                                  ;					; 	 6 bytes are omitted
 15810                                  ;					;	 when BPB manipulations
 15811                                  ;					;	 are performed!
 15812                                  .size:
 15813                                  endstruc
 15814

 16072                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16073                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 16074                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16075                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 16076                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 16077                                  									  
 16078                                  ;*******************************					  
 16079                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 16080                                  ;*******************************					  
 16081                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 16082                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 16083                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 16084                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16085                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 16086                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 16087                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 16088                                  ;For all others:							  
 16089                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 16090                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 16091                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 16092                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 16093                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 16094                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 16095                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 16096                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 16097                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16098                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 16099                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 16100                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 16101                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 16102                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 16103                                  ;									  
 16104                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 16105                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 16106                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 16107                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 16108                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 16109                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 16110                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 16111                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 16112                                  ;									  
 16113                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 16114                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 16115                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 16116                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 16117                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 16118                                  ;									  
 16119                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 16120                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 16121                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 16122                                  ;									  
 16123                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 16124                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 16125                                  ;									  
 16126                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 16127                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 16128                                  ;									  
 16129                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 16130                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 16131                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 16132                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 16133                                  ;						called. 		  
 16134                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 16135                                  ;									  
 16136                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16137                                  ;									  
 16138                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16139                                  ;									  
 16140                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16141                                  ;									  
 16142                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 16143                                  ;									  
 16144                                  
 16145                                  ; 22/03/2019									  
 16146                                  struc ROMBIOS_DESC		; BIOS_SYSTEM_DESCRIPTOR						  
 16147 00000000 ????                    .bios_sd_leng:		resw 1				  
 16148 00000002 ??                      .bios_sd_modelbyte:	resb 1					  
 16149                                  .bios_sd_scnd_modelbyte: 
 16150 00000003 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16151 00000004 ??                      			resb 1					  
 16152 00000005 ??                      .bios_sd_featurebyte1:	resb 1					  
 16153 00000006 ????????                			resb 4					  
 16154                                  endstruc					  
 16155

 16157                                  DMAchannel3		equ 10000000b					  
 16158                                  ScndIntController	equ 01000000b					  
 16159                                  RealTimeClock		equ 00100000b					  
 16160                                  KeyEscapeSeq		equ 00010000b					  
 16161                                  					;;End of Modification

 16263                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16264                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16265                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16266                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16267                                  
 16268                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 16269                                  ;
 16270                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 16271                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 16272                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 16273                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 16274                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 16275                                  ;
 16276                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 16277                                  ;
 16278                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 16279                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 16280                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 16281                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 16282                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 16283                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 16284                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 16285                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 16286                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 16287                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 16288                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 16289                                  
 16290                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 16291                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 16292                                  
 16293                                  struc 		curdir_list
 16294                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 16295 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 16296 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 16297 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 16298 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 16299 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 16300 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 16301                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 16302 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 16303 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 16304 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 16305                                  .size:
 16306                                  endstruc
 16307                                  
 16308                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 16309                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 16310                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 16311                                  						; argument

 16323                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16324                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 16325                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16326                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 16327                                  
 16328                                  ; system file table
 16329                                  
 16330                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 16331                                  ;
 16332                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 16333                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 16334                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 16335                                  
 16336                                  struc	SF
 16337 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 16338 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 16339 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 16340                                  .size:
 16341                                  endstruc
 16342                                  
 16343                                  ;**	System file table entry
 16344                                  ;
 16345                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 16346                                  
 16347                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 16348 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 16349                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 16350 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 16351 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 16352 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 16353                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 16354                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 16355                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 16356                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 16357                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 16358                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 16359                                  					;   (WRITE)
 16360                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 16361                                  					;
 16362                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 16363                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 16364                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 16365                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 16366                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 16367                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 16368                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 16369                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 16370                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 16371                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 16372                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 16373                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 16374 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 16375                                  					; to device header if local device,
 16376                                  					; points to net device header if
 16377                                  					; remote
 16378 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 16379                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 16380 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 16381 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 16382 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 16383 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 16384                                  ;
 16385                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 16386                                  ; ID
 16387                                  ;
 16388 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 16389 0000001B ????                    .sf_dirsec:	resw	1		; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 16390 0000001D ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above

 16678                                  	;IF	STACKSW 
 16679                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 16685                                  ; 05/07/2018
 16686                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16687                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 16688                                  
 16689                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16690                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 16691                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16692                                  
 16693                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 16694                                  ;
 16695                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 16696                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 16697                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 16698                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 16699                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 16700                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 16701                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 16702                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 16703                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 16704                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 16705                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 16706                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 16707                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 16708                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 16709                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 16710                                  ;
 16711                                  
 16712                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 16713                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 16714                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 16715                                  ;
 16716                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 16717                                  ;
 16718                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 16719                                  ;
 16720                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 16721                                  ;
 16722                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 16723                                  ;
 16724                                  
 16725                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 16726                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 16727                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 16728                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 16729                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 16730                                  ;      deeply nested one
 16731                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 16732                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interupts on a PCjr.
 16733                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 16734                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 16735                                  
 16736                                  		;EVEN
 16737                                  ;align 2
 16738                                  		; 21/10/2022
 16739                                  
 16740 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 16741 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 16742 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 16743 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 16744 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 16745 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 16746                                  
 16747 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 16748 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16749 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 16750                                  
 16751                                  ;***********************************************************************
 16752                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 16753                                  
 16754                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 16755                                  
 16756 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 16757                                  
 16758                                  int02:
 16759                                  
 16760                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16761                                  ;
 16762                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 16763                                  ;
 16764                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 16765                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 16766                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 16767                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 16768                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 16769                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 16770                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 16771                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 16772                                  ;
 16773                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 16774                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 16775                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 16776                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 16777                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 16778                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 16779                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 16780                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 16781                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 16782                                  ;
 16783                                  ; *********************************************************************
 16784                                  
 16785 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 16786 00000017 06                      	push	es
 16787 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 16788 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 16789                                  	; 02/11/2022
 16790 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 16791 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 16792 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 16793                                  
 16794 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 16795                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 16796                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 16797                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 16798                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 16799 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 16800 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 16801                                  special02:
 16802 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 16803 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]

 16806 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks

 17033                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17034                                  
 17035                                  ;********************************************************************
 17036                                  ;common routines
 17037                                  ;********************************************************************
 17038                                  
 17039                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 17040                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 17041                                  ; service routine
 17042                                  
 17043                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 17044                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 17045                                  
 17046                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 17047                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 17048                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 17049                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 17050                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 17051                                  
 17052                                  do_int_stacks:
 17053 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 17054 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 17055 00000149 06                      	push	es
 17056 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 17057 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 17058 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 17059                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17060                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 17061                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17062 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 17063 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 17064 0000015C 754F                    	jne	short notfree02
 17065                                  
 17066 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 17067                                  
 17068                                  found02:
 17069 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 17070 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 17071                                  
 17072 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 17073                                  
 17074 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 17075                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17076                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 17077                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17078                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 17079 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 17080 00000176 7542                    	jne	short foundbad02
 17081                                  
 17082                                  	;mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 17083                                  	;mov	es,bp
 17084                                  	;mov	bp,sp
 17085                                  	;mov	bp,[bp+6]
 17086                                  	;mov	ss,ax
 17087                                  	;mov	sp,es
 17088                                  	;mov	es,ax
 17089                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 17090                                  
 17091                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 code SYSINIT code)
 17092 00000178 55                      	push    bp
 17093 00000179 89E5                    	mov     bp,sp
 17094 0000017B 8B4608                  	mov     ax,[bp+8]
 17095 0000017E 5D                      	pop     bp
 17096 0000017F 06                      	push    es
 17097 00000180 17                      	pop     ss
 17098 00000181 89EC                    	mov     sp,bp
 17099 00000183 89C5                    	mov     bp,ax
 17100                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17101                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 17102 00000185 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 17103                                  
 17104 00000189 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 17105                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17106 0000018A 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 17107                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17108                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 17109                                  
 17110 0000018E 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 17111                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17112 00000190 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 17113                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17114                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 17115 00000194 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 17116 00000198 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 17117                                  
 17118                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17119                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; free the entry
 17120                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17121 0000019C 26C6460000              	mov	byte [es:bp],free ; 0
 17122 000001A1 2E892E[1000]            	mov	[cs:nextentry],bp	; setup to use next time
 17123                                  
 17124 000001A6 07                      	pop	es
 17125 000001A7 5D                      	pop	bp			; saved on entry
 17126 000001A8 58                      	pop	ax			; saved on entry
 17127 000001A9 83C402                  	add	sp,2
 17128 000001AC CF                      	iret				; done with this interrupt
 17129                                  
 17130                                  notfree02:
 17131 000001AD 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; error flag
 17132 000001AF 7404                    	je	short findnext02	;  no, continue
 17133                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17134                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, restore error value
 17135                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17136 000001B1 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17137                                  
 17138                                  findnext02:
 17139 000001B5 E81200                  	call	longpath
 17140 000001B8 EBAA                    	jmp	short found02
 17141                                  
 17142                                  foundbad02:
 17143 000001BA 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17144 000001BF 72F4                    	jc	short findnext02
 17145 000001C1 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			; flag this entry
 17146                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17147                                  	;mov	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],clobbered
 17148                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17149 000001C3 26C6460003              	mov	byte [es:bp],clobbered ; 3
 17150 000001C8 EBEB                    	jmp	short findnext02	; keep looking
 17151                                  
 17152                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 17153                                  
 17154                                  ; Common routines
 17155                                  
 17156                                  longpath:
 17157                                  	; 21/03/2019
 17158 000001CA 2E8B2E[0E00]            	mov	bp,[cs:lastentry]	; start with last entry in table
 17159                                  lploopp:
 17160                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17161                                  	;cmp	byte [es:bp+allocbyte],free ; is entry free?
 17162                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17163 000001CF 26807E0000              	cmp	byte [es:bp],free
 17164 000001D4 7512                    	jne	short inuse		;  no, try next one
 17165                                  
 17166 000001D6 B001                    	mov	al,allocated
 17167                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17168                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	; allocate entry
 17169                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17170 000001D8 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al
 17171 000001DC 3C00                    	cmp	al,free 		; is it still free?
 17172 000001DE 7414                    	je	short found		;  yes, go use it
 17173                                  
 17174 000001E0 3C01                    	cmp	al,allocated		; is it other than Allocated or Free?
 17175 000001E2 7404                    	je	short inuse		;  no, check the next one
 17176                                  
 17177                                  	; 11/12/2022
 17178                                  	;mov	[es:bp+allocbyte],al	;  yes, put back the error state
 17179                                  	; 21/10/2022
 17180 000001E4 26884600                	mov	[es:bp],al
 17181                                  inuse:
 17182 000001E8 2E3B2E[0C00]            	cmp	bp,[cs:firstentry]
 17183 000001ED 7406                    	je	short fatal
 17184 000001EF 83ED08                  	sub	bp,entrysize
 17185 000001F2 EBDB                    	jmp	short lploopp
 17186                                  found:
 17187 000001F4 C3                      	retn
 17188                                  fatal:
 17189 000001F5 1E                      	push	ds
 17190 000001F6 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h		;look at the model byte
 17191 000001F9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 17192 000001FB 803EFEFFF9              	cmp	byte [0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; convertible?
 17193 00000200 1F                      	pop	ds
 17194 00000201 7504                    	jne	short skip_nmis
 17195                                  
 17196 00000203 B007                    	mov	al,07h			; disable pc convertible nmis
 17197 00000205 E672                    	out	72h,al
 17198                                  
 17199                                  skip_nmis:
 17200 00000207 FA                      	cli				; disable and mask
 17201 00000208 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh			;   all other ints
 17202 0000020A E621                    	out	021h,al
 17203 0000020C E6A1                    	out	0A1h,al
 17204

 17206 00000210 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si
 17207 00000212 BE[3902]                	mov	si,fatal_msg

 17209                                  ;   We set all foci to this VM to issue the stack failure message
 17210                                  ;

 18397                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 18398                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 18399                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 18400                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 18401                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 18402                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 18403                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 18404                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 18405                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 18406                                  ;
 18407                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 18408                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 18409                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 18410                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 18411                                  ; been patched.

 18699                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 18700                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 18701                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 18702                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 18703                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 18704                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 18705                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 18706                                  ; correctness to be usable.

 18734                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 18735                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 18736                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 18737                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 18738                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 18739                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 18740                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 18741                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 18742                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 18743                                  ;
 18744                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 18745                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 18746                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 18747                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 18748                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 18749                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 18750                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP

 18999                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19000                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 19001                                  ;
 19002                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 19003                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 19004                                  ;
 19005                                  ; Inputs : None
 19006                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 19007                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 19008                                  ;	   free memory.
 19009                                  ;
 19010                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 19011                                  ;
 19012                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19013                                  
 19014                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19015                                  AllocFreeMem:
 19016 00000853 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 19017 00000856 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19018 00000858 CD21                    	int	21h			; first time fails
 19019 0000085A B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 19020 0000085C CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 19021                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19022                                  	; ds = cs
 19023                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 19024                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 19025 0000085E A3[E403]                	mov	[area],ax
 19026 00000861 A3[E003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 19027 00000864 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory
 19028                                  				
 19029                                  	; include msbio.cl6

 19095                                  ;
 19096                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 19097                                  ;
 19098                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 19099                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 19100                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 19101                                  ;
 19102                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 19103                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 19104                                  ; 
 19105                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19106                                  
 19107                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19108                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 19109                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 19110                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19111                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19112                                  	; ds = cs
 19113 000008DA E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 19114 000008DD 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 19115                                  
 19116                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 19117                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19118                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 19119                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19120                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19121                                  	; ds = cs
 19122 000008DF 8E06[7102]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 19123                                  ;else
 19124                                  ;	..
 19125                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 19126                                  
 19127                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19128                                  	; ds = cs
 19129 000008E3 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 19130                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 19131 000008E5 FF1E[7B02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 19132                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 19133 000008E9 C606[6A02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 19134 000008EE F8                      	clc
 19135                                  ttldhx:
 19136 000008EF C3                      	retn

 19140                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 19141                                  ;
 19142                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 19143                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 19144                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 19145                                  ;
 19146                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed

 19148                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19149

 19172                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 19173                                  	;xor	di,di
 19174                                  	
 19175                                  	; 23/10/2022

 19180 00000901 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 19181                                  
 19182                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 19183                                  ;else
 19184                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack
 19185                                  ;
 19186                                  ;	mov	di,0E0h				; room for 5 bytes at ffff:d0

 19328                                  ; procedure : MovBIOS
 19329                                  ;
 19330                                  ;		Moves BIOS code into requested segment
 19331                                  ;
 19332                                  ;	In : ES - segment to which BIOS is to be moved
 19333                                  ;		  ( it moves always into offset BCode_Start)
 19334                                  ;
 19335                                  ;	Out : ES:DI - pointer to memory immediately after BIOS
 19336                                  ;
 19337                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19338                                  
 19339                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19340

 19342                                  
 19343                                  MovBIOS: ; proc	near
 19344                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19345 0000092F 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs

 19350                                  	; 09/12/2022

 19353 0000093A B9D019                  	mov	cx,BCODE_END ; mov cx,1A60h
 19354 0000093D 29F1                    	sub	cx,si				; size of BIOS
 19355 0000093F D1E9                    	shr	cx,1				; Both the labels are para
 19356                                  						;  aligned

 19358

 19360 00000943 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19361                                  	;

 19363 00000945 57                      	push	di				; save end of BIOS

 19519                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 19520                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 19521                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 19522                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 19523                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 19524                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 19525                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 19526                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 19527                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 19528                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 19529                                  ;	  stub will go.
 19530                                  ;
 19531                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 19532                                  
 19533                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19534                                  update_arena:
 19535 00000982 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 19536 00000983 57                      	push	di
 19537 00000984 51                      	push	cx
 19538 00000985 52                      	push	dx
 19539                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19540                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 19541                                  	; 11/12/2022
 19542                                  	; ds = cs 
 19543 00000986 C53E[6B02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 19544 0000098A 4F                      	dec	di
 19545 0000098B 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 19546                                  						;  before sysvar
 19547 0000098C 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 19548                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 19549 0000098E 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 19550 00000993 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 19551 00000995 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 19552                                  
 19553                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 19554 00000997 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 19555 0000099C 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 19556 0000099E 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 19557 000009A0 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 19558 000009A2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 19559                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 19560 000009A4 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 19561                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 19562 000009A8 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 19563 000009AE 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 19564                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 19565 000009B0 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 19566 000009B4 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 19567                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19568                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 19569 000009B6 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 19570 000009B9 5A                      	pop	dx
 19571 000009BA 59                      	pop	cx
 19572 000009BB 5F                      	pop	di
 19573 000009BC 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 19574 000009BD C3                      	retn

 19576                                  ; M012 : END

 19596                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 19597                                  ;
 19598                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 19599                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 19600                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 19601                                  ;
 19602                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success

 19605

 19608                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't

 19610                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 19611                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.

 19763 00000A40 CB                      	retf
 19764                                  
 19765                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19766                                  ;
 19767                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 19768                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 19769                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 19770                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 19771                                  ;
 19772                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 19773                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 19774                                  ;
 19775                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19776                                  
 19777                                  StartVDHead:
 19778                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 19779                                  
 19780 00000A41 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 19781 00000A45 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 19782 00000A47 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 19783 00000A49 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 19784 00000A4B 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 19785                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 19786 00000A4C 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 19787                                  VDiskSig1:
 19788 00000A53 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19789                                  
 19790                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 19791                                  
 19792 00000A58 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 19793                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 19794 00000A5E 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 19795 00000A6D 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 19796 00000A6F 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 19797                                  VDInt19:
 19798 00000A70 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 19799                                  OldVDInt19:
 19800 00000A71 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 19801                                  
 19802                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 19803                                  
 19804                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 19805 00000A75 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 19806                                  VDiskSig2:
 19807 00000A78 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 19808                                  
 19809                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 19810                                  
 19811 00000A7D 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 19812 00000A80 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 19813 00000A82 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 19814 00000A83 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 19815 00000A85 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 19816 00000A86 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 19817 00000A88 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 19818 00000A8A FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 19819 00000A8B 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 19820 00000A8D 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 19821 00000A8F 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 19822 00000A91 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 19823 00000A93 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 19824                                  
 19825                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 19826                                  
 19827                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19828                                  ;
 19829                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 19830                                  ;
 19831                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 19832                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 19833                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 19834                                  ;
 19835                                  ; Inputs : None
 19836                                  ;
 19837                                  ; Outputs : None
 19838                                  ;
 19839                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 19840                                  ;
 19841                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19842                                  
 19843                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 19844                                  
 19845                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 19846 00000A95 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 19847 00000A97 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 19848                                  
 19849                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 19850                                  
 19851                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19852 00000A99 A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 19853                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 19854 00000A9C 2EA3[710A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 19855 00000AA0 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 19856                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19857 00000AA3 2EA3[730A]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 19858                                  
 19859                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 19860                                  
 19861 00000AA7 B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 19862                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 19863                                  	; 23/10/2022
 19864 00000AA9 BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 19865 00000AAC CD21                    	int	21h
 19866                                  
 19867                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 19868                                  
 19869 00000AAE 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 19870 00000AAF 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 19871                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 19872 00000AB1 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 19873                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 19874 00000AB8 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC'
 19875 00000ABF 40                      	inc	ax
 19876 00000AC0 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 19877                                  
 19878                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 19879

 19968                                  
 19969                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19970                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 19971                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 19972                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 19973                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 19974                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 19975                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 19976                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 19977                                  ;								      ;I070
 19978                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 19979                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 19980                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 19981                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 19982                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 19983                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 19984                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 19985                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 19986                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 19987                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 19988                                  ;								      ;I070
 19989                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 19990                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 19991                                  
 19992                                  	; 12/12/2022
 19993                                  	; ds = cs
 19994

 19998 00000B42 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 19999 00000B44 D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 20000 00000B46 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 20001 00000B48 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl

 21020                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 21021                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 21022                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 21023                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 21024                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 21025                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 21026                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 21027                                  ;
 21028                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 21029                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 21030                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 21031                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 21032                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 21033                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 21034                                  ;
 21035                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 21036                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 21037                                  ;
 21038                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 21039                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 21040                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 21041                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 21042                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 21043                                  ;
 21044                                  ;	for round-up machine
 21045                                  ;
 21046                                  ;			  none.
 21047                                  
 21048                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 21049                                  ;
 21050                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 21051                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 21052                                  
 21053                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21054

 21221                                  ;memory allocation for sysinit,confbot module.
 21222                                  
 21223 00001007 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21224                                  	;mov	bx,[CONFBOT]
 21225                                  	; 24/10/2022

 21228 0000100F 4B                      	dec	bx			; make a room for the memory block id.
 21229 00001010 4B                      	dec	bx			; make sure!!!.

 21231 00001013 CD21                    	int	21h			; this will free (confbot to top of memory)
 21232                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ADJUST MEMORY BLOCK SIZE (SETBLOCK)
 21233                                  		; ES = segment address of block to change
 21234                                  		; BX = new size in paragraphs
