 21240                                  		; DOS - 2+ - ALLOCATE MEMORY
 21241                                  		; BX = number of 16-byte paragraphs desired

 21243                                  					; need this to free this area for command.com.

 21246 00001029 CD21                    	int	21h			; free (memhi to confbot(=area))
 21247                                  		; DOS - 2+ - FREE MEMORY
 21248                                  		; ES = segment address of area to be freed
 21249                                  endfile_ret:

 21254                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21255                                  ; 26/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21256                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)	
 21257                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21258                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 21259                                  ;
 21260                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 21261                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 21262                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 21263                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 21264                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 21265                                  ; program).
 21266                                  
 21267                                  ;SYSINIT:10CFh:
 21268                                  
 21269                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 21270                                  
 21271 0000102C 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 21272                                  
 21273                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 21274                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 21275                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 21276                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 21277                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 21278                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 21279                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 21280                                  ; carridge return.
 21281                                  
 21282                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 21283                                  ;character after =.
 21284                                  
 21285 0000102D 06                      	push	es
 21286 0000102E 1E                      	push	ds
 21287 0000102F 07                      	pop	es
 21288 00001030 1F                      	pop	ds			; es->sysinitseg,ds->confbot seg
 21289 00001031 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 21290                                  
 21291 00001033 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 21292 00001035 FC                      	cld
 21293 00001036 2EC606[6D03]20          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],' ' ; clear out the parm area
 21294 0000103C BF[6E03]                	mov	di,ldexec_parm
 21295                                  installfilename:			; skip the file name
 21296 0000103F AC                      	lodsb				; al = ds:si; si++
 21297 00001040 3C00                    	cmp	al,0
 21298 00001042 7402                    	je	short got_installparm
 21299 00001044 EBF9                    	jmp	short installfilename
 21300                                  got_installparm:			; copy the parameters to ldexec_parm
 21301 00001046 AC                      	lodsb
 21302 00001047 268805                  	mov	[es:di],al
 21303 0000104A 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf	; cmp al,0Ah	; line feed?
 21304 0000104C 7405                    	je	short done_installparm
 21305 0000104E FEC1                    	inc	cl			; # of char. in the parm.
 21306 00001050 47                      	inc	di
 21307 00001051 EBF3                    	jmp	short got_installparm
 21308                                  done_installparm:
 21309 00001053 2E880E[6C03]            	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_line],cl ; length of the parm.
 21310 00001058 80F900                  	cmp	cl,0			; if no parm,then
 21311 0000105B 7506                    	jne	short install_seg_set 	; let the parm area
 21312 0000105D 2EC606[6D03]0D          	mov	byte [cs:ldexec_start],cr ; 0Dh 
 21313                                  					; starts with cr.
 21314                                  install_seg_set:
 21315 00001063 2EC70600000000          	mov	word [cs:0],0		; make a null environment segment
 21316 0000106A 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs			; by overlap jmp instruction of sysinitseg.
 21317                                  
 21318                                  ;---------------------------------------------------M067----------------
 21319                                  ;
 21320                                  ; 	the environment pointer is made 0. so the current environment ptr.
 21321                                  ; 	will be the same as pdb_environ which after dosinit is 0.
 21322                                  ;
 21323                                  ; 	mov	cs:[instexe.exec0_environ],0 ; set the environment seg.
 21324                                  ;
 21325                                  ; 	instexe.exec0_environ need not be initialized to 0 above. It was
 21326                                  ; 	done as a fix for bug #529. The actual bug was in NLSFUNC and
 21327                                  ; 	was fixed.

 21348                                  
 21349                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_com_line+2],ax ; set the seg.
 21350 00001070 2EA3[C203]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_line+2],ax
 21351                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21352 00001074 2EA3[C603]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_5c_fcb+2],ax
 21353                                  	;mov	[cs:instexe.exec0_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21354 00001078 2EA3[CA03]              	mov	[cs:iexec.ldexec_6c_fcb+2],ax
 21355 0000107C E86E00                  	call	sum_up
 21356 0000107F 26A3[5603]              	mov	[es:checksum],ax	; save the value of the sum
 21357 00001083 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21358 00001085 B44B                    	mov	ah,4Bh ; EXEC		; load/exec
 21359 00001087 BB[BE03]                	mov	bx,instexe		; es:bx -> parm block.
 21360 0000108A 06                      	push	es			; save es,ds for load/exec
 21361 0000108B 1E                      	push	ds			; these registers will be restored in sysinit_base.
 21362 0000108C 2EFF2E[4E03]            	jmp	far [cs:sysinit_base_ptr] ; jmp to sysinit_base to execute
 21363                                  					; load/exec function and check sum.

 21367                                  ;j.k. this is the returning address from sysinit_base.
 21368                                  
 21369                                  	; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT)
 21370                                  
 21371                                  sysinitptr:				; returning far address from sysinit_base
 21372 00001091 5E                      	pop	si			; restore si for config.sys file.
 21373 00001092 06                      	push	es

 21403                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21404                                  
 21405                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 21406                                  ;
 21407                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 21408                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 21409                                  ;
 21410                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 21411                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 21412                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 21413                                  
 21414                                  ParaRound:
 21415 000010AC 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 21416 000010AF D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 21417 000010B1 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21418 000010B3 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21419 000010B5 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 21420 000010B7 C3                      	retn
 21421                                  
 21422                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21423                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 21424                                  ;
 21425                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 21426                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 21427                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 21428                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 21429                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 21430                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 21431                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 21432                                  ;
 21433                                  ;in: after relocation,
 21434                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 21435                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 21436                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 21437                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 21438                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 21439                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 21440                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 21441                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 21442                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 21443                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 21444                                  ;
 21445                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 21446                                  
 21447                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21448                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21449                                  sysinit_base:				
 21450 000010B8 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 21451 000010BD 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 21452 000010C2 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 21453 000010C4 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 21454 000010C9 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 21455 000010CE 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 21456 000010CF 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 21457 000010D0 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 21458                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 21459                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 21460 000010D2 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 21461 000010D5 263906[5603]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 21462 000010DA 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 21463                                  
 21464                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 21465                                  
 21466 000010DC B409                    	mov	ah,9
 21467 000010DE 0E                      	push	cs
 21468 000010DF 1F                      	pop	ds
 21469 000010E0 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21470 000010E3 CD21                    	int	21h
 21471                                  		; DOS - PRINT STRING
 21472                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"
 21473                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21474                                  _stall: 
 21475                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21476 000010E5 F4                      	hlt 
 21477                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21478                                  	;hlt				;use HLT to minimize energy consumption
 21479 000010E6 EBFD                            jmp	short _stall
 21480                                  
 21481                                  sysinit_base_end: 
 21482 000010E8 26FF2E[5203]            	jmp	far [es:sysinit_ptr]	;return back to sysinit module
 21483                                  
 21484                                  ;-------------------------------------
 21485                                  
 21486                                  sum_up:
 21487                                  
 21488                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 21489                                  ;out:  ax - result
 21490                                  ;
 21491                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 21492                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 21493                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 21494                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.
 21495                                  ;
 21496                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 21497                                  
 21498 000010ED 1E                      	push	ds
 21499                                  	;mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 21500                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21501 000010EE 26A1[A102]              	mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 21502 000010F2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 21503 000010F4 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 21504 000010F6 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 21505 000010F8 268B0E[4C03]            	mov	cx,[es:config_size]	; if config_size has been broken,then this
 21506                                  					;whole test better fail.
 21507 000010FD D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 21508 000010FF 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 21509                                  sum1:
 21510 00001101 0304                    	add	ax,[si]
 21511 00001103 46                      	inc	si
 21512 00001104 46                      	inc	si
 21513 00001105 E2FA                    	loop	sum1
 21514                                  ;now,sum up sysinit module.
 21515                                  sum_sys_code:
 21516                                  	; 24/10/2022
 21517 00001107 BE0611                  	mov	si,locstack ; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21518                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 21519                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 21520                                  	;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 21521                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21522                                  	;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 21523                                  	; 30/12/2022 (BugFix)
 21524                                  	; (SI_End is 39D0h for this -Retro DOS v4.0- IO.SYS)
 21525 0000110A B9[0038]                	mov	cx,SI_end ; (22688) 	; SI_end is the label at the end of sysinit
 21526 0000110D 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end
 21527 0000110F D1E9                    	shr	cx,1
 21528                                  sum2:
 21529 00001111 260304                  	add	ax,[es:si]
 21530 00001114 46                      	inc	si
 21531 00001115 46                      	inc	si
 21532 00001116 E2F9                    	loop	sum2
 21533 00001118 1F                      	pop	ds
 21534 00001119 C3                      	retn
 21535                                  
 21536                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21537

 21539                                  ;SYSINIT:11BDh:

 21557                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21558                                  ; Set_Buffer
 21559                                  ;
 21560                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 21561                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 21562                                  ;
 21563                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 21564                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.

 21630                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21631                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 21632                                  ;
 21633                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 21634                                  ;
 21635                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 21636                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA

 21639                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 21640                                  GetBufferAddr:
 21641 00001193 53                      	push	bx
 21642 00001194 52                      	push	dx

 21645                                  	;add	ax,0Fh

 21657                                  
 21658                                  	;mov	di,0			; dont xor di,di Z flag needed

 21700                                  
 21701                                  ; ======================================================================
 21702                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 21703                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21704                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21705                                  
 21706                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21707                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 21708                                  ;
 21709                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 21710                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 21711                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 21712                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 21713                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 21714                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 21715                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 21716                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 21717                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 21718                                  ;
 21719                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 21720                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 21721                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 21722                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 21723                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 21724                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 21725                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 21726                                  ;	conditions:
 21727                                  ;
 21728                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 21729                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 21730                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 21731                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 21732                                  ;
 21733                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 21734                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 21735                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 21736                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 21737                                  ;
 21738                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 21739                                  ;
 21740                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 21741                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 21742                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 21743                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 21744                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 21745                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 21746                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 21747                                  ;	interrupt line.
 21748                                  ;
 21749                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 21750                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 21751                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 21752                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 21753                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 21754                                  ;
 21755                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 21756                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 21757                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 21758                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 21759                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 21760                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 21761                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 21762                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 21763                                  ;
 21764                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 21765                                  
 21766                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 21767                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 21768                                  
 21769                                  	; 14/12/2022
 21770                                  stackinit:
 21771 000011E0 50                      	push	ax
 21772 000011E1 1E                      	push	ds
 21773 000011E2 06                      	push	es
 21774 000011E3 53                      	push	bx
 21775 000011E4 51                      	push	cx
 21776 000011E5 52                      	push	dx
 21777 000011E6 57                      	push	di
 21778 000011E7 56                      	push	si
 21779 000011E8 55                      	push	bp
 21780                                  
 21781                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 21782                                  
 21783                                  	; 12/12/2022
 21784                                  	; ds = cs
 21785 000011E9 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 21786 000011EC 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 21787                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 21788                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 21789                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 21790 000011EE 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 21791                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)

 21793 000011F5 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax

 21797                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)

 21801 00001200 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*

 21804                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)

 21830

 22608                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22609                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 22610                                  
 22611                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22612                                  ; (SYSINIT:1610h)
 22613                                  
 22614                                  new_init_loop:
 22615                                  
 22616                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 22617                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 22618                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 22619                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 22620                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 22621                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 22622                                  
 22623 000013D2 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 22624 000013D5 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 22625 000013D7 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 22626 000013DB 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 22627                                  
 22628 000013DE 1E                      	push	ds
 22629                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 22630                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 22631                                  	; 21/10/2022
 22632 000013DF B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 22633 000013E2 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 22634 000013E4 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 22635 000013E7 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 22636 000013E9 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 22637 000013ED 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 22638 000013F0 1F                      	pop	ds
 22639                                  
 22640 000013F1 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 22641 000013F4 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 22642 000013F8 C3                      	retn
 22643                                  
 22644                                  ; End of STACK initialization routine
 22645                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22646                                  
 22647                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22648                                  ;set the devmark for mem command.
 22649                                  ;in: [memhi] - the address to place devmark
 22650                                  ;    [memlo] = 0
 22651                                  ;    al = id for devmark_id
 22652                                  ;out: devmark established.
 22653                                  ;     the address saved in cs:[devmark_addr]
 22654                                  ;     [memhi] increase by 1.
 22655                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 22656                                  
 22657                                  ; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22658                                  ; (SYSINIT:1637h)
 22659                                  ; 04/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 22660                                  ; (SYSINIT:176Ch)
 22661                                  
 22662                                  ; 04/09/2023 - PCDOS 7.1 - IBMBIO.COM (SYSINIT:1944h)
 22663                                  
 22664                                  setdevmark:
 22665                                  
 22666                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22667                                  	;push	es
 22668                                  	;push	cx
 22669                                  
 22670 000013F9 2E8B0E[E003]            	mov	cx,[cs:memhi]
 22671 000013FE 2E890E[1614]            	mov	[cs:devmark_addr],cx
 22672 00001403 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 22673                                  	; 25/10/2022
 22674                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.id],al
 22675 00001405 26A20000                	mov	[es:0],al
 22676 00001409 41                      	inc	cx
 22677                                  	;mov	[es:devmark.seg],cx
 22678 0000140A 26890E0100              	mov	[es:1],cx
 22679                                  
 22680                                  	; 04/09/2023
 22681                                  	;pop	cx
 22682                                  	;pop	es
 22683                                  	
 22684 0000140F 2EFF06[E003]            	inc	word [cs:memhi]
 22685 00001414 C3                      	retn

 22728                                  ;ifdef MULTI_CONFIG
 22729                                  ;
 22730                                  ;   config_envlen must immediately precede config_wrkseg, because they
 22731                                  ;   may be loaded as a dword ptr
 22732                                  
 22733                                  ; 25/10/2022
 22734                                  ;config_envlen:	dw  0  			; when config_wrkseg is being used as
 22735                                  ;               			;  a scratch env, this is its length
 22736                                  ;config_wrkseg:	dw  0			; config work area (above confbot)
 22737                                  ;                   			;  segment of work area
 22738                                  ;

 22885                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22886                                  ; PARMS 	LABEL	BYTE
 22887                                  ;		DW	PARMSX
 22888                                  ;		DB	2		; NUMBER OF STRINGS (0, 1, 2)
 22889                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22890                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA DELIMITER LIST,
 22891                                  ;					; TYPICAL ARE ";", "="
 22892                                  ;					; "," & WHITESPACE ALWAYS
 22893                                  ;		DB	length		; LENGTH OF THE NEXT LIST, 0 IF NONE
 22894                                  ;		DB	" .. "          ; EXTRA END OF LINE LIST, CR, LF OR 0 ALWAYS
 22895                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22896                                  
 22897                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 22898                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 22899 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 22900 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 22901 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 22902                                  endstruc

 22907                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 22908                                  
 22909                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22910                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 22911                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 22912                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 22913                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 22914                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 22915                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 22916                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 22917                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 22918                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 22919                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES

 22921                                  
 22922                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 22923                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 22924 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 22925 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 22926 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 22927                                  endstruc
 22928                                  
 22929                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22930                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 22931                                  ;
 22932                                  ;
 22933                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 22934                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 22935                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22936                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22937                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 22938                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22939                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22940                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22941                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22942                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22943                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 22944                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 22945                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 22946                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 22947                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 22948                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 22949                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 22950                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 22951                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 22952                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 22953                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 22954                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 22955                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 22956                                  ;	   :
 22957                                  ;
 22958                                  ;Note:
 22959                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 22960                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 22961                                  ;
 22962                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 22963                                  ;
 22964                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 22965                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 22966                                  ;
 22967                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 22968                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 22969                                  ;
 22970                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 22971                                  ;
 22972                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 22973                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 22974                                  ;
 22975                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22976                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 22977                                  ;
 22978                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 22979                                  ;
 22980                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 22981                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 22982                                  ;
 22983                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 22984                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 22985                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 22986                                  ;
 22987                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 22988                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 22989                                  ;
 22990                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 22991                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 22992                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 22993                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 22994                                  
 22995                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 22996                                  
 22997                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 22998                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 22999                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 23000                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 23001                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 23002                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 23003                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 23004                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 23005                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 23006                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 23007                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 23008                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 23009                                  
 23010                                  ;**** Function flags
 23011                                  
 23012                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 23013                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 23014                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 23015                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 23016                                  
 23017                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 23018                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 23019 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 23020 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 23021 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 23022 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 23023 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 23024 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 23025                                  endstruc
 23026                                  
 23027                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23028                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 23029                                  ;
 23030                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 23031                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 23032                                  ;	     +-
 23033                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 23034                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 23035                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 23036                                  ;	     |	:
 23037                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23038                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 23039                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 23040                                  ;	     |	:
 23041                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 23042                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 23043                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 23044                                  ;	     +-	:
 23045                                  ;
 23046                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 23047                                  ;
 23048                                  ;Note:
 23049                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 23050                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 23051                                  ;
 23052                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 23053                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 23054                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 23055                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23056                                  
 23057                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 23058                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 23059                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 23060                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 23061                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 23062                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 23063                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 23064                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 23065                                  
 23066                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 23067 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 23068 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 23069 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 23070 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 23071 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 23072                                  endstruc
 23073                                  
 23074                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23075                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 23076                                  ;
 23077                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 23078                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 23079                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 23080                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 23081                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 23082                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 23083                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 23084                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 23085                                  ;
 23086                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 23087                                  ;
 23088                                  ;            +-
 23089                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 23090                                  ;	    | or
 23091                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 23092                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 23093                                  ;	    | or
 23094                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 23095                                  ;	    | or
 23096                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 23097                                  ;	    | or
 23098                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 23099                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 23100                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 23101                                  ;	    | or
 23102                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 23103                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 23104                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 23105                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 23106                                  ;	    +-
 23107                                  ;
 23108                                  ;
 23109                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 23110                                  ;      list.
 23111                                  ;
 23112                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 23113                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 23114                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 23115                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 23116                                  
 23117                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 23118                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 23119 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 23120 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 23121 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 23122 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 23123                                  endstruc

 23130                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 23131                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 23132                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 23133                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 23134                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 23135                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 23136                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 23137                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 23138                                  
 23139                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 23140                                  
 23141                                  ;**** Return code
 23142                                  ;
 23143                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 23144                                  
 23145                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 23146                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 23147                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 23148                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 23149                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 23150                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 23151                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 23152                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 23153                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 23154                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 23161 0000141D 0000                    _$P_ORDINAL:	   dw	0		;AN000; Operand ordinal save area
 23162 0000141F 0000                    _$P_RC:		   dw	0		;AN000; Return code from parser
 23163 00001421 0000                    _$P_SI_Save:	   dw	0		;AN000; Pointer of command buffer
 23164 00001423 0000                    _$P_DX:		   dw	0		;AN000; Return result buffer address
 23165 00001425 00                      _$P_Terminator:	   db	0		;AN000; Terminator code (ASCII)
 23166 00001426 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_OFF:	   dw	0		;AN000; Offset of DBCS EV
 23167 00001428 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_SEG:	   dw	0		;AN000; Segment of DBCS EV
 23168 0000142A 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 23169                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags
 23170                                  %define _$P_Flags2 _$P_Flags+1		;AN038; to reference second byte flags only
 23171                                  
 23172                                  ;in second byte of _$P_Flags, referenced as _$P_Flags2:

 23238                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23239                                  ; SysParse;
 23240                                  ;
 23241                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 23242                                  ;
 23243                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 23244                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 23245                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 23246                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 23247                                  ;
 23248                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 23249                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 23250                                  ;		 is in DS.
 23251                                  ;
 23252                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 23253                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 23254                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 23255                                  ;
 23256                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 23257                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 23258                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 23259                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 23260                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 23261                                  ;
 23262                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 23263                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 23264                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 23265                                  ;
 23266                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 23267                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 23268                                  ;
 23269                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 23270                                  ;
 23271                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 23272                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 23273                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 23274                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 23275                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 23276                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 23277                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 23278                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 23279                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 23280                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 23281                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 23282                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 23283                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 23284                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 23285                                  ;	     (tm08)
 23286                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 23287                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 23288                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 23289                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 23290                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 23291                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)

 23293                                  ;					  (tm12)

 23295                                  ;					  (tm13)

 23297                                  ;					  (tm14)

 23299                                  ;					  (tm15)
 23300                                  ;  7/24/87 : Negative lower bound on numeric ranges cause trouble
 23301                                  
 23302                                  ;  7/24/87 : Quoted strings being returned with quotes.
 23303                                  
 23304                                  ;  7/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN018;)
 23305                                  ;	     Non optional value on switch (match flags<>0 and <>1) not flagged
 23306                                  ;	     as an error when missing.	Solution: return error 2.  Modules
 23307                                  ;	     affected: _$P_Chk_SW_Control.
 23308                                  
 23309                                  ;  7/29/87 : Kerry S (;AN019;)
 23310                                  ;	     Now allow the optional bit in match flags for switches.  This
 23311                                  ;	     allows the switch to be encountered with a value or without a
 23312                                  ;	     value and no error is returned.
 23313                                  ;
 23314                                  
 23315                                  ;  8/28/87 : Ed K, Kerry S (;AN020;)
 23316                                  ;  9/14/87   In PROC _$P_Get_DecNum, when checking for field separators
 23317                                  ;	     within a date response, instead of checking just for the one
 23318                                  ;	     character defined by the COUNTRY DEPENDENT INFO, check for
 23319                                  ;	     all three chars, "-", "/", and ".". Change _$P_Chk_Switch to allow
 23320                                  ;	     slashes in date strings when DateSw (assembler switch) is set.
 23321                                  
 23322                                  ;  9/1/87  : Kerry S (;AN021)
 23323                                  ;	     In PROC _$P_String_Comp, when comparing the switch or keyword on
 23324                                  ;	     the command line with the string in the control block the
 23325                                  ;	     comparing was stopping at a colon (switch) or equal (keyword)
 23326                                  ;	     on the command line and assuming a match.	This allowed a shorter
 23327                                  ;	     string on the command line than in the synonym list in the control
 23328                                  ;	     block.  I put in a test for a null in the control block so the
 23329                                  ;	     string in the control block must be the same length as the string
 23330                                  ;	     preceeding the colon or equal on the command line.
 23331                                  
 23332                                  ;  8/28/87 : Kerry S (;AN022;)
 23333                                  ;	     All references to data in PSDATA.INC had CS overrides.  This caused
 23334                                  ;	     problems for people who included it themselves in a segment other
 23335                                  ;	     than CS.  Added switch to allow including PSDATA.INC in any
 23336                                  ;	     segment.

 23512 00001517 2EF606[2B14]20          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Extra ;AC034; 3/9 extra delimiter encountered ?
 23513 0000151D 7543                    	jnz	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN000; 3/9 if yes, no need to copy
 23514                                  
 23515                                  _$P_Pack_Loop:				;AN000;
 23516 0000151F AC                      	lodsb				;AN000; Pick a operand from buffer
 23517 00001520 E8FA06                  	call	_$P_Chk_Switch		;AN000; Check switch character
 23518 00001523 723C                    	jc	short _$P_Pack_End_BY_EOL ;AN020; if carry set found delimiter type slash, need backup si, else continue

 23521 00001528 7437                    	je	short _$P_Pack_End_BY_EOL ;AN000; need backup si
 23522                                  
 23523 0000152A E8A206                  	call	_$P_Chk_Delim		;AN000; Check delimiter
 23524 0000152D 7518                    	jne	short _$P_PL01 		;AN000; If no, process next byte
 23525

 23527                                  ; (tm08)jne	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN000; 3/9 then
 23528 00001535 7505                    	jnz	short _$P_Pack_End_backup_si ;AN000; (tm08)

 23531 0000153A EB26                    	jmp	short _$P_Pack_End	;AN000; finish copy by placing NUL at end
 23532

 23539

 23543 0000154C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_PL00 		;AN000; then
 23544

 23546                                  _$P_PL00:				;AN000;

 23550

 23935                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23936                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 23937                                  ;
 23938                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 23939                                  ;
 23940                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 23941                                  ;	    AL = type
 23942                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 23943                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 23944                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 23945                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 23946                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 23947                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths
 23948                                  ;		  AL = else: cs:SI points to returned string buffer
 23949                                  ;	    ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 23950                                  ;
 23951                                  ; Output:   None
 23952                                  ;
 23953                                  ; Use:	_$P_Do_CAPS_String, _$P_Remove_Colon, _$P_Found_SYNONYM
 23954                                  ;
 23955                                  ; Vars: _$P_DX(W)
 23956                                  ;***********************************************************************
 23957                                  
 23958                                  _$P_Fill_Result:

 23964                                  	;mov	[es:di+_$P_Result_Blk.Item_Tag],ah ;AN000; store item tag

 24351                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24352                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 24353                                  ;
 24354                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 24355                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 24356                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 24357                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 24358                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 24359                                  ;
 24360                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 24361                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block

 24603                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24604                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 24605                                  ;
 24606                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 24607                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 24608                                  ;
 24609                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 24610                                  ;
 24611                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 24612                                  ;
 24613                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 24614                                  ;***********************************************************************
 24615                                  
 24616                                  	; 26/10/2022
 24617                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 24618 0000198F 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 24619 00001990 2EF606[2B14]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?

 24621                                  
 24622 00001998 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 24623 00001999 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 24624                                  
 24625                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 24626 0000199A 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 24627 0000199B 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 24628                                  
 24629 0000199D F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 24630 0000199E C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 24631                                  
 24632                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 24633                                  _$P_0099Err: ; 14/08/2023
 24634 0000199F F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 24635                                  _$P_0099Err2: ; 14/08/2023
 24636 000019A0 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25341                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25342                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 25343                                  ;
 25344                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 25345                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 25346                                  ;
 25347                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 25348                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 25349                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 25350                                  ;
 25351                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 25352                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 25353                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 25354                                  
 25355                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 25356                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 25357                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 25358                                  ;
 25359                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 25360                                  
 25361                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 25362                                  ;***********************************************************************
 25363                                  
 25364                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 25365                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 25366                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 25367                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25368 00001C1D BD[3414]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 25369                                  
 25370                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 25371 00001C20 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 25372 00001C22 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 25373                                  
 25374                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 25375 00001C24 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25376 00001C26 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 25377                                  
 25378 00001C28 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 25379                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25380                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25381 00001C29 C3                      	retn
 25382                                  
 25383                                  ; 12/12/2022
 25384                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 25385                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 25386                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25387                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 25388                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 25389                                  
 25390                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 25391                                  ;	    .IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 25392 00001C2A 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 25393 00001C2C 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 25394                                  
 25395 00001C2E 2E800E[2B14]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 25396                                  ;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 25397                                  
 25398                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25399                                  	; cf=0
 25400                                  	;retn
 25401                                  
 25402                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 25403                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25404                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 25405 00001C34 F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 25406                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 25407                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 25408 00001C35 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25464                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 25465                                  	; 14/08/2023
 25466 00001C67 2EC536[2614]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 25467                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 25468 00001C6C 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 25469 00001C6F 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 25470 00001C71 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 25471 00001C73 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 25472 00001C75 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 25473 00001C78 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 25474 00001C7A F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 25475 00001C7B EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 25476                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 25477 00001C7D 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 25478 00001C7E 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 25479                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 25480 00001C7F EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 25481                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 25482                                  	; 12/12/2022
 25483                                  	; cf=0
 25484                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 25485                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 25486 00001C81 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 25487 00001C82 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 25488 00001C83 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 25489 00001C84 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 25501                                  struc p_parms
 25502 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 25503 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 25504 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 25505 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 25506                                  .size:
 25507                                  endstruc
 25508                                  
 25509                                  struc p_pos
 25510 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 25511 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 25512 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 25513                                  
 25514                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 25515                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 25516                                  
 25517 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list
 25518 00000008 ??                      	resb	1	; db 0	; no switches/keywords
 25519                                  .size:
 25520                                  endstruc
 25521                                  
 25522                                  struc	p_range
 25523 00000000 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; range definition
 25524 00000001 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; 1 definition of range
 25525 00000002 ??                      	resb 	1	; db 1	; item tag for this range
 25526 00000003 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric min
 25527 00000007 ????????                	resd	1	; dd ?	; numeric max
 25528                                  .size:
 25529                                  endstruc

 25962                                  ;swit_f: db 	'/F',0

 25968 00001E10 [CD1C]             
 25969 00001E12 01                      	db	1
 25970 00001E13 2F5400                  swit_t:	db	'/T',0			   ;				M059
