 26047                                  
 26048                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 26049                                  ;
 26050                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 26051                                  ;
 26052                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26053                                  ;
 26054                                  ;   Modification log:
 26055                                  ;
 26056                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 26057                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 26058                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 26059                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 26060                                  ;
 26061                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26062                                  ;
 26063                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 26064                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 26065                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 26066                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 26067                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 26068                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 26069                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 26070                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 26071                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 26072                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 26073                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 26074                                  ;
 26075                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26076                                  
 26077                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 26078                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 26079                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 26080                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 26081                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 26082                                  
 26083                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 26084                                  
 26085                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 26086                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 26087                                  
 26088                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 26089                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 26090                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 26091                                  
 26092                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 26093                                  ;
 26094                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 26095                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 26096                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 26097                                  ;	           line.
 26098                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 26099                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 26100                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 26101                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 26102                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 26103                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 26104                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 26105                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 26106                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 26107                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 26108                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 26109                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 26110                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 26111                                  ;	           for details).
 26112                                  
 26113                                  fInHigh:  db	0
 26114                                  fUmbTiny: db	0
 26115                                  SegLoad:  dw	0
 26116                                  UmbLoad:  db	0
 26117                                  UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 26118                                  UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 26119                                  fm_umb:   db	0
 26120                                  fm_strat: db	0
 26121                                  fm_argc:  db	0	
 26122                                  
 26123                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 26124                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 26125                                  
 26126                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 26127                                  
 26128                                  %endif
 26129

 26139

 26141 00001E6A 0000                    DevLoadAddr:	dw	0	; Mem addr where the device driver is 2 b loaded
 26142 00001E6C 0000                    DevLoadEnd:	dw	0	; MaxAddr to which device can be loaded
 26143 00001E6E 00000000                DevEntry:	dd	0	; Entry point to the device driver

 26150 00001E79 0000                    DevUMBSize:	dw	0	; Size of the current UMB being used   (paras)

 26183                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26184                                  ;
 26185                                  ; procedure : doconf
 26186                                  ;
 26187                                  ;             Config file is parsed initially with this routine. For the
 26188                                  ;             Subsequent passes 'multi_pass' entry is used .
 26189                                  ;
 26190                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26191                                  
 26192                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26193                                  doconf:
 26194 00001E9B 0E                      	push	cs
 26195 00001E9C 1F                      	pop	ds
 26196                                  
 26197 00001E9D B80037                  	mov	ax,3700h
 26198                                          ;mov	ax,(CHAR_OPER<<8)	; get switch character
 26199 00001EA0 CD21                    	int	21h
 26200 00001EA2 8816[AA02]              	mov	[command_line+1],dl	; set in default command line
 26201                                  
 26202                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26203                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26204                                  ;	;mov	[command_line-1],dl     ; save default switchchar
 26205                                  ;	mov	[def_swchr],dl ; 31/03/2019 
 26206                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26207                                  
 26208 00001EA6 BA[0D33]                	mov	dx,config ;'\CONFIG.SYS' ;now pointing to file description
 26209 00001EA9 B8003D                  	mov	ax,3D00h
 26210                                  	;mov	ax,OPEN<<8		;open file "config.sys"
 26211 00001EAC F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26212 00001EAD CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26213 00001EAF 7306                    	jnc	short noprob		; brif opened okay
 26214                                  
 26215                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26216                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26217                                  ;      	call	kbd_read		; we still want to give the guy
 26218                                  ;					; a chance to select clean boot!
 26219                                  ;;endif					; (ie, no autoexec.bat processing)
 26220 00001EB1 C606[4903]0B            	mov	byte [multi_pass_id],11	; set it to unreasonable number
 26221 00001EB6 C3                      	retn
 26222                                  noprob: 				;get file size (note < 64k!!)
 26223 00001EB7 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax  ; File handle
 26224 00001EB9 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 26225 00001EBB 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26226                                  	;mov	ax,4202h
 26227 00001EBD B80242                  	mov	ax,(LSEEK<<8)|2
 26228 00001EC0 CD21                    	int	21h
 26229 00001EC2 A3[D203]                	mov	[count],ax
 26230                                  
 26231 00001EC5 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26232                                  	;mov	ax,4200h
 26233 00001EC7 B80042                  	mov	ax,LSEEK<<8		;reset pointer to beginning of file
 26234 00001ECA CD21                    	int	21h
 26235                                  
 26236                                  	;mov	dx,[ALLOCLIM]		;use current alloclim value
 26237                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26238 00001ECC 8B16[A102]              	mov	dx,[top_of_cdss] 
 26239                                  
 26240 00001ED0 A1[D203]                	mov	ax,[count]
 26241 00001ED3 A3[4C03]                	mov	[config_size],ax	;save the size of config.sys file.
 26242 00001ED6 E8D3F1                  	call	ParaRound
 26243 00001ED9 29C2                    	sub	dx,ax
 26244                                  
 26245                                  ; 27/10/2022
 26246                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26247                                  ;;
 26248                                  ;;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 26249                                  ;;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 26250                                  ;;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 26251                                  ;;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 26252                                  ;;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 26253                                  ;;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 26254                                  ;;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 26255                                  ;;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 26256                                  ;;
 26257                                  ;       dec     dx                      ;reserve 1 additional paragraph
 26258                                  ;       mov     [config_wrkseg],dx      ;this is the segment to be used for
 26259                                  ;       sub     dx,ax                   ;rebuilding the config.sys memory image
 26260                                  ;;endif	;MULTI_CONFIG
 26261                                  
 26262 00001EDB 83EA11                  	sub	dx,11h			;room for header
 26263                                  	
 26264                                  	;mov	[ALLOCLIM],dx		;config starts here. new alloclim value.
 26265                                  	;mov	[CONFBOT],dx
 26266                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26267 00001EDE 8916[A102]              	mov	[top_of_cdss],dx
 26268 00001EE2 E8E8EC                  	call    TempCDS 
 26269                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26270                                  	; ds <> cs 
 26271 00001EE5 2E8B16[A102]            	mov	dx,[cs:top_of_cdss]
 26272                                   
 26273 00001EEA 8EDA                    	mov	ds,dx
 26274 00001EEC 8EC2                    	mov	es,dx
 26275                                  
 26276 00001EEE 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx
 26277 00001EF0 2E8B0E[D203]            	mov	cx,[cs:count]
 26278 00001EF5 B43F                    	mov	ah,3Fh
 26279                                  	;mov	ah,READ  ; 3Fh
 26280 00001EF7 F9                      	stc				;in case of int 24
 26281 00001EF8 CD21                    	int	21h			;function request
 26282 00001EFA 9C                      	pushf
 26283                                  
 26284                                  ; find the eof mark in the file. if present,then trim length.
 26285                                  
 26286 00001EFB 50                      	push	ax
 26287 00001EFC 57                      	push	di
 26288 00001EFD 51                      	push	cx
 26289 00001EFE B01A                    	mov	al,1Ah			; eof mark
 26290 00001F00 89D7                    	mov	di,dx			; point to buffer
 26291 00001F02 E305                    	jcxz	puteol			; no chars
 26292 00001F04 F2AE                    	repnz	scasb			; find end
 26293 00001F06 7501                    	jnz	short puteol		; none found and count exhausted
 26294                                  
 26295                                  ; we found a 1a. back up
 26296                                  
 26297 00001F08 4F                      	dec	di			; backup past 1Ah
 26298                                  
 26299                                  ;  just for the halibut, stick in an extra eol
 26300                                  
 26301                                  puteol:
 26302 00001F09 B00D                    	mov	al,cr ; 0Dh
 26303 00001F0B AA                      	stosb
 26304 00001F0C B00A                    	mov	al,lf  ;0Ah
 26305 00001F0E AA                      	stosb
 26306 00001F0F 29D7                    	sub	di,dx			; difference moved
 26307                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26308                                  	;mov	[cs:count],di		; new count
 26309                                  
 26310                                  	; 11/12/2022	
 26311                                  	; 31/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26312 00001F11 0E                      	push	cs
 26313 00001F12 1F                      	pop	ds
 26314                                  
 26315 00001F13 893E[D203]              	mov	[count],di		; new count
 26316                                  
 26317 00001F17 59                      	pop	cx
 26318 00001F18 5F                      	pop	di
 26319 00001F19 58                      	pop	ax
 26320                                  
 26321                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26322                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26323                                  	;push	cs
 26324                                  	;pop	ds
 26325                                  
 26326 00001F1A 50                      	push	ax
 26327                                  	;mov	ah,CLOSE
 26328 00001F1B B43E                    	mov	ah,3Eh
 26329 00001F1D CD21                    	int	21h
 26330 00001F1F 58                      	pop	ax
 26331 00001F20 9D                      	popf
 26332 00001F21 7204                    	jc	short conferr 		;if not we've got a problem
 26333 00001F23 39C1                    	cmp	cx,ax
 26334 00001F25 742C                    	jz	short getcom		;couldn't read the file
 26335                                  conferr:
 26336 00001F27 BA[0D33]                	mov	dx,config		;want to print config error
 26337 00001F2A E83713                  	call	badfil
 26338                                  endconv:
 26339 00001F2D C3                      	retn
 26340                                  
 26341                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26342                                  ;
 26343                                  ; entry : multi_pass
 26344                                  ;
 26345                                  ;             called to execute device=,install= commands
 26346                                  ;
 26347                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26348                                  
 26349                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26350                                  multi_pass:
 26351 00001F2E 0E                      	push	cs
 26352 00001F2F 1F                      	pop	ds
 26353                                  
 26354 00001F30 803E[4903]0A            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],10
 26355                                  ;jae_endconv:
 26356 00001F35 73F6                    	jae	short endconv 		; do nothing. just return.
 26357                                  
 26358                                  	;push	word [CONFBOT]
 26359                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26360 00001F37 FF36[A102]              	push	word [top_of_cdss]
 26361 00001F3B 07                      	pop	es			; es -> confbot
 26362                                  
 26363 00001F3C 8B36[D403]              	mov	si,[org_count]
 26364 00001F40 8936[D203]              	mov	[count],si		; set count
 26365 00001F44 31F6                    	xor	si,si ; 0
 26366 00001F46 8936[D603]                      mov     [chrptr],si		; reset chrptr
 26367 00001F4A 8936[2B03]                      mov     [linecount],si		; reset linecount
 26368                                  
 26369 00001F4E E89710                  	call	getchr
 26370 00001F51 EB06                    	jmp	short conflp
 26371                                  
 26372                                  getcom:
 26373 00001F53 E87B0E                          call    organize                ; organize the file
 26374 00001F56 E88F10                  	call	getchr
 26375                                  conflp: 
 26376 00001F59 72D2                    	jc	short endconv
 26377                                  
 26378 00001F5B FF06[2B03]                      inc     word [linecount]	; increase linecount
 26379                                  
 26380 00001F5F C606[1514]00            	mov	byte [multdeviceflag],0	; reset multdeviceflag.
 26381 00001F64 C606[1814]00            	mov	byte [setdevmarkflag],0	; reset setdevmarkflag.
 26382 00001F69 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 26383 00001F6B 7416                    	je	short blank_line	;  then ignore this line.
 26384                                  
 26385                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26386                                  %if 0
 26387                                  
 26388                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26389                                  
 26390                                  ;   If this is a genuine CONFIG.SYS command, then there should be a line
 26391                                  ;   number immediately following it....
 26392                                  
 26393                                          mov     [config_cmd],al         ; save original command code
 26394                                  	;and	al,NOT CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY
 26395                                  	and	al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; and al,7Fh
 26396                                          cmp     byte [config_multi],0	; is this a multi-config config.sys?
 26397                                          je      short not_final		; no, line number is not embedded
 26398                                  
 26399                                          push    ax                      ;
 26400                                          call    getchr                  ; ignore end-of-image errors,
 26401                                          mov     ah,al                   ; because if there's an error
 26402                                          call    getchr                  ; fetching the line number that's
 26403                                          xchg    al,ah                   ; supposed to be there, the next
 26404                                          mov     [linecount],ax          ; getchr call will get the same error
 26405                                          pop     ax
 26406                                  ;
 26407                                  ;   HACK: when 4DOS.COM is the shell and it doesn't have an environment from
 26408                                  ;   which to obtain its original program name, it grovels through all of
 26409                                  ;   memory to find the filename that was used to exec it; it wants to find
 26410                                  ;   the SHELL= line in the in-memory copy of CONFIG.SYS, and it knows that
 26411                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'
 26412                                  ;   immediately before the filename, but since we are now storing line # info
 26413                                  ;   in the config.sys memory image, 4DOS fails to find the 'S' in the right
 26414                                  ;   spot.
 26415                                  ;
 26416                                  ;   So, on the final pass of CONFIG.SYS, copy the command code (eg, 'S')
 26417                                  ;   over the line number info, since we no longer need that info anyway. This
 26418                                  ;   relies on the fact that getchr leaves ES:SI pointing to the last byte
 26419                                  ;   retrieved.
 26420                                  ;
 26421                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2	; final pass?
 26422                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26423                                          ;test	word [install_flag],have_install_cmd
 26424                                  	test	byte [install_flag],have_install_cmd ; 1
 26425                                          jz	short final		; no install cmds, so yes it is
 26426                                          cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],3	; final pass?
 26427                                          jb	short not_final		; no
 26428                                  final:                                  ;
 26429                                  	mov	[es:si],al		; save backward-compatible command code
 26430                                  not_final:                              ;
 26431                                  ;endif
 26432                                  
 26433                                  %endif
 26434 00001F6D 88C4                    	mov	ah,al
 26435 00001F6F E87610                  	call	getchr
 26436 00001F72 7314                    	jnc	short tryi
 26437                                  
 26438 00001F74 803E[4903]02            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],2
 26439                                  	;jae	short jae_endconv	; do not show badop again for multi_pass.
 26440                                  	; 27/10/2022
 26441 00001F79 73B2                    	jnb	short endconv	
 26442 00001F7B E9FB06                  	jmp	badop
 26443                                  	
 26444                                  coff:	
 26445                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26446                                  	; ds = cs
 26447                                  	;push	cs
 26448                                  	;pop	ds
 26449 00001F7E E85E10                  	call	newline
 26450 00001F81 EBD6                    	jmp	short conflp	; 13/05/2019
 26451                                  
 26452                                  blank_line:
 26453 00001F83 E86210                  	call	getchr
 26454 00001F86 EBD1                    	jmp	short conflp
 26455                                  
 26456                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26457                                  ; 11/12/2022
 26458                                  ; (there is not a jump or call to here from anywhere!)
 26459                                  ;coff_p:
 26460                                  	;push	cs
 26461                                  	;pop	ds
 26462                                  
 26463                                  ;to handle install= commands,we are going to use multi-pass.
 26464                                  ;the first pass handles the other commands and only set install_flag when
 26465                                  ;it finds any install command. the second pass will only handle the
 26466                                  ;install= command.
 26467                                  
 26468                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26469                                  ;install command
 26470                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 26471                                  
 26472                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26473                                  	; (SYSINIT:2250h)
 26474                                  tryi:
 26475 00001F88 803E[4903]00            	cmp	byte [multi_pass_id],0	; the initial pass for DOS=HI

 26486                                  					; we want do some config.sys process

 26488                                  					; and before install= commands
 26489                                  					; are processed

 26493 00001FA0 80FC48                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_DOS  ; 'H'
 26494                                  	; 11/12/2022
 26495                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff2

 26498                                  	;je	short multi_pass_coff

 26501                                  ;       but don't process them now.        
 26502

 26504                                  	;jne	short precheck_installhigh ; the first pass is for normal operation.

 26512

 26514                                  ;precheck_installhigh:
 26515                                  ;       cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH ; 'W' ; signifier for INSTALLHIGH
 26516                                  ;       jne     short tryb		; carry on with normal processing

 26519                                  ;       jmp	short coff
 26520                                  
 26521                                  multi_try_i:
 26522 00001FB1 80FC49                          cmp     ah, CONFIG_INSTALL ; 'I' ; install= command?
 26523                                  	;jne	short multi_try_n	; no, check for installhigh
 26524                                  	; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26525 00001FB4 7505                    	jne	short multi_pass_filter
 26526                                  
 26527                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26528                                  ;;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26529                                  ;       call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26530                                  ;       jc	short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26531                                  ;;endif
 26532                                  
 26533 00001FB6 E873F0                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26534 00001FB9 EBC3                    	jmp	short coff		;to handle next install= command.
 26535                                  
 26536                                  ; 27/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26537                                  %if 0
 26538                                  
 26539                                  multi_try_n:
 26540                                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_INSTALLHIGH   ; installhigh= command?
 26541                                          jne	short multi_pass_filter	; no. ignore this.
 26542                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 26543                                          call    query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 26544                                          jc      short multi_pass_filter	; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 26545                                  ;endif
 26546                                  
 26547                                  ;       The memory environment is in its normal DOS state, so do
 26548                                  ;       the standard calls to set the alloc strategy for loading high
 26549                                  
 26550                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|0 ; 5800h
 26551                                  	int	21h			;get alloc strategy
 26552                                  	mov	bx,ax
 26553                                          push    bx                      ; save for the return
 26554                                  
 26555                                          or	bx,HIGH_FIRST  ; 80h	;set alloc to HighFirst
 26556                                  	mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1 ; 5801h
 26557                                  	int	21h			;set alloc strategy
 26558                                  
 26559                                  	mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|2 ; 5802h
 26560                                          int     21h                     ; get link state
 26561                                          xor     ah,ah                   ; clear top byte
 26562                                          push    ax                      ; save for return
 26563                                  
 26564                                          mov	ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3 ; 5803h
 26565                                  	mov	bx,1
 26566                                  	int	21h			;link in UMBs
 26567                                  
 26568                                  	call	do_install_exec 	;install it.
 26569                                  
 26570                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|3
 26571                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original link state
 26572                                          int     21h
 26573                                          pop     bx                      ; recover original alloc strategy
 26574                                          mov     ax,(ALLOCOPER<<8)|1
 26575                                          int     21h
 26576                                  
 26577                                  	jmp	coff			;to handle next install= command.
 26578                                  
 26579                                  %endif
 26580                                  
 26581                                  multi_pass_filter:
 26582 00001FBB 80FC59                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_COMMENT ; 'Y' ; comment?
 26583 00001FBE 740A                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26584 00001FC0 80FC5A                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_UNKNOWN ; 'Z' ; bad command?
 26585 00001FC3 7405                    	je	short multi_pass_adjust
 26586 00001FC5 80FC30                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_REM  ; '0' 	; rem?

 26588                                  
 26589                                  multi_pass_adjust:			; these commands need to
 26590 00001FCA FF0E[D603]              	dec	word [chrptr]		;  adjust chrptr,count

 26601                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26602                                  ;									      *
 26603                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 26604                                  ;									      *
 26605                                  ; input :								      *
 26606                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 26607                                  ; output:								      *
 26608                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 26609                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 26610                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 26611                                  ;									      *
 26612                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 26613                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 26614                                  ; logic:								      *
 26615                                  ; {									      *
 26616                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 26617                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 26618                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 26619                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 26620                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 26621                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 26622                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 26623                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 26624                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 26625                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 26626                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 26627                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 26628                                  ;	};								      *
 26629                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 26630                                  ; };									      *
 26631                                  ;									      *
 26632                                  ;******************************************************************************
 26633                                  
 26634                                  	; 27/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 26635                                  	; (SYSINIT:229Ch)

 26637 00001FD4 80FC42                          cmp     ah,CONFIG_BUFFERS ; 'B'

 26643                                  ;       jc      short tryc		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set

 26670                                  	;cmp	word [result_val_swoff],switch_x

 26723                                  
 26724                                  ;****************************************************************************
 26725                                  ;									    *
 26726                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 26727                                  ;									    *
 26728                                  ; input :								    *
 26729                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 26730                                  ; output:								    *
 26731                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 26732                                  ;									    *
 26733                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 26734                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *

 26739                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 26740                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 26741                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 26742                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 26743                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 26744                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 26745                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 26746                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 26747                                  ;	};								    *

 26751                                  ;									    *

 26753

 26755                                  	; (SYSINIT:22FFh)

 26758 00002033 7534                    	jne	short trym

 26764                                  ;;endif

 26771 0000203D 7303                    	jnc	short if22		; parse error
 26772                                  	;call	badparm_p		;  show message and end the search loop.
 26773                                  	;;jmp	short sr22
 26774                                  	; 31/12/2022
 26775                                  ;sr22:

 26777                                  	; 04/01/2023

 28147                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28148                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 28149                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 28150                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 28151                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 28152                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 28153                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 28154                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 28155                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28156                                  
 28157                                  ;**************************************************************************
 28158                                  ;									  *
 28159                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 28160                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 28161                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 28162                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 28163                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 28164                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 28165                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 28166                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 28167                                  ; input :								  *
 28168                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 28169                                  ; output:								  *
 28170                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 28171                                  ;									  *
 28172                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 28173                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 28174                                  ; logic:								  *
 28175                                  ; {									  *
 28176                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 28177                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 28178                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 28179                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 28180                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 28181                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 28182                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28183                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 28184                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 28185                                  ;	     }								  *
 28186                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 28187                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 28188                                  ;	};								  *
 28189                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 28190                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 28191                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 28192                                  ; };									  *
 28193                                  ;**************************************************************************

 28877                                  ;	 procedure.

 29224                                  ;
 29225                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 29226                                  ;
 29227                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 29228                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 29229                                  ;
 29230                                  ;	Output : none
 29231                                  ;
 29232                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 29233                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 29234                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29235                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 29236                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 29237                                  ;
 29238                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29239                                  
 29240                                  LieInt12Mem:
 29241                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29242                                  	; ds = cs
 29243 000026FF A1[A302]                	mov	ax,[ALLOCLIM]
 29244                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:ALLOCLIM]	; lie INT 12 as alloclim
 29245                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 29246 00002702 E84400                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 29247 00002705 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 29248                                  	; 13/05/2019
 29249                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 29250                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 29251                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 29252                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29253                                  	; ds = cs
 29254 00002707 803E[851E]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 29255 0000270C 74F0                    	je	short limx
 29256 0000270E A1[6C1E]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 29257                                  lim_set:
 29258                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 29259                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29260                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 29261                                  ;limx:
 29262                                  	;retn
 29263                                  	
 29264                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 29265                                  
 29266                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29267                                  ;
 29268                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 29269                                  ;
 29270                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 29271                                  ;	Output : none
 29272                                  ;
 29273                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 29274                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 29275                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 29276                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 29277                                  ;
 29278                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29279                                  
 29280                                  	; 01/11/2022
 29281                                  SetInt12Mem:
 29282 00002711 1E                      	push	ds
 29283 00002712 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 29284 00002715 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 29285 00002717 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 29286 0000271B 2E891E[891E]            	mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 29287 00002720 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 29288 00002722 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 29289 00002724 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 29290 00002727 2EC606[881E]FF          	mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 29291 0000272D 1F                      	pop	ds
 29292                                  ;limx:
 29293 0000272E C3                      	retn
 29294                                  
 29295                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29296                                  ;
 29297                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 29298                                  ;
 29299                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 29300                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 29301                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 29302                                  ;
 29303                                  ;	Output : none
 29304                                  ;
 29305                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 29306                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 29307                                  ;
 29308                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29309                                  
 29310                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 29311                                  	; 11/12/2022
 29312                                  	; ds = cs
 29313 0000272F 803E[881E]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29314                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 29315                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 29316                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 29317 00002734 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 29318                                  	; 18/12/2022
 29319 00002736 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 29320 00002739 8826[881E]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 29321                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 29322                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 29323 0000273D 1E                      	push	ds
 29324                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 29325 0000273E 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 29326 00002740 2EA1[891E]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 29327 00002744 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 29328 00002747 1F                      	pop	ds
 29329                                  timx:
 29330 00002748 C3                      	retn

 29392                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29393                                  ;
 29394                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 29395                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 29396                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 29397                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 29398                                  ;
 29399                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 29400                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 29401                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 29402                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 29403                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 29404                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 29405                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 29406                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 29407                                  ; available during the load.
 29408                                  ;
 29409                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 29410                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 29411                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 29412                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 29413                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 29414                                  ; allocated.  After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 29415                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 29416                                  ;
 29417                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 29418                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 29419                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 29420                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 29421                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 29422                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 29423                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 29424                                  ;
 29425                                  ;******************************************************************************
 29426                                  
 29427                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 29428                                  
 29429                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 29430                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 29431                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 29432                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 29433                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 29434                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 29435                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 29436                                  
 29437                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 29438                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 29439                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 29440                                  
 29441                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29442                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 29443                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29444                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 29445                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 29446                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 29447                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29448                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29449                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1.  Its contents
 29450                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 29451                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29452                                  
 29453                                  InitVar:
 29454                                  	;pushreg <ax, cx, di, es>
 29455                                  	push	ax
 29456                                  	push	cx
 29457                                  	push	di
 29458                                  	push	es
 29459                                  
 29460                                  	;dataseg es			;Point ES into appropriate data segment
 29461                                  	push	cs
 29462                                  	pop	es
 29463                                  
 29464                                  	xor	ax,ax
 29465                                  	mov	[es:fUmbTiny],al	;Shrink UMBs? (made 1 if /S given)
 29466                                  	mov	[es:fInHigh],al		;Set to 1 when DH/LH has been called
 29467                                  	mov	[es:SegLoad],ax		;Load Address (seg), used for DH only
 29468                                  	mov	byte [es:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; 0FFh
 29469                                  					;Later is the # of the 1st spec'd UMB
 29470                                  	mov	[es:fm_argc], al	;Start with zero args having been read
 29471                                  
 29472                                  	cld
 29473                                  
 29474                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;For each entry
 29475                                  	mov	di,UmbUsed		;on the UmbUsed array,
 29476                                  	rep	stosb			;	Store 0
 29477                                  
 29478                                  	mov	cx,MAXUMB ; 16		;Okay... for each entry
 29479                                  	mov	di,UmbSize		;on the UmbSize array,
 29480                                  	rep	stosw			;	Store 0
 29481                                  
 29482                                  	;normseg es			; Return ES
 29483                                  
 29484                                  	;popreg	<es, di, cx, ax>
 29485                                  	pop	es
 29486                                  	pop	di
 29487                                  	pop	cx
 29488                                  	pop	ax	 	
 29489                                  
 29490                                  	retn
 29491                                  
 29492                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29493                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 29494                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29495                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 29496                                  ; EXIT    : None
 29497                                  ; ERROR   : None
 29498                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 29499                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29500                                  
 29501                                  FixMem:
 29502                                  	push	ax
 29503                                  	push	bx
 29504                                  	push	cx
 29505                                  	push	dx
 29506                                  	push	es
 29507                                  
 29508                                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 29509                                  
 29510                                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 29511                                  	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 29512                                  
 29513                                  	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 29514                                  
 29515                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 29516                                  
 29517                                  	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 29518                                  	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 29519                                  	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 29520                                  
 29521                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29522                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 29523                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 29524                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29525                                  
 29526                                  fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 29527                                  	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 29528                                  	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 29529                                  	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 29530                                  
 29531                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 29532                                  
 29533                                  fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 29534                                  	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 29535                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 29536                                  
 29537                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 29538                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 29539                                  	; 14/08/2023
 29540                                  	inc	bx
 29541                                  	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 29542                                  
 29543                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 29544                                  
 29545                                  fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 29546                                  	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 29547                                  
 29548                                  	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 29549                                  	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 29550                                  	inc	bx
 29551                                  	mov	es,bx
 29552                                  
 29553                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 29554                                  	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 29555                                  	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 29556                                  fmX:	
 29557                                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 29558                                  
 29559                                  	pop	es
 29560                                  	pop	dx
 29561                                  	pop	cx
 29562                                  	pop	bx
 29563                                  	pop	ax
 29564                                  
 29565                                  	retn
 29566                                  
 29567                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29568                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 29569                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29570                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 29571                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 29572                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29573                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 29574                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29575                                  
 29576                                  fm_link:
 29577                                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 29578                                  	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 29579                                  
 29580                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 29581                                  	;
 29582                                  	;push	es
 29583                                  	;push	cs
 29584                                  	;pop	es
 29585                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 29586                                  	;pop	es
 29587                                  	
 29588                                  	mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 29589                                  
 29590                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29591                                  	mov	bx,1
 29592                                  	int	21h
 29593                                  	retn
 29594                                  
 29595                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29596                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 29597                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29598                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 29599                                  ; EXIT:     None
 29600                                  ; ERROR:    None
 29601                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 29602                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29603                                  
 29604                                  fm_unlink:
 29605                                  	xor	bx,bx
 29606                                  	
 29607                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 29608                                  	;
 29609                                  	;push	ds
 29610                                  	;push	cs
 29611                                  	;pop	ds
 29612                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 29613                                  	;pop	ds
 29614                                  	
 29615                                  	mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 29616                                  
 29617                                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 29618                                  	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 29619                                  	retn
 29620                                  
 29621                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29622                                  
 29623                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29624                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 29625                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 29626                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29627                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 29628                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 29629                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 29630                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 29631                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29632                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 29633                                  ;
 29634                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 29635                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 29636                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29637                                  ;
 29638                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 29639                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 29640                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 29641                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 29642                                  ;
 29643                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 29644                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 29645                                  ;
 29646                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29647                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 29648                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 29649                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 29650                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 29651                                  ;     lh
 29652                                  ;     /l
 29653                                  ;     1
 29654                                  ;     1000
 29655                                  ;     2
 29656                                  ;     print
 29657                                  ;     /d
 29658                                  ;     :lpt2
 29659                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 29660                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 29661                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 29662                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 29663                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 29664                                  ; for:
 29665                                  ;    Each /L
 29666                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 29667                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 29668                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 29669                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 29670                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 29671                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29672                                  
 29673                                  ParseVar:
 29674                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 29675                                  	push	di
 29676                                  	push	ds
 29677                                  	push	es
 29678                                  
 29679                                  	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 29680                                  	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 29681                                  	cld
 29682                                  
 29683                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29684                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 29685                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 29686                                  
 29687                                  pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 29688                                  	call	isWhite
 29689                                  	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 29690                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 29691                                  	cmp	al,SWTCH
 29692                                  	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 29693                                  
 29694                                  	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 29695                                  	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 29696                                  	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 29697                                  
 29698                                  pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 29699                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 29700                                  	and	al,0DFh
 29701                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 29702                                  	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 29703                                  	jne	short pv30
 29704                                  
 29705                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29706                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29707                                  
 29708                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 29709                                  	;
 29710                                  	;push	es
 29711                                  	;push	cs
 29712                                  	;pop	es
 29713                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 29714                                  	;pop	es
 29715                                  
 29716                                  	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 29717                                  
 29718                                  	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 29719                                  
 29720                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 29721                                  	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 29722                                  	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 29723                                  
 29724                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 29725                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 29726                                  
 29727                                  	call	parseL
 29728                                  	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 29729                                  
 29730                                  	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 29731                                  	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 29732                                  
 29733                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 29734                                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 29735                                  pvErr:	dec	si
 29736                                  	dec	si
 29737                                  	stc
 29738                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 29739                                  	pop	es
 29740                                  	pop	ds
 29741                                  	pop	di
 29742                                  	retn
 29743                                  
 29744                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29745                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 29746                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29747                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 29748                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 29749                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 29750                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 29751                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29752                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 29753                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 29754                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 29755                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 29756                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 29757                                  
 29758                                  parseL:
 29759                                  	lodsb
 29760                                  	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 29761                                  	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 29762                                  
 29763                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29764                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 29765                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 29766                                  
 29767                                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 29768                                  	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 29769                                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 29770                                  
 29771                                  	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 29772                                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 29773                                  	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 29774                                  
 29775                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 29776                                  	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29777                                  
 29778                                  	lodsb
 29779                                  	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 29780                                  	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 29781                                  
 29782                                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 29783                                  	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 29784                                  
 29785                                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 29786                                  	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 29787                                  
 29788                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
